 20992                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 20993                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 20994                                  ;
 20995                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 20996                                  ;
 20997                                  ; Inputs:
 20998                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 20999                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21000                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 21001                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 21002                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 21003                                  ; Function:
 21004                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 21005                                  ; Outputs:
 21006                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 21007                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 21008                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 21009                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 21010                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 21011                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 21012                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21013                                  
 21014                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 21015                                  
 21016                                  DIRREAD:
 21017                                  
 21018                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 21019                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 21020                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 21021                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 21022                                  
 21023 000036F5 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 21024 000036F7 833E[C205]00            	CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 21025 000036FC 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 21026 000036FE 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 21027 000036FF EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 21028                                  
 21029                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 21030                                  
 21031                                  SubDir:
 21032 00003701 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 21033                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 21034 00003703 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 21035                                  
 21036                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 21037                                  
 21038                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 21039 00003707 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 21040 0000370B D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 21041                                  
 21042                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 21043                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 21044                                  
 21045                                  DoRead:
 21046 0000370D 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 21047 00003711 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 21048 00003713 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 21049                                  
 21050                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 21051                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 21052                                  
 21053                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21054                                  
 21055                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21056 00003715 8B16[C005]              	MOV	DX,[DIRSEC+2]	     	  ;>32mb
 21057 00003719 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	  ;>32mb
 21058 0000371D 8B16[BE05]              	MOV	DX,[DIRSEC]
 21059 00003721 00E2                    	ADD	DL,AH
 21060 00003723 80D600                  	ADC	DH,0
 21061 00003726 8316[0706]00            	ADC	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	  ;>32mb
 21062                                  
 21063 0000372B 8B1E[BC05]              	MOV	BX,[CLUSNUM]
 21064 0000372F 891E[DC05]              	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 21065 00003733 E319                    	JCXZ	FIRSTCLUSTER
 21066                                  SKPCLLP:
 21067 00003735 E8DB1E                  	call	UNPACK
 21068 00003738 72BA                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 21069 0000373A 87DF                    	XCHG	BX,DI
 21070 0000373C E8BD1E                  	call	IsEOF			; test for eof based on fat size
 21071 0000373F 7302                    	JAE	short HAVESKIPPED
 21072 00003741 E2F2                    	LOOP	SKPCLLP
 21073                                  HAVESKIPPED:
 21074 00003743 891E[DC05]              	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 21075 00003747 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI
 21076 00003749 88E3                    	MOV	BL,AH
 21077 0000374B E86917                  	call	FIGREC
 21078                                  
 21079                                  	;entry	FIRSTCLUSTER
 21080                                  
 21081                                  FIRSTCLUSTER:
 21082                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 21083 0000374E C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 21084 00003753 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Indicate pre-read
 21085 00003755 E8DD22                  	call	GETBUFFR
 21086 00003758 729A                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 21087                                  
 21088                                  	;entry	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 21089                                  
 21090                                  SET_BUF_AS_DIR:
 21091                                  
 21092                                  ;	Set the type of CURBUF to be a directory sector.
 21093                                  ;	Only flags are modified.
 21094                                  
 21095 0000375A 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 21096 0000375B 56                      	PUSH	SI
 21097 0000375C C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 21098                                  	;or	byte [si+5],4
 21099 00003760 804C0504                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_isDIR	; Clears carry
 21100 00003764 5E                      	POP	SI
 21101 00003765 1F                      	POP	DS
 21102                                  dirread_retn:
 21103 00003766 C3                      	retn

 21105                                  ;Break	<FATSECRD -- READ A FAT SECTOR>
 21106                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21107                                  ;
 21108                                  ; Procedure Name : FATSECRD
 21109                                  ; Inputs:
 21110                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 21111                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 21112                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 21113                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number
 21114                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21115                                  ; Function:
 21116                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform FAT read.
 21117                                  ; Outputs:
 21118                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 21119                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21120                                  
 21121                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21122                                  	; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)	
 21123                                  
 21124                                  FATSECRD:
 21125                                  ;hkn; SS override
 21126                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 21127 00003767 36C606[4B03]18          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 21128 0000376D 89CF                    	MOV	DI,CX
 21129                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+8]
 21130 0000376F 268A4E08                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_COUNT]
 21131                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 21132                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0Fh]
 21133                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE] 				
 21134                                  	;XOR	AH,AH
 21135                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21136                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Fh]
 21137 00003773 268B460F                	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE] ;>32mb
 21138 00003777 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH	
 21139 00003779 52                      	PUSH	DX
 21140                                  NXTFAT:
 21141                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21142                                  ;hkn; SS override

 21165                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 21166                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)

 21297                                  ;	TITLE	DISK2 - Disk utility routines
 21298                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 21299                                  
 21300                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 21301                                  ;
 21302                                  ;	DskRead
 21303                                  ;	DWRITE
 21304                                  ;	DSKWRITE
 21305                                  ;	HarderrRW
 21306                                  ;	SETUP
 21307                                  ;	BREAKDOWN
 21308                                  ;	READ_LOCK_VIOLATION

 21310                                  ;	DISKREAD
 21311                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 21312                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR
 21313                                  ;	SETSFT
 21314                                  ;	SETCLUS
 21315                                  ;	AddRec
 21316                                  ;
 21317                                  ;	Revision history:
 21318                                  ;
 21319                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 21320                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 21321                                  
 21322                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21323                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 21324                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21325                                  ; DOSCODE:7685h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21326                                  
 21327                                  ;Break	<DSKREAD -- PHYSICAL DISK READ>
 21328                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21329                                  ;
 21330                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKREAD
 21331                                  ;
 21332                                  ; Inputs:
 21333                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 21334                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 21335                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 21336                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 21337                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21338                                  ; Function:
 21339                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 21340                                  ; Outputs:
 21341                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 21342                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 21343                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 21344                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 21345                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 21346                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 21347                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21348                                  
 21349                                  DSKREAD:
 21350 000037E3 51                      	PUSH	CX
 21351                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 21352 000037E4 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 21353                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 21354 000037E8 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 21355 000037EC 53                      	PUSH	BX
 21356 000037ED 06                      	PUSH	ES
 21357 000037EE E8A00F                  	call	SETREAD
 21358 000037F1 EB27                    	JMP	short DODSKOP
 21359                                  
 21360                                  ;Break	<DWRITE -- SEE ABOUT WRITING>
 21361                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21362                                  ;
 21363                                  ; Procedure Name : DWRITE
 21364                                  ;
 21365                                  ; Inputs:
 21366                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 21367                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 21368                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 21369                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 21370                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21371                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case HARDERR called
 21372                                  ; Function:
 21373                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk write. If BIOS reports
 21374                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 21375                                  ; Output:
 21376                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently, user FAILed to I 24)
 21377                                  ; BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 21378                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21379                                  
 21380                                  	;entry	DWRITE
 21381                                  DWRITE:
 21382 000037F3 E81600                  	CALL	DSKWRITE
 21383 000037F6 7413                    	jz	short dw_ret_label	; Carry clear (retz)
 21384                                  
 21385                                  ;hkn; SS override
 21386 000037F8 36C606[7505]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],1
 21387 000037FE E83A00                  	call	HARDERRRW
 21388 00003801 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1		; Check for retry
 21389 00003803 74EE                    	JZ	short DWRITE
 21390 00003805 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3		; Check for FAIL
 21391 00003807 F8                      	CLC
 21392 00003808 7501                    	JNZ	short NO_CAR2 	; Ignore
 21393 0000380A F9                      	STC
 21394                                  NO_CAR2:
 21395                                  dw_ret_label:
 21396 0000380B C3                      	retn
 21397                                  
 21398                                  ;Break	<DSKWRITE -- PHYSICAL DISK WRITE>
 21399                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21400                                  ;
 21401                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKWRITE
 21402                                  ;
 21403                                  ; Inputs:
 21404                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 21405                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 21406                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 21407                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 21408                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21409                                  ; Function:
 21410                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 21411                                  ; Outputs:
 21412                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 21413                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 21414                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 21415                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 21416                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 21417                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 21418                                  ;
 21419                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21420                                  
 21421                                  	;entry	DSKWRITE
 21422                                  DSKWRITE:
 21423 0000380C 51                      	PUSH	CX
 21424                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 21425 0000380D 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 21426                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 21427 00003811 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 21428 00003815 53                      	PUSH	BX
 21429 00003816 06                      	PUSH	ES
 21430 00003817 E8AA0F                  	call	SETWRITE
 21431                                  DODSKOP:
 21432 0000381A 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS		; Save DS
 21433 0000381C 1F                      	POP	DS		; DS:BP points to DPB
 21434 0000381D 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 21435

 21454                                  	;test	ah,80h

 21456                                  	;test	AX,STERR
 21457 0000383A C3                      	retn

 21459                                  ;Break	<HardErrRW - map extended errors and call harderr>
 21460                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21461                                  ;
 21462                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErrRW
 21463                                  ;
 21464                                  ; Inputs:
 21465                                  ;	AX is error code from read or write
 21466                                  ;	Other registers set as per HARDERR
 21467                                  ; Function:
 21468                                  ;	Checks the error code for special extended
 21469                                  ;	errors and maps them if needed. Then invokes
 21470                                  ;	Harderr
 21471                                  ; Outputs:
 21472                                  ;	Of HARDERR
 21473                                  ; AX may be modified prior to call to HARDERR.
 21474                                  ; No other registers altered.
 21475                                  ;
 21476                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 21499 00003850 58                      	pop	ax
 21500                                  DO_ERR:
 21501                                  	;;call	HARDERR

 21511                                  
 21512                                  ;Break	<SETUP -- SETUP A DISK READ OR WRITE FROM USER>
 21513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21514                                  ;
 21515                                  ; Procedure Name : SETUP
 21516                                  ;
 21517                                  ; Inputs:
 21518                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT (value also in THISSFT)
 21519                                  ;	DMAAdd contains transfer address
 21520                                  ;	CX = Byte count
 21521                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 21522                                  ;   WARNING Stack must be clean, two ret addrs on stack, 1st of caller,
 21523                                  ;		2nd of caller of caller.
 21524                                  ; Outputs:
 21525                                  ;	    CX = byte count
 21526                                  ;	    [THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters if file
 21527                                  ;		      = Pointer to device header if device or NET
 21528                                  ;	    ES:DI Points to SFT
 21529                                  ;	    [NEXTADD] = Displacement of disk transfer within segment
 21530                                  ;	    [TRANS] = 0 (No transfers yet)
 21531                                  ;	    BytPos = Byte position in file
 21532                                  ;
 21533                                  ;	The following fields are relevant to local files (not devices) only:
 21534                                  ;
 21535                                  ;	    SecPos = Position of first sector (local files only)
 21536                                  ;	    [BYTSECPOS] = Byte position in first sector (local files only)
 21537                                  ;	    [CLUSNUM] = First cluster (local files only)
 21538                                  ;	    [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector within first cluster (local files only)
 21539                                  ;	    [THISDRV] = Physical unit number (local files only)
 21540                                  ;
 21541                                  ;      RETURNS ONE LEVEL UP WITH:
 21542                                  ;	   CX = 0
 21543                                  ;	   CARRY = Clear
 21544                                  ;	IF AN ERROR IS DETECTED
 21545                                  ; All other registers destroyed
 21546                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21547                                  
 21548                                  ;hkn; called from disk.asm. DS has been set up to DOSDATA.
 21549                                  
 21550                                  ; DOSCODE:770Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 21551                                  
 21552                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21553                                  ; DOSCODE:76F7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21554                                  
 21555                                  SETUP:
 21556                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 411Bh
 21557                                  
 21558                                  	;lds 	si,[es:di+7]
 21559 00003854 26C57507                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 21560                                  
 21561                                  ;hkn; SS override
 21562 00003858 368C1E[8C05]            	MOV	[SS:THISDPB+2],DS
 21563                                  
 21564                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 21565 0000385D 16                      	push	ss
 21566 0000385E 1F                      	pop	ds
 21567                                  
 21568 0000385F 8936[8A05]              	MOV	[THISDPB],SI
 21569                                  
 21570 00003863 8B1E[2C03]              	MOV	BX,[DMAADD]
 21571 00003867 891E[B805]              	MOV	[NEXTADD],BX		;Set NEXTADD to start of Xaddr
 21572 0000386B C606[7405]00            	MOV	BYTE [TRANS],0		;No transferes
 21573                                  	;mov	ax,[es:di+15h]
 21574 00003870 268B4515                	MOV	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_position]
 21575                                  	;mov	dx,[es:di+17h]
 21576 00003874 268B5517                	MOV	DX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_position+2]
 21577 00003878 8916[D005]              	MOV	[BYTPOS+2],DX		;Set it
 21578 0000387C A3[CE05]                	MOV	[BYTPOS],AX
 21579                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8080h
 21580 0000387F 26F745058080            	TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet+devid_device
 21581 00003885 753C                    	JNZ	short NOSETSTUFF	;Following not done on devs or NET
 21582 00003887 06                      	PUSH	ES
 21583 00003888 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		;Point at the DPB
 21584                                  
 21585                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 21586                                  	;;mov	bl,[es:bp+0]
 21587                                  	;MOV	BL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 21588                                  	; 05/12/2022
 21589 0000388C 268A5E00                	mov	bl,[es:bp]
 21590                                  	
 21591 00003890 881E[7605]              	MOV	[THISDRV],BL		;Set THISDRV
 21592                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 21593 00003894 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 21594                                  
 21595                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 21596                                  	;cmp	dx,bx
 21597                                  	;jnb	short EOFERR
 21598                                  	;div	bx
 21599                                  	;mov	[SECPOS],ax
 21600                                  	;mov	[BYTSECPOS],dx
 21601                                  	;mov	dx,ax
 21602                                  	;;and	al,[es:bp+4]
 21603                                  	;AND	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 21604                                  	;mov	[SECCLUSPOS],al
 21605                                  	;mov	ax,cx
 21606                                  	;;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 21607                                  	;MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 21608                                  	;shr	dx,cl
 21609                                  	;mov	[CLUSNUM],dx
 21610                                  	;pop	es
 21611                                  	;mov	cx,ax
 21612                                  
 21613                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21614                                  
 21615                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21616                                  ;M039: Optimized this section.
 21617 00003898 51                              PUSH    CX			;SHR32 and DIV32 use CX.
 21618 00003899 E83E05                  	call	DIV32			;DX:AX/BX = CX:AX + DX (rem)
 21619 0000389C 8916[CC05]              	MOV	[BYTSECPOS],DX
 21620 000038A0 A3[C405]                	MOV	[SECPOS],AX
 21621 000038A3 890E[C605]              	MOV	[SECPOS+2],CX
 21622 000038A7 89CA                    	MOV	DX,CX
 21623                                  
 21624 000038A9 89C3                    	MOV	BX,AX
 21625                                  	;and	bl,[es:bp+4]
 21626 000038AB 26225E04                	AND	BL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 21627 000038AF 881E[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],BL
 21628                                  
 21629 000038B3 E84B05                  	call	SHR32			;(DX:AX SHR dpb_cluster_shift)
 21630 000038B6 59                      	POP	CX			;CX = byte count.
 21631 000038B7 751F                    	JNZ	short EOFERR		;cluster number above 64k
 21632                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:bp+0Dh]
 21633 000038B9 263B460D                	CMP	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ;>32mb  if > disk size ;AN000;
 21634 000038BD 7719                    	JA	short EOFERR		   ;>32mb  then EOF       ;AN000;
 21635                                  
 21636 000038BF A3[BC05]                	MOV	[CLUSNUM],AX
 21637 000038C2 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:DI point to SFT
 21638                                  ;M039
 21639                                  
 21640                                  NOSETSTUFF:
 21641 000038C3 89C8                    	MOV	AX,CX		; AX = Byte count.
 21642 000038C5 0306[2C03]              	ADD	AX,[DMAADD]	; See if it will fit in one segment

 21668                                  ;Break	<BREAKDOWN -- CUT A USER READ OR WRITE INTO PIECES>
 21669                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21670                                  ;
 21671                                  ; Procedure Name : BREAKDOWN
 21672                                  ;
 21673                                  ; Inputs:
 21674                                  ;	CX = Length of disk transfer in bytes
 21675                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 21676                                  ;	[BYTSECPOS] = Byte position within first sector
 21677                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 21678                                  ; Outputs:
 21679                                  ;	[BYTCNT1] = Bytes to transfer in first sector
 21680                                  ;	[SECCNT] = No. of whole sectors to transfer
 21681                                  ;	[BYTCNT2] = Bytes to transfer in last sector
 21682                                  ; AX, BX, DX destroyed. No other registers affected.
 21683                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21684                                  
 21685                                  BREAKDOWN:

 21687 000038E1 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX

 21690                                  	;sub	ax,[es:bp+2]

 21692 000038EB F7D8                    	NEG	AX		; Max number of bytes left in first sector
 21693 000038ED 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX		; Subtract from total length
 21694 000038EF 7304                    	JAE	short SAVFIR
 21695 000038F1 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX		; Don't use all of the rest of the sector
 21696 000038F3 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX		; And no bytes are left
 21697                                  SAVFIR:

 21699 000038F8 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 21700 000038FA 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 21701                                  	;div	word [ES:BP+2]
 21702 000038FC 26F77602                	DIV	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; How many whole sectors?
 21703 00003900 A3[D605]                	MOV	[SECCNT],AX
 21704 00003903 8916[D405]              	MOV	[BYTCNT2],DX	; Bytes remaining for last sector
 21705                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 21706                                  	;OR	DX,[BYTCNT1]	; SMR ONESECTORFIX BUGBUG

 21713                                  _RET45:

 22140 00003A38 C3                      	retn
 22141                                  
 22142                                  ; 25/07/2018
 22143                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 22144                                  ;Break   <DskRdBufScan -- Disk Read Buffer Scan>
 22145                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22146                                  ;
 22147                                  ; Procedure Name : DskRdBufScan
 22148                                  ;
 22149                                  ; Inputs:
 22150                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
 22151                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 22152                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 22153                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
 22154                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 22155                                  ;
 22156                                  ; Function:
 22157                                  ;	The Buffer Queue is scanned: the contents of any dirty buffers are
 22158                                  ;	"read" into the transfer memory block, so that the transfer memory
 22159                                  ;	reflects the most recent data.
 22160                                  ;
 22161                                  ; Outputs:
 22162                                  ;       Transfer memory updated as required.
 22163                                  ;
 22164                                  ; Uses:
 22165                                  ;       DS,AX,BX,CX,SI,DI destroyed.
 22166                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 22167                                  ;
 22168                                  ; Notes:
 22169                                  ;       FIRST_BUFF_ADDR is set-up to contain the LAST buffer to check, rather
 22170                                  ;	than the FIRST.
 22171                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22172                                  ;M039: Created
 22173                                  
 22174                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22175                                  ; DOSCODE:78F0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22176                                  
 22177                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22178                                  ; DOSCODE:78DCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 22179                                  
 22180                                  ;procedure DskRdBufScan,NEAR
 22181                                  ;
 22182                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 22183                                  
 22184                                  DskRdBufScan:
 22185 00003A39 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0 ; Any dirty buffers?
 22186 00003A3F 743C                    	je	short bufx		     ; -no, skip all work.
 22187                                  
 22188 00003A41 368B1E[0706]            	mov     bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 22189 00003A46 89DE                    	mov     si,bx
 22190 00003A48 01D1                    	add     cx,dx
 22191 00003A4A 83D600                  	adc     si,0
 22192                                  
 22193 00003A4D E8801F                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> 1st buf in queue.
 22194                                  	;mov	ax,[di+2]
 22195 00003A50 8B4502                  	mov     ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]
 22196 00003A53 36A3[BB0E]              	mov     [ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],ax
 22197                                  		
 22198                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 22199                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 22200                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 22201                                  	; 15/12/2022
 22202 00003A57 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 22203                                  
 22204                                  ;       BX:DX = Extent start.
 22205                                  ;       SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 22206                                  ;          AL = Drive #.
 22207                                  ;       DS:DI-> 1st buffer in queue.
 22208                                  ;[FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] = Address offset of last buffer in queue.
 22209                                  
 22210                                  bufq:	
 22211                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 22212 00003A5B 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 22213 00003A5E 7514                    	jne	short bufq1        	;  -no, jump.
 22214                                  
 22215                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 22216                                  ;       ja	short bufq1		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 22217                                  
 22218                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 22219 00003A60 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 22220 00003A63 7503                    	jne	short bufq01
 22221                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 22222 00003A65 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 22223                                  bufq01:
 22224 00003A68 770A                    	ja	short bufq1
 22225                                  
 22226                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 22227                                  ;       ja	short bufq2		;Jump if Extent end >= buffer sector.
 22228                                  
 22229                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 22230 00003A6A 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 22231 00003A6D 7503                    	jne	short bufq02
 22232                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 22233 00003A6F 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 22234                                  bufq02:
 22235 00003A72 770A                    	ja	short bufq2
 22236                                  bufq1:	
 22237 00003A74 363B3E[BB0E]            	cmp     di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 22238 00003A79 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 22239                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ; Set-up for next buffer.
 22240 00003A7B 75DE                    	jne	short bufq		; -no, do next buffer
 22241                                  bufx:
 22242 00003A7D C3                      	retn				;Exit.
 22243                                  
 22244                                  ;       Buffer's sector is in Extent: if it is dirty, copy its contents to
 22245                                  ;	transfer memory; otherwise, just re-position it in the buffer queue
 22246                                  ;       as MRU (Most Recently Used).
 22247                                  
 22248                                  bufq2:	
 22249 00003A7E 50                      	push	ax
 22250                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 22251 00003A7F F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 22252 00003A83 742F                    	jz	short bufq3                    ; -no, jump.
 22253                                  
 22254                                  ;       SaveReg <cx,dx,si,di,es>
 22255 00003A85 51                      	push	cx
 22256 00003A86 52                      	push	dx
 22257 00003A87 56                      	push	si
 22258 00003A88 57                      	push	di
 22259 00003A89 06                      	push	es
 22260                                  
 22261 00003A8A 89D0                    	mov     ax,dx
 22262                                  	;sub	ax,[di+6]
 22263 00003A8C 2B4506                  	sub	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 22264 00003A8F F7D8                    	neg	ax
 22265                                  
 22266                                  ;       AX = offset (in sectors) of buffer sector within Transfer memory
 22267                                  ;            block. (Note: the upper word of the sector # may be ignored
 22268                                  ;	     since no more than 64k bytes will ever be read. This 64k limit
 22269                                  ;            is imposed by the input parameters of the disk read operation.)
 22270                                  
 22271                                  	;lea	si,[di+20]
 22272 00003A91 8D7514                  	lea	si,[di+BUFINSIZ]	;DS:SI -> buffer data.
 22273                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+2]
 22274 00003A94 268B4E02                	mov     cx,[es:bp+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ;CX = sector size (in bytes).
 22275 00003A98 F7E1                    	mul     cx			;AX = offset (in bytes) of buf. sector
 22276 00003A9A 368B3E[0C06]            	mov     di,[ss:TEMP_VAR]
 22277 00003A9F 01C7                    	add	di,ax
 22278 00003AA1 368E06[0E06]            	mov	es,[ss:TEMP_VAR2]
 22279 00003AA6 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22280                                  
 22281                                  ;	   CX = sector size (in WORDs) ; CF=1 if odd # of bytes.
 22282                                  ;       DS:SI-> Buffer sector data.
 22283                                  ;       ES:DI-> Destination within Transfer memory block.
 22284                                  
 22285 00003AA8 F3A5                    	rep	movsw			;Copy buffer sector to Transfer memory
 22286                                  	;; 04/05/2019
 22287                                  	;;adc	cx,0                    ;CX=1 if odd # of bytes, else CX=0.
 22288                                  	;;rep	movsb                   ;Copy last byte.
 22289                                  	;jnc	short bufq03	
 22290                                  	;movsb
 22291                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compability)
 22292 00003AAA 83D100                  	adc	cx,0
 22293 00003AAD F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 22294                                  bufq03:
 22295                                  	;RestoreReg <es,di,si,dx,cx>
 22296 00003AAF 07                      	pop	es
 22297 00003AB0 5F                      	pop	di
 22298 00003AB1 5E                      	pop	si
 22299 00003AB2 5A                      	pop	dx
 22300 00003AB3 59                      	pop	cx
 22301                                  
 22302                                  ;       DS:DI -> current buffer.
 22303                                  bufq3:	
 22304 00003AB4 89F8                    	mov     ax,di			;DS:AX -> Current buffer.
 22305                                          ;invoke SCANPLACE
 22306 00003AB6 E8291F                  	call	SCANPLACE
 22307 00003AB9 363B06[BB0E]            	cmp	ax,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] ;Last buffer?
 22308 00003ABE 58                      	pop	ax
 22309                                  	;jne	short bufq		; -no, jump.
 22310                                  	;;jmp	short bufx		; -yes, exit.
 22311                                  	;; 12/06/2019
 22312                                  	;retn
 22313                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compability)
 22314 00003ABF 759A                    	jne	short bufq
 22315 00003AC1 EBBA                    	jmp	short bufx
 22316                                  
 22317                                  ;EndProc DskRdBufScan

 23009                                  ;Break   <DskWrtBufPurge -- Disk Write Buffer Purge>
 23010                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23011                                  ;
 23012                                  ; Procedure Name : DskWrtBufPurge
 23013                                  ;
 23014                                  ; Inputs:
 23015                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
 23016                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 23017                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 23018                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 23019                                  ;
 23020                                  ; Function:
 23021                                  ;       Purge the Buffer Queue and the Secondary Cache of any buffers which
 23022                                  ;	are in Extent; they are being over-written.
 23023                                  ;
 23024                                  ; Outputs:
 23025                                  ;       (Same as Input.)
 23026                                  ; Uses:
 23027                                  ;       All registers except DS,AX,SI,DI preserved.
 23028                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 23029                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23030                                  ;M039: Created
 23031                                  
 23032                                  ;procedure   DskWrtBufPurge,NEAR
 23033                                  ;
 23034                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 23035                                  
 23036                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23037                                  ; DOSCODE:7C0Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23038                                  
 23039                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23040                                  ; DOSCODE:7BD4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23041                                  
 23042                                  DskWrtBufPurge:
 23043                                  	;SaveReg <bx,cx>
 23044 00003D54 53                      	push	bx
 23045 00003D55 51                      	push	cx
 23046                                  
 23047 00003D56 368B1E[0706]            	mov	bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]	;BX:DX = Extent start (sector #).
 23048 00003D5B 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 23049 00003D5D 01D1                    	add	cx,dx
 23050 00003D5F 83D600                  	adc	si,0                    ;SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 23051                                  
 23052                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23053                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 23054                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 23055                                  	; 15/12/2022
 23056 00003D62 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 23057                                  
 23058                                  ;	BX:DX = Extent start.
 23059                                  ;	SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 23060                                  ;	AL = Drive #
 23061                                  
 23062 00003D66 36833E[7700]00          	cmp	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;Secondary cache in-use?
 23063 00003D6C 7431                    	je	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 23064                                  
 23065                                  ;	If any of the sectors to be written are in the secondary cache (SC),
 23066                                  ;	invalidate the entire SC. (This is an optimization; we really only
 23067                                  ;	need to invalidate those sectors which intersect, but that's slower.)
 23068                                  
 23069 00003D6E 363A06[B00D]            	cmp	al,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;Same drive?
 23070 00003D73 752A                    	jne	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 23071                                  
 23072 00003D75 50                      	push    ax
 23073 00003D76 36A1[B10D]              	mov     ax,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR]
 23074 00003D7A 368B3E[B30D]            	mov     di,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR+2]	;DI:AX = SC start.
 23075                                  
 23076                                  	;Cmp32	si,cx,di,ax		;Extent end < SC start?
 23077                                  	;jbe	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 23078                                  
 23079 00003D7F 39FE                    	cmp	si,di
 23080 00003D81 7502                    	jne	short sc01
 23081 00003D83 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 23082                                  sc01: 
 23083 00003D85 7617                    	jbe	short sc5	
 23084                                  
 23085 00003D87 360306[7700]            	add	ax,[ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT]
 23086 00003D8C 83D700                  	adc	di,0                    ;DI:AX = SC end + 1.
 23087                                  	
 23088                                  	;Cmp32	bx,dx,di,ax             ;Extent start > SC end?
 23089                                  	;jae	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 23090                                  
 23091 00003D8F 39FB                    	cmp	bx,di
 23092 00003D91 7502                    	jne	short sc02
 23093 00003D93 39C2                    	cmp	dx,ax
 23094                                  sc02:
 23095 00003D95 7307                    	jnb	short sc5
 23096                                  
 23097 00003D97 36C706[B50D]0000        	mov	word [ss:SC_STATUS],0	;Extent intersects SC: invalidate SC.
 23098                                  sc5:	
 23099 00003D9E 58                      	pop     ax
 23100                                  
 23101                                  ;	Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
 23102                                  ;	written.
 23103                                  
 23104                                  nosc:	
 23105 00003D9F E82E1C                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> first buffer in queue.
 23106                                  
 23107                                  _bufq:	
 23108                                  	;cmpo	al,[di+4]
 23109 00003DA2 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 23110 00003DA5 7527                    	jne	short bufq5		; -no, jump.
 23111                                  
 23112                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 23113                                  ;       ja	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 23114                                  
 23115                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 23116 00003DA7 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 23117 00003DAA 7503                    	jne	short bufq04
 23118                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 23119 00003DAC 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 23120                                  bufq04:
 23121 00003DAF 771D                    	ja	short bufq5
 23122                                  
 23123                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 23124                                  ;       jbe	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent end < buffer sector.
 23125                                  
 23126                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 23127 00003DB1 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 23128 00003DB4 7503                    	jne	short bufq05
 23129                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 23130 00003DB6 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 23131                                  bufq05:
 23132 00003DB9 7613                    	jbe	short bufq5
 23133                                  
 23134                                  ;	Buffer's sector is in Extent, so free it; it is being over-written.
 23135                                  
 23136                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 23137 00003DBB F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 23138 00003DBF 7403                    	jz	short bufq4		; -no, jump.
 23139 00003DC1 E87D1E                  	call	DEC_DIRTY_COUNT		; -yes, decrement dirty count.
 23140                                  bufq4:
 23141                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 23142 00003DC4 C74504FF20              	mov     word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],((buf_visit<<8)|0FFh)
 23143                                  
 23144 00003DC9 E8161C                  	call	SCANPLACE
 23145 00003DCC EB02                    	jmp     short bufq6
 23146                                  bufq5: 
 23147 00003DCE 8B3D                    	mov     di,[di]
 23148                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 23149                                  bufq6: 
 23150 00003DD0 363B3E[BB0E]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 23151 00003DD5 75CB                    	jne	short _bufq		; --no, go do next buffer.
 23152                                  	
 23153                                  	;RestoreReg <cx,bx>
 23154 00003DD7 59                      	pop	cx
 23155 00003DD8 5B                      	pop	bx
 23156 00003DD9 C3                      	retn
 23157                                  
 23158                                  ;EndProc DskWrtBufPurge
 23159                                  
 23160                                  ;Break   <DIV32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT DIVIDE>
 23161                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23162                                  ;
 23163                                  ; Procedure Name : DIV32
 23164                                  ;
 23165                                  ; Inputs:
 23166                                  ;       DX:AX = 32 bit dividend   BX= divisor
 23167                                  ; Function:
 23168                                  ;       Perform 32 bit division:  DX:AX/BX = CX:AX + DX (rem.)
 23169                                  ; Outputs:
 23170                                  ;       CX:AX = quotient , DX= remainder
 23171                                  ; Uses:
 23172                                  ;       All registers except AX,CX,DX preserved.
 23173                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23174                                  ;M039: DIV32 optimized for divisor of 512 (common sector size).
 23175                                  
 23176                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23177                                  ; DOSCODE:7C94h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23178                                  
 23179                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23180                                  ; DOSCODE:7C5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23181                                  
 23182                                  DIV32:
 23183 00003DDA 81FB0002                	cmp	bx,512
 23184 00003DDE 7515                    	jne	short div5
 23185                                  
 23186 00003DE0 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 23187 00003DE2 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax           ; CX:AX = Dividend
 23188 00003DE4 81E2FF01                	and	dx,(512-1)      ; DX = Remainder
 23189 00003DE8 88E0                    	mov	al,ah
 23190 00003DEA 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 23191 00003DEC 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 23192 00003DEE 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 23193 00003DF0 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 23194 00003DF2 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 23195 00003DF4 C3                      	retn
 23196                                  div5:	
 23197 00003DF5 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 23198 00003DF7 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 23199 00003DF9 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 23200 00003DFB F7F3                    	div	bx              ; 0:AX/BX
 23201 00003DFD 91                      	xchg	cx,ax
 23202 00003DFE F7F3                    	div	bx              ; DX:AX/BX
 23203 00003E00 C3                      	retn
 23204                                  
 23205                                  ;Break   <SHR32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT SHIFT RIGHT>
 23206                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23207                                  ;
 23208                                  ; Procedure Name : SHR32
 23209                                  ;
 23210                                  ; Inputs:
 23211                                  ;	DX:AX = 32 bit sector number
 23212                                  ; Function:
 23213                                  ;       Perform 32 bit shift right
 23214                                  ; Outputs:
 23215                                  ;	AX = cluster number
 23216                                  ;	ZF = 1 if no error
 23217                                  ;	   = 0 if error (cluster number > 64k)
 23218                                  ; Uses:
 23219                                  ;       DX,CX
 23220                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23221                                  ; M017	- SHR32 rewritten for better performance
 23222                                  ; M039	- Additional optimization
 23223                                  
 23224                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23225                                  ; DOSCODE:7CBBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23226                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23227                                  ; DOSCODE:7C81h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23228                                  
 23229                                  SHR32:
 23230                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 23231 00003E01 268A4E05                	mov	cl,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 23232 00003E05 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch	    ;ZF=1
 23233 00003E07 E306                    	jcxz	norota
 23234                                  
 23235                                  rotashft2:
 23236 00003E09 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1	    ;ZF reflects state of DX.
 23237 00003E0B D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1	    ;ZF not affected.
 23238 00003E0D E2FA                    	loop	rotashft2
 23239                                  norota:
 23240 00003E0F C3                      	retn
 23241                                  
 23242                                  ;============================================================================
 23243                                  ; DIR.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 23244                                  ;============================================================================
 23245                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23246                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 23247                                  
 23248                                  ;	TITLE	DIR - Directory and path cracking
 23249                                  ;	NAME	Dir
 23250                                  
 23251                                  ;Break	<FINDENTRY -- LOOK FOR AN ENTRY>
 23252                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23253                                  ;
 23254                                  ; Procedure Name : FINDENTRY,SEARCH
 23255                                  ;
 23256                                  ; Inputs:
 23257                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 23258                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 23259                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Starting directory sector number
 23260                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster of directory
 23261                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 23262                                  ;	[NAME1] = Name to look for
 23263                                  ; Function:
 23264                                  ;	Find file name in disk directory.
 23265                                  ;	"?" matches any character.
 23266                                  ; Outputs:
 23267                                  ;	Carry set if name not found
 23268                                  ;	ELSE
 23269                                  ;	Zero set if attributes match (always except when creating)
 23270                                  ;	AH = Device ID (bit 7 set if not disk)
 23271                                  ;	[THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters
 23272                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 23273                                  ;	ES = DOSGROUP
 23274                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer into directory buffer
 23275                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI = Pointer to First Cluster field in directory entry
 23276                                  ;	[CURBUF] has directory record with match
 23277                                  ;	[NAME1] has file name
 23278                                  ;	[LASTENT] is entry number of the entry
 23279                                  ; All other registers destroyed.
 23280                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23281                                  
 23282                                  ;hkn; called from rename.asm and dir2.asm. DS must be already set up at
 23283                                  ;hkn; this point.
 23284                                  
 23285                                  SEARCH:
 23286                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23287                                  	; DOSCODE:7C90h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23288                                  
 23289                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23290                                  	; DOSCODE:7CCA (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23291                                  
 23292                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23293                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 45B3h 
 23294                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 23295                                  
 23296                                  	;entry	FindEntry
 23297                                  FINDENTRY:
 23298 00003E10 E84804                  	call	STARTSRCH
 23299 00003E13 A0[6B05]                	MOV	AL,[ATTRIB]
 23300                                  	;and	al,9Eh
 23301 00003E16 24DE                    	AND	AL,~attr_ignore		; Ignore useless bits
 23302                                  	;cmp	al,8
 23303 00003E18 3C08                    	CMP	AL,attr_volume_id	; Looking for vol ID only ?
 23304 00003E1A 7503                    	JNZ	short NOTVOLSRCH	; No
 23305 00003E1C E87501                  	CALL	SETROOTSRCH		; Yes force search of root
 23306                                  NOTVOLSRCH:
 23307 00003E1F E80601                  	CALL	GETENTRY
 23308 00003E22 7303                    	JNC	short SRCH
 23309 00003E24 E99500                  	JMP	SETESRET
 23310                                  
 23311                                  	;entry	Srch
 23312                                  SRCH:
 23313 00003E27 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 23314 00003E28 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 23315                                  
 23316                                  ;	(DS:BX) = directory entry address
 23317                                  
 23318 00003E2C 8A27                    	mov	ah,[BX]
 23319                                  	;MOV	AH,[BX+dir_entry.dir_name] ; mov ah,[bx+0]
 23320 00003E2E 08E4                    	OR	AH,AH			; End of directory?
 23321 00003E30 743A                    	JZ	short FREE
 23322                                  
 23323                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23324 00003E32 363A26[7F05]            	CMP	AH,[SS:DELALL]		; Free entry?
 23325 00003E37 7433                    	JZ	short FREE
 23326                                  	;test	byte [bx+0Bh],8
 23327 00003E39 F6470B08                	TEST	byte [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_volume_id
 23328                                  					; Volume ID file?
 23329 00003E3D 7405                    	JZ	short CHKFNAM 		; NO
 23330                                  
 23331                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23332 00003E3F 36FE06[7B05]            	INC	BYTE [SS:VOLID]
 23333                                  CHKFNAM:
 23334                                  ;	Context ES
 23335 00003E44 8CD6                    	MOV	SI,SS
 23336 00003E46 8EC6                    	MOV	ES,SI
 23337 00003E48 89DE                    	MOV	SI,BX
 23338                                  
 23339                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 23340 00003E4A BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 23341                                  ;;;;; 7/29/86
 23342                                  
 23343                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 23344 00003E4D 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	BYTE [SS:NAME1],0E5H	; special char check
 23345 00003E53 7506                    	JNZ	short NO_E5
 23346 00003E55 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	BYTE [SS:NAME1],05H
 23347                                  NO_E5:
 23348                                  ;;;;; 7/29/86
 23349 00003E5B E86100                  	CALL	MetaCompare
 23350 00003E5E 7428                    	JZ	short FOUND
 23351 00003E60 1F                      	POP	DS
 23352                                  
 23353                                  	;entry	NEXTENT
 23354                                  NEXTENT:
 23355 00003E61 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 23356 00003E65 E86600                  	CALL	NEXTENTRY
 23357 00003E68 73BD                    	JNC	short SRCH
 23358 00003E6A EB50                    	JMP	SHORT SETESRET
 23359                                  
 23360                                  FREE:
 23361 00003E6C 1F                      	POP	DS
 23362 00003E6D 8B0E[4803]              	MOV	CX,[LASTENT]
 23363 00003E71 3B0E[D805]              	CMP	CX,[ENTFREE]
 23364 00003E75 7304                    	JAE	short TSTALL
 23365 00003E77 890E[D805]              	MOV	[ENTFREE],CX
 23366                                  TSTALL:
 23367 00003E7B 3A26[7F05]              	CMP	AH,[DELALL]		; At end of directory?
 23368                                  NEXTENTJ:
 23369 00003E7F 74E0                    	je	short NEXTENT 		; No - continue search
 23370 00003E81 890E[DA05]              	MOV	[ENTLAST],CX
 23371 00003E85 F9                      	STC
 23372 00003E86 EB34                    	JMP	SHORT SETESRET
 23373                                  
 23374                                  FOUND:
 23375                                  ; We have a file with a matching name. We must now consider the attributes:
 23376                                  ; ATTRIB	Action
 23377                                  ; ------	------
 23378                                  ; Volume_ID	Is Volume_ID in test?
 23379                                  ; Otherwise	If no create then Is ATTRIB+extra superset of test?
 23380                                  ;		If create then Is ATTRIB equal to test?
 23381                                  
 23382 00003E88 8A2C                    	MOV	CH,[SI] 		; Attributes of file
 23383 00003E8A 1F                      	POP	DS
 23384 00003E8B 8A26[6B05]              	MOV	AH,[ATTRIB]		; Attributes of search
 23385                                  	;and	ah,9Eh
 23386 00003E8F 80E4DE                  	AND	AH,~attr_ignore
 23387                                  	;lea	si,[si+15]
 23388 00003E92 8D740F                  	LEA	SI,[SI+dir_entry.dir_first-dir_entry.dir_attr]
 23389                                  					; point to first cluster field
 23390                                  	;test	ch,8
 23391 00003E95 F6C508                  	TEST	CH,attr_volume_id	; Volume ID file?
 23392 00003E98 7409                    	JZ	short check_one_volume_id ; Nope check other attributes
 23393                                  	;test	ah,8
 23394 00003E9A F6C408                  	TEST	AH,attr_volume_id	; Can we find Volume ID?
 23395                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Nope, (not even $FCB_CREATE)
 23396                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23397 00003E9D 74C2                    	jz	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 23398                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23399                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 23400 00003E9F 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Set zero flag for $FCB_CREATE
 23401 00003EA1 EB11                    	JMP	SHORT RETFF		; Found Volume ID
 23402                                  check_one_volume_id:
 23403                                  	;CMP	ah,8
 23404 00003EA3 80FC08                  	CMP	AH,attr_volume_id	; Looking only for Volume ID?
 23405                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Yes, continue search
 23406                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23407 00003EA6 74B9                    	je	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 23408                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 23409 00003EA8 E8C403                  	CALL	MatchAttributes
 23410 00003EAB 7407                    	JZ	SHORT RETFF
 23411 00003EAD F606[7E05]FF            	TEST	BYTE [CREATING],-1	; Pass back mismatch if creating
 23412                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23413                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Otherwise continue searching
 23414 00003EB2 74AD                    	jz	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 23415                                  RETFF:
 23416 00003EB4 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 23417                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23418                                  	;MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]  ; mov ah,[es:bp+0]
 23419                                  	; 15/12/2022
 23420 00003EB8 268A6600                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP]
 23421                                  SETESRET:
 23422 00003EBC 16                      	PUSH	SS
 23423 00003EBD 07                      	POP	ES
 23424 00003EBE C3                      	retn
 23425                                  
 23426                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23427                                  ;
 23428                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 23429                                  ;
 23430                                  ; Inputs:
 23431                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 23432                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry.  It MUST be in upper case
 23433                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 23434                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT.  It MUST be in upper case
 23435                                  ; Function:
 23436                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 23437                                  ; Outputs:
 23438                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 23439                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 23440                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23441                                  
 23442                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23443                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23444                                  
 23445                                  MetaCompare:
 23446 00003EBF B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 23447                                  WILDCRD:
 23448 00003EC2 F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 23449 00003EC4 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 23450                                  CHECK_META:
 23451 00003EC6 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 23452 00003ECB 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 23453                                  MetaRet:
 23454 00003ECD C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match
 23455                                  
 23456                                  ;Break	<NEXTENTRY -- STEP THROUGH DIRECTORY>
 23457                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23458                                  ;
 23459                                  ; Procedure Name : NEXTENTRY
 23460                                  ;
 23461                                  ; Inputs:
 23462                                  ;	Same as outputs of GETENTRY, above
 23463                                  ; Function:
 23464                                  ;	Update BX, and [LASTENT] for next directory entry.
 23465                                  ;	Carry set if no more.
 23466                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23467                                  
 23468                                  NEXTENTRY:
 23469                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23470                                  	; DOSCODE:7D4Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 23471                                  
 23472                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23473                                  	; DOSCODE:7D88h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23474                                  
 23475                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23476                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 4671h 
 23477                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 23478                                  
 23479 00003ECE A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 23480 00003ED1 3B06[DA05]              	CMP	AX,[ENTLAST]
 23481 00003ED5 7422                    	JZ	short NONE
 23482 00003ED7 40                      	INC	AX
 23483                                  	;ADD	BX,32
 23484 00003ED8 8D5F20                  	LEA	BX,[BX+32]
 23485 00003EDB 39D3                    	CMP	BX,DX
 23486                                  	; 21/11/2022 - MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS (DOSCODE:7D5Dh)
 23487                                  	;JB	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.0 src (dir.asm)
 23488                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23489 00003EDD 751C                    	jne	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:7D97h)
 23490 00003EDF 8A1E[7305]              	MOV	BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 23491 00003EE3 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 23492 00003EE5 3A1E[7705]              	CMP	BL,[CLUSFAC]
 23493 00003EE9 7215                    	JB	short SAMECLUS
 23494 00003EEB 8B1E[DC05]              	MOV	BX,[NXTCLUSNUM]
 23495 00003EEF E80A17                  	call	IsEOF
 23496 00003EF2 7305                    	JAE	short NONE
 23497                                  	; 23/07/2019
 23498 00003EF4 83FB02                  	CMP	BX,2
 23499                                  	;JB	short NONE
 23500                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 23501                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23502 00003EF7 7332                    	jnb	short GETENT
 23503                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23504                                  	;JB	short NONE
 23505                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 23506                                  NONE:
 23507 00003EF9 F9                      	STC
 23508 00003EFA C3                      	retn
 23509                                  HAVIT:
 23510 00003EFB A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 23511 00003EFE F8                      	CLC
 23512                                  nextentry_retn:
 23513 00003EFF C3                      	retn
 23514                                  SAMECLUS:
 23515 00003F00 881E[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],BL
 23516 00003F04 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 23517 00003F07 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 23518 00003F08 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 23519                                  	; 19/05/2019
 23520                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23521                                  	;mov	dx,[di+8]
 23522 00003F0C 8B5508                  	MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	;AN000; >32mb
 23523                                  ;hkn; SS override
 23524 00003F0F 368916[0706]            	MOV	[SS:HIGH_SECTOR],DX 		;AN000; >32mb
 23525                                  	;mov	dx,[di+6]
 23526 00003F14 8B5506                  	MOV	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]	;AN000; >32mb
 23527                                  	;inc	dx ; MSDOS 3.3
 23528                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23529 00003F17 83C201                  	ADD	DX,1				;AN000; >32mb
 23530 00003F1A 368316[0706]00          	ADC	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0 	;AN000; >32mb
 23531                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 23532 00003F20 1F                      	POP	DS
 23533 00003F21 E82AF8                  	call	FIRSTCLUSTER
 23534 00003F24 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX
 23535 00003F26 EB23                    	JMP	short SETENTRY
 23536                                  
 23537                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23538                                  ;
 23539                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 23540                                  ;
 23541                                  ; Inputs:
 23542                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 23543                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 23544                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 23545                                  ; Function:
 23546                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 23547                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 23548                                  ; Outputs:
 23549                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 23550                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 23551                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 23552                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 23553                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 23554                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23555                                  
 23556                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23557                                  GETENTRY:
 23558                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23559 00003F28 A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 23560                                  
 23561                                  	;entry	GETENT
