 23562                                  GETENT:
 23563 00003F2B A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 23564                                  ;
 23565                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 23566                                  ; directory.
 23567                                  ;
 23568 00003F2E B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 23569 00003F30 D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 23570 00003F32 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 23571                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23572                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 23573                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23574                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 23575                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23576 00003F34 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 23577 00003F36 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 23578                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 23579                                  ;
 23580                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 23581                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 23582                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 23583                                  ;
 23584                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 23585 00003F39 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 23586 00003F3D 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 23587                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 23588 00003F40 F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 23589 00003F42 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 23590 00003F44 53                      	PUSH	BX
 23591 00003F45 E8ADF7                  	call	DIRREAD
 23592 00003F48 5B                      	POP	BX
 23593                                  	;retc
 23594 00003F49 72B4                    	jc	short nextentry_retn	
 23595                                  SETENTRY:
 23596 00003F4B 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 23597                                  	;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 23598                                  	;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 23599 00003F4F 83C214                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 23600 00003F52 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 23601                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 23602 00003F54 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 23603 00003F58 C3                      	retn
 23604                                  
 23605                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 23606                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23607                                  ;
 23608                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 23609                                  ;
 23610                                  ; Inputs:
 23611                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 23612                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 23613                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 23614                                  ; Function:
 23615                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 23616                                  ; Outputs:
 23617                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 23618                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 23619                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 23620                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 23621                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23622                                  
 23623                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23624                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 23625 00003F59 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX
 23626 00003F5B 7437                    	JZ	short SETROOTSRCH
 23627 00003F5D 891E[C205]              	MOV	[DIRSTART],BX
 23628                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 23629 00003F61 268A4604                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 23630 00003F65 FEC0                    	INC	AL
 23631 00003F67 A2[7705]                	MOV	[CLUSFAC],AL
 23632                                  
 23633                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 23634                                  	;SAVE	<SI>
 23635 00003F6A 56                      	push	si
 23636                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 23637 00003F6B F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 23638 00003F70 7507                    	JNZ	short UNP_OK
 23639                                  
 23640                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 23641                                  	;invoke	UNPACK
 23642 00003F72 E89E16                  	call	UNPACK
 23643 00003F75 7302                    	JNC	short UNP_OK
 23644                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 23645 00003F77 5E                      	pop	si
 23646                                  	;return
 23647 00003F78 C3                      	retn
 23648                                  
 23649                                  UNP_OK:
 23650 00003F79 893E[BC05]              	MOV	[CLUSNUM],DI
 23651 00003F7D 89DA                    	MOV	DX,BX
 23652 00003F7F 30DB                    	XOR	BL,BL
 23653 00003F81 881E[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],BL
 23654                                  	;invoke	FIGREC
 23655 00003F85 E82F0F                  	call	FIGREC
 23656                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 23657 00003F88 5E                      	pop	si
 23658                                  	
 23659                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23660                                  
 23661                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23662                                  	;PUSH	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 23663                                  	;MOV	DX,[HIGH_SECTOR]	   ;AN000; >32mb
 23664                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC+2],DX		   ;AN000; >32mb
 23665                                  	;POP	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 23666                                  
 23667                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23668                                  	;push	dx
 23669                                  	;mov	dx,[HIGH_SECTOR]
 23670                                  	;mov	[DIRSEC+2],dx
 23671                                  	;pop	dx
 23672                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC],dx
 23673                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23674 00003F89 A1[0706]                	mov	ax,[HIGH_SECTOR]
 23675 00003F8C A3[C005]                	mov	[DIRSEC+2],AX
 23676 00003F8F 8916[BE05]              	MOV	[DIRSEC],DX
 23677                                  
 23678                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23679                                  	; cf=0 (at the return of FIGREC)
 23680                                  	;CLC
 23681 00003F93 C3                      	retn
 23682                                  
 23683                                  	;entry	SETROOTSRCH
 23684                                  SETROOTSRCH:
 23685 00003F94 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 23686 00003F96 A3[C205]                	MOV	[DIRSTART],AX
 23687 00003F99 A2[7305]                	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],AL
 23688 00003F9C 48                      	DEC	AX
 23689 00003F9D A3[BC05]                	MOV	[CLUSNUM],AX
 23690                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+0Bh]
 23691 00003FA0 268B460B                	MOV	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 23692                                  	; 19/05/2019
 23693                                  	;;mov	dx,[es:bp+10h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 23694                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+11h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 23695 00003FA4 268B5611                	MOV	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.DIR_SECTOR]
 23696 00003FA8 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 23697 00003FAA A2[7705]                	MOV	[CLUSFAC],AL
 23698 00003FAD 8916[BE05]              	MOV	[DIRSEC],DX		      ;F.C. >32mb
 23699                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23700 00003FB1 C706[C005]0000          	MOV	WORD [DIRSEC+2],0	      ;F.C. >32mb
 23701 00003FB7 F8                      	CLC
 23702 00003FB8 C3                      	retn
 23703                                  
 23704                                  ;============================================================================
 23705                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 23706                                  ;============================================================================
 23707                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 23708                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 23709                                  
 23710                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 23711                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 23712                                  
 23713                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 23714                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23715                                  ;
 23716                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 23717                                  ;
 23718                                  ; Inputs:
 23719                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23720                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 23721                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23722                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23723                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23724                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23725                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 23726                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 23727                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 23728                                  ; Function:
 23729                                  ;	Crack the path
 23730                                  ; Outputs:
 23731                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 23732                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 23733                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 23734                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 23735                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 23736                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 23737                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 23738                                  ;	   Zero set
 23739                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 23740                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 23741                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 23742                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 23743                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 23744                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 23745                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 23746                                  ;	   Zero reset
 23747                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 23748                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 23749                                  ;	ELSE
 23750                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 23751                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 23752                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 23753                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 23754                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 23755                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 23756                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 23757                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 23758                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 23759                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 23760                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 23761                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 23762                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 23763                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 23764                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 23765                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 23766                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 23767                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 23768                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 23769                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 23770                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23771                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23772                                  
 23773                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 23774                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 23775                                  
 23776                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23777                                  GETPATH:
 23778                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 23779 00003FB9 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 23780                                  
 23781                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 23782                                  
 23783                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 23784                                  GetPathNoSet:
 23785                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2	
 23786 00003FBF C606[2303]02            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 23787 00003FC4 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 23788                                  
 23789                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 23790                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 23791                                  
 23792 00003FCA 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 23793                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 23794                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 23795 00003FCE 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 23796 00003FD3 7438                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 23797                                  
 23798                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 23799                                  
 23800 00003FD5 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 23801                                  	; 18/08/2018
 23802                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 23803                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23804                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23805                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 23806 00003FD8 E8B000                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 23807 00003FDB 722E                    	JC	short InternalError
 23808                                  
 23809                                  Build_devJ:
 23810 00003FDD A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 23811 00003FE0 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 23812                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 23813 00003FE3 C606[2303]01            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 23814                                  					; "finding" a char device
 23815                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 23816                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 23817                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 23818                                  
 23819                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 23820                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 23821                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 23822                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 23823                                  ;
 23824                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 23825                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 23826                                  
 23827                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 23828 00003FE8 16                      	push	ss
 23829 00003FE9 07                      	pop	es
 23830                                  
 23831                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 23832 00003FEA BE[4B05]                	mov	si,NAME1
 23833 00003FED 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]
 23834 00003FF1 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 23835 00003FF3 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; 8 chars in device name
 23836                                  MoveLoop:
 23837 00003FF6 AC                      	lodsb
 23838 00003FF7 AA                      	stosb
 23839 00003FF8 3C20                    	cmp	al," "
 23840 00003FFA 7402                    	jz	short NoSave
 23841                                  
 23842 00003FFC 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 23843                                  NoSave:
 23844 00003FFE E2F6                    	loop	MoveLoop
 23845                                  
 23846                                  ; DX is the position of the last seen non-space + 1. We terminate the name
 23847                                  ; at this point.
 23848                                  
 23849 00004000 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 23850 00004002 C60500                  	mov	byte [di],0		; end of string
 23851 00004005 E8D302                  	call	Build_device_ent	; Clears carry sets zero
 23852 00004008 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; reset zero
 23853 0000400A C3                      	retn
 23854                                  
 23855                                  InternalError:
 23856                                  InternalError_loop:
 23857 0000400B EBFE                    	JMP	short InternalError_loop	; freeze
 23858                                  
 23859                                  ; Start off at the correct spot. Optimize if the current dir part is valid.
 23860                                  
 23861                                  CrackIt:
 23862 0000400D 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer
 23863 00004011 83FEFF                  	CMP	SI,-1			; valid?
 23864 00004014 7503                    	JNZ	short LOOK_SING		; Yes, use it.
 23865 00004016 8D7503                  	LEA	SI,[DI+3]		; skip D:\.
 23866                                  LOOK_SING:
 23867                                  	;mov	byte [ATTRIB],16h
 23868 00004019 C606[6B05]16            	MOV	byte [ATTRIB],attr_directory+attr_system+attr_hidden
 23869                                  					; Attributes to search through Dirs
 23870 0000401E C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 23871 00004022 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1
 23872                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+73]
 23873 00004025 268B5D49                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+curdir.ID]
 23874 00004029 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 23875                                  
 23876                                  ; AX = -1
 23877                                  ; BX = cluster number of current directory. THis number is -1 if the media
 23878                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 23879                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 23880                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 23881                                  
 23882 0000402D 39C6                    	CMP	SI,AX			; if Current directory is not part
 23883 0000402F 7440                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 23884 00004031 39C3                    	CMP	BX,AX			; is the current directory cluster valid
 23885                                  
 23886                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 23887 00004033 743C                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; no, crack form the root
 23888                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 23889 00004035 F606[3A0D]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ; for fastopen ?
 23890 0000403A 7442                    	JZ	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER	; no
 23891 0000403C 06                      	PUSH	ES			; save registers
 23892 0000403D 57                      	PUSH	DI
 23893 0000403E 51                      	PUSH	CX
 23894 0000403F FF74FF                  	PUSH	word [SI-1]		; save \ and 1st char of next element
 23895 00004042 56                      	PUSH	SI
 23896 00004043 53                      	PUSH	BX
 23897                                  
 23898 00004044 C644FF00                	MOV	BYTE [SI-1],0		; call fastopen to look up cur dir info
 23899 00004048 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 23900                                  
 23901                                  ;hkn; FastOpenTable, Dir_Info_Buff & FastOpen_Ext_Info are in DOSDATA
 23902 0000404C BB[300D]                	MOV	BX,FastOpenTable
 23903 0000404F BF[460D]                	MOV	DI,Dir_Info_Buff
 23904 00004052 B9[3B0D]                	MOV	CX,FastOpen_Ext_Info
 23905                                  	;mov	al,1
 23906 00004055 B001                    	MOV	AL,FONC_Look_up
 23907 00004057 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 23908 00004058 07                      	POP	ES
 23909                                  	;call	far [BX+2]
 23910 00004059 FF5F02                  	CALL	far [BX+fastopen_entry.name_caching]
 23911 0000405C 7208                    	JC	short GO_Chk_end1 	;fastopen not installed, or wrong drive.
 23912                                  					; Go to Got_Srch_cluster
 23913 0000405E 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		;fastopen has current dir info?
 23914 00004061 7404                    	JE	short GO_Chk_end	;yes. Go to got_search_cluster
 23915 00004063 F9                      	stc
 23916 00004064 EB01                    	jmp	short GO_Chk_end	;Go to No_Curr_D
 23917                                  GO_Chk_end1:
 23918 00004066 F8                      	clc
 23919                                  GO_Chk_end:				; restore registers
 23920 00004067 5B                      	POP	BX
 23921 00004068 5E                      	POP	SI
 23922 00004069 8F44FF                  	POP	word [SI-1]
 23923 0000406C 59                      	POP	CX
 23924 0000406D 5F                      	POP	DI
 23925 0000406E 07                      	POP	ES
 23926 0000406F 730D                    	JNC	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER ; crack based on cur dir
 23927                                  
 23928                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 23929                                  ;
 23930                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 23931                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 23932                                  
 23933                                  NO_CURR_D:
 23934 00004071 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 23935 00004075 8D7403                  	LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 23936 00004078 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 23937 0000407C EB3C                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 23938                                  
 23939                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 23940                                  ; of specified cluster.
 23941                                  
 23942                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:
 23943 0000407E C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 23944 00004082 E8D4FE                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 23945                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 23946                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 23947                                  	; 16/12/2022
 23948 00004085 7344                    	jnc	short FINDPATH ; 17/08/2018
 23949                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 23950                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 23951                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 23952                                  SETFERR:
 23953 00004087 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; set zero
 23954 00004089 F9                      	STC
 23955 0000408A C3                      	retn
 23956                                  
 23957                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23958                                  ;
 23959                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 23960                                  ;
 23961                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 23962                                  ;   device.
 23963                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 23964                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23965                                  
 23966                                  CHKDEV:
 23967 0000408B 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 23968 0000408D 8CD7                    	MOV	DI,SS
 23969 0000408F 8EC7                    	MOV	ES,DI
 23970                                  
 23971 00004091 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 23972 00004094 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 23973                                  TESTLOOP:
 23974 00004097 E87F10                  	call	GETLET
 23975                                  
 23976 0000409A 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 23977 0000409C 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 23978 0000409E E8CE10                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 23979 000040A1 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 23980 000040A3 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 23981 000040A5 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 23982                                  
 23983 000040A7 AA                      	STOSB
 23984 000040A8 E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 23985                                  NOTDEV:
 23986 000040AA F9                      	STC
 23987 000040AB C3                      	retn
 23988                                  
 23989                                  TESTDEVICE:
 23990 000040AC 83C102                  	ADD	CX,2
 23991 000040AF B020                    	MOV	AL,' '
 23992 000040B1 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 23993 000040B3 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 23994 000040B5 8ED8                    	MOV	DS,AX
 23995                                  	;call	DEVNAME
 23996                                  	;retn
 23997                                  	; 18/12/2022
 23998 000040B7 E9C201                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 23999                                  
 24000                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 24001                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24002                                  ;
 24003                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 24004                                  ;
 24005                                  ; Inputs:
 24006                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 24007                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 24008                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 24009                                  ; Function:
 24010                                  ;	Search from root for path
 24011                                  ; Outputs:
 24012                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 24013                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 24014                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 24015                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24016                                  
 24017                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24018                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24019                                  
 24020                                  ROOTPATH:
 24021 000040BA E8D7FE                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 24022 000040BD 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 24023 000040C0 7509                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 24024                                  
 24025                                  ; Root dir specified
 24026 000040C2 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 24027 000040C5 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 24028 000040C8 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 24029                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 24030 000040CA C3                      	retn
 24031                                  
 24032                                  ; Inputs:
 24033                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 24034                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 24035                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 24036                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 24037                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 24038                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 24039                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 24040                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 24041                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 24042                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 24043                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 24044                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 24045                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 24046                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 24047                                  ; Function:
 24048                                  ;	Parse path name
 24049                                  ; Outputs:
 24050                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 24051                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 24052                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 24053                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 24054                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 24055                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 24056                                  ;	   Zero set
 24057                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 24058                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 24059                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 24060                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 24061                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 24062                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 24063                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 24064                                  ;	   Zero reset
 24065                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 24066                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 24067                                  ;	ELSE
 24068                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 24069                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 24070                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 24071                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 24072                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 24073                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 24074                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 24075                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 24076                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 24077                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 24078                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 24079                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 24080                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 24081                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 24082                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 24083                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 24084                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 24085                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 24086                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 24087                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 24088                                  
 24089                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24090                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24091                                  
 24092                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 24093                                  FINDPATH:
 24094 000040CB 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 24095 000040CC 56                      	PUSH	SI
 24096 000040CD 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 24097 000040CF 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 24098 000040D3 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 24099 000040D8 740E                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 24100 000040DA 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 24101 000040DE 7508                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 24102 000040E0 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 24103                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 24104 000040E4 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory currency
 24105                                  NOIDS:
 24106                                  
 24107                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 24108                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 24109                                  ;
 24110                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 24111                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 24112                                  ;
 24113                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 24114                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 24115                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 24116                                  
 24117 000040E8 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 24118 000040EA 8EC0                    	MOV	ES,AX
 24119                                  
 24120                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 24121 000040EC BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 24122 000040EF B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 24123 000040F2 AA                      	STOSB
 24124 000040F3 AB                      	STOSW
 24125 000040F4 AB                      	STOSW
 24126 000040F5 AB                      	STOSW
 24127 000040F6 AB                      	STOSW
 24128 000040F7 AB                      	STOSW
 24129                                  
 24130                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 24131 000040F8 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 24132 000040FB 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 24133                                  GetNam:
 24134                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24135                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 24136                                  
 24137                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 24138                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24139                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !	
 24140                                  	
 24141 000040FD AC                      	LODSB
 24142 000040FE 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 24143 00004100 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 24144 00004102 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24145 00004104 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24146 00004106 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 24147 00004108 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24148 0000410A 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 24149 0000410C 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 24150 0000410E 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 24151                                  StoNam: 
 24152 00004111 AA                      	STOSB
 24153 00004112 EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 24154                                  _SetExt:
 24155 00004114 BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 24156                                  GetExt:
 24157 00004117 AC                      	LODSB
 24158 00004118 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24159 0000411A 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24160 0000411C 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 24161 0000411E 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 24162 00004120 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 24163 00004122 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 24164 00004124 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 24165                                  StoExt: 
 24166 00004127 AA                      	STOSB
 24167 00004128 EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 24168                                  _GetDone:
 24169 0000412A 4E                      	DEC	SI
 24170 0000412B 88E1                    	MOV	CL,AH  ; ?*!
 24171 0000412D 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 24172 00004130 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 24173 00004131 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 24174 00004132 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 24175 00004134 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 24176 00004136 E9EA00                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 24177                                  check_device:
 24178 00004139 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element
 24179 0000413A 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 24180 0000413C 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24181 0000413E 7508                    	JNZ	short NOT_LAST
 24182                                  
 24183                                  ; for last element of the path switch to the correct search attributes
 24184                                  
 24185 00004140 8A3E[6D05]              	MOV	BH,[SATTRIB]
 24186 00004144 883E[6B05]              	MOV	[ATTRIB],BH
 24187                                  
 24188                                  NOT_LAST:
 24189                                  
 24190                                  ; check name1 to see if we have a device...
 24191                                  
 24192 00004148 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 24193                                  
 24194                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24195                                  	;context ES
 24196 00004149 16                      	push	ss
 24197 0000414A 07                      	pop	es
 24198 0000414B E82E01                  	call	DEVNAME 		; blast BX
 24199 0000414E 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 24200 0000414F 720B                    	JC	short FindFile		; Not a device
 24201 00004151 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; Test next char again
 24202 00004153 7403                    	JZ	short GO_BDEV
 24203 00004155 E9CF00                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Device name in middle of path
 24204                                  
 24205                                  GO_BDEV:
 24206 00004158 5E                      	POP	SI			; Points to NUL at end of path
 24207 00004159 E981FE                  	JMP	Build_devJ
 24208                                  
 24209                                  FindFile:
 24210                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 24211 0000415C 803E[4B05]E5            	CMP	BYTE [NAME1],0E5H	; if 1st char = E5
 24212 00004161 7505                    	JNZ	short NOE5		; no
 24213 00004163 C606[4B05]05            	MOV	BYTE [NAME1],05H	; change it to 05
 24214                                  NOE5:
 24215                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 24216 00004168 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Start of this element
 24217 00004169 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 24218 0000416A 51                      	PUSH	CX			; CL return from NameTrans
 24219                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24220                                  
 24221 0000416B E89C02                  	CALL	LookupPath		; call fastopen to get dir entry
 24222 0000416E 7303                    	JNC	short DIR_FOUND		; found dir entry
 24223                                  
 24224                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24225 00004170 E89DFC                  	call	FINDENTRY
 24226                                  DIR_FOUND:
 24227 00004173 59                      	POP	CX
 24228 00004174 07                      	POP	ES
 24229 00004175 5F                      	POP	DI
 24230 00004176 7303                    	JNC	short LOAD_BUF
 24231 00004178 E9D100                  	JMP	BADPATHPOP
 24232                                  
 24233                                  LOAD_BUF:
 24234 0000417B C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 24235                                  	;test	byte [bx+0Bh],10h
 24236 0000417F F6470B10                	TEST	BYTE [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_directory
 24237 00004183 7503                    	JNZ	short GO_NEXT 		; DOS 3.3
 24238 00004185 E99F00                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Error or end of path
 24239                                  
 24240                                  ; if we are not setting the directory, then check for end of string
 24241                                  
 24242                                  GO_NEXT:
 24243                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24244 00004188 36803E[4C03]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:NoSetDir],0
 24245 0000418E 7423                    	JZ	short SetDir
 24246 00004190 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI			; Save pointer to entry
 24247 00004192 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 24248                                  
 24249                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24250                                  	;context DS
 24251 00004194 16                      	push	ss
 24252 00004195 1F                      	pop	ds
 24253 00004196 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24254                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24255                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24256 00004197 F606[3A0D]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ;only DOSOPEN can take advantage of
 24257 0000419C 740B                    	JZ	short _nofast			; the FastOpen
 24258 0000419E F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success ; Lookup just happened
 24259 000041A3 7404                    	JZ	short _nofast			; no
 24260 000041A5 8B3E[660D]              	MOV	DI,[Next_Element_Start]	; no need to insert it again
 24261                                  _nofast:
 24262 000041A9 803D00                  	CMP	BYTE [DI],0
 24263                                  	;;JNZ	short NEXT_ONE		; DOS 3.3
 24264                                  	;;JMP	_SETRET  ; retn		; Got it
 24265                                  	;retn	; 05/09/2018
 24266                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 24267                                  	;jmp	_SETRET
 24268                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24269 000041AC 7421                    	jz	short _SETRET
 24270                                  
 24271                                  NEXT_ONE:
 24272 000041AE 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Put start of next element back on stack
 24273 000041AF 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 24274 000041B1 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX			; Get back pointer to entry
 24275                                  SetDir:
 24276 000041B3 8B14                    	MOV	DX,[SI] 		; Dir_first
 24277                                  
 24278                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24279 000041B5 1E                      	PUSH	DS		      ; save [curbuf+2]
 24280                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24281 000041B6 16                      	push	ss
 24282 000041B7 1F                      	pop	ds		      ; set DS Dosgroup
 24283                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 24284 000041B8 F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 24285 000041BD 7411                    	JZ	short DO_NORMAL	      ; fastopen not in memory or path not
 24286 000041BF 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX		      ; not found
 24287 000041C1 8B3E[BC05]              	MOV	DI,[CLUSNUM]	      ; clusnum was set in LookupPath
 24288 000041C5 50                      	PUSH	AX		      ; save device id (AH)
 24289 000041C6 E890FD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 24290 000041C9 58                      	POP	AX		      ; restore device id (AH)
 24291 000041CA 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2		      ; pop ds in stack
 24292 000041CD EB3E                    	JMP	short FAST_OPEN_SKIP
 24293                                  
 24294                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24295                                  _SETRET:
 24296 000041CF C3                      	retn
 24297                                  
 24298                                  DO_NORMAL:
 24299 000041D0 1F                      	POP	DS			; DS = [curbuf + 2]
 24300                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 24301                                  
 24302 000041D1 29FB                    	SUB	BX,DI			; Offset into sector of start of entry
 24303 000041D3 29FE                    	SUB	SI,DI			; Offset into sector of dir_first
 24304 000041D5 53                      	PUSH	BX
 24305 000041D6 50                      	PUSH	AX
 24306 000041D7 56                      	PUSH	SI
 24307 000041D8 51                      	PUSH	CX
 24308                                  	;push	word [di+6]
 24309 000041D9 FF7506                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]	;AN000;>32mb
 24310                                  	; 19/05/2019
 24311                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24312                                  	;push	word [di+8]
 24313 000041DC FF7508                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	;AN000;>32mb
 24314 000041DF 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX
 24315                                  
 24316                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24317                                  	;context DS
 24318 000041E1 16                      	push	ss
 24319 000041E2 1F                      	pop	ds
 24320                                  	;invoke	SETDIRSRCH		; This uses UNPACK which might blow
 24321 000041E3 E873FD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH		; the entry sector buffer
 24322                                  	; 19/05/2019
 24323                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24324 000041E6 8F06[0706]              	POP	word [HIGH_SECTOR]
 24325 000041EA 5A                      	POP	DX
 24326 000041EB 720A                    	JC	short SKIP_GETB
 24327                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 24328 000041ED C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY+Allowed_FAIL
 24329 000041F2 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 24330                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFR		; Get the entry buffer back
 24331 000041F4 E83E18                  	call	GETBUFFR
 24332                                  SKIP_GETB:
 24333 000041F7 59                      	POP	CX
 24334 000041F8 5E                      	POP	SI
 24335 000041F9 58                      	POP	AX
 24336 000041FA 5B                      	POP	BX
 24337 000041FB 7305                    	JNC	short SET_THE_BUF
 24338 000041FD 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24339 000041FE 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Point with SI
 24340 00004200 EB21                    	JMP	SHORT _BADPATH
 24341                                  
 24342                                  SET_THE_BUF:
 24343 00004202 E855F5                  	call	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 24344 00004205 8B3E[E205]              	MOV	DI,[CURBUF]
 24345 00004209 01FE                    	ADD	SI,DI			; Get the offsets back
 24346 0000420B 01FB                    	ADD	BX,DI
 24347                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24348                                  FAST_OPEN_SKIP:
 24349 0000420D 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24350 0000420E E89D02                  	CALL	InsertPath		; insert dir entry info
 24351                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24352 00004211 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 24353 00004213 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24354 00004215 74B8                    	JZ	short _SETRET		; At end
 24355 00004217 47                      	INC	DI			; Skip over "/"
 24356 00004218 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Point with SI
 24357 0000421A E8520F                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 24358 0000421D 7503                    	JNZ	short find_bad_name	; oops
 24359 0000421F E9A9FE                  	JMP	FINDPATH		; Next element
 24360                                  
 24361                                  find_bad_name:
 24362 00004222 4E                      	DEC	SI			; Undo above INC to get failure point
 24363                                  _BADPATH:
 24364 00004223 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; Set zero
 24365 00004225 EB2C                    	JMP	SHORT BADPRET
 24366                                  
 24367                                  FILEINPATH:
 24368 00004227 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 24369                                  
 24370                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24371                                  	;context DS			; Got to from one place with DS gone
 24372 00004228 16                      	push	ss
 24373 00004229 1F                      	pop	ds
 24374                                  
 24375                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen
 24376                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 24377 0000422A F606[3A0D]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set  ; do this here is we don't want to
 24378 0000422F 740B                    	JZ	short NO_FAST		; device info to fastopen
 24379                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 24380 00004231 F606[3A0D]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 24381 00004236 7404                    	JZ	short NO_FAST
 24382 00004238 8B3E[660D]              	MOV	DI,[Next_Element_Start]  ; This takes care of one time lookup
 24383                                  					 ; success
 24384                                  NO_FAST:
 24385                                  ; DOS 3.3 FastOpen
 24386 0000423C 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 24387 0000423E 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 24388 00004240 7404                    	JZ	short INCRET
 24389 00004242 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Path too long
 24390 00004244 EB0D                    	JMP	SHORT BADPRET
 24391                                  
 24392                                  INCRET:
 24393                                  ; DOS 3.3 FasOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24394                                  
 24395 00004246 E86502                  	CALL   InsertPath		; insert dir entry info
 24396                                  
 24397                                  ; DOS 3.3 FasOpen 6/12/86  F.C.
 24398 00004249 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; Reset zero
 24399                                  	; 16/12/2022	
 24400                                  ;_SETRET:
 24401 0000424B C3                      	retn
 24402                                  
 24403                                  BADPATHPOP:
 24404 0000424C 5E                      	POP	SI			; Start of next element
 24405 0000424D 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 24406 0000424F 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; Start of bad element
 24407 00004251 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; zero if bad element is last, non-zero if path too long
 24408                                  BADPRET:
 24409 00004253 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 24410 00004256 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL		; Make sure return correct
 24411 00004259 F9                      	STC
 24412 0000425A C3                      	retn
 24413                                  
 24414                                  ;Break	<STARTSRCH -- INITIATE DIRECTORY SEARCH>
 24415                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24416                                  ;
 24417                                  ; Procedure Name : STARTSRCH
 24418                                  ;
 24419                                  ; Inputs:
 24420                                  ;	[THISDPB] Set
 24421                                  ; Function:
 24422                                  ;	Set up a search for GETENTRY and NEXTENTRY
 24423                                  ; Outputs:
 24424                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameters
 24425                                  ;	Sets up LASTENT, ENTFREE=ENTLAST=-1, VOLID=0
 24426                                  ; Destroys ES,BP,AX
 24427                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24428                                  
 24429                                  STARTSRCH:
 24430 0000425B C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 24431 0000425F 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 24432 00004261 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 24433 00004264 A2[7B05]                	MOV	[VOLID],AL		; No volume ID found
 24434 00004267 48                      	DEC	AX
 24435 00004268 A3[D805]                	MOV	[ENTFREE],AX
 24436 0000426B A3[DA05]                	MOV	[ENTLAST],AX
 24437 0000426E C3                      	retn
 24438                                  
 24439                                  ;BREAK <MatchAttributes - the final check for attribute matching>
 24440                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24441                                  ; Procedure Name : MatchAttributes
 24442                                  ;
 24443                                  ; Input:    [Attrib] = attribute to search for
 24444                                  ;	    CH = found attribute
 24445                                  ; Output:   JZ <match>
 24446                                  ;	    JNZ <nomatch>
 24447                                  ; Registers modified: noneski
 24448                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24449                                  
 24450                                  MatchAttributes:
 24451 0000426F 50                      	PUSH	AX
 24452                                  
 24453                                  ;hkn; SS override
 24454 00004270 36A0[6B05]              	MOV	AL,[ss:ATTRIB]		; AL <- SearchSet
 24455 00004274 F6D0                    	NOT	AL			; AL <- SearchSet'

 24457                                  	;and	al,16h

 24459                                  ;
 24460                                  ; the result is non-zero if an attribute is not in the search set
 24461                                  ; and in the found set and in the important set. This means that we do not
 24462                                  ; have a match. Do a JNZ <nomatch> or JZ <match>
 24463                                  ;

 24465 0000427B C3                      	retn

 24473                                  ;Break <DevName - Look for name of device>
 24474                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24475                                  ;
 24476                                  ; Procedure Name : DevName
 24477                                  ;
 24478                                  ; Inputs:
 24479                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA
 24480                                  ;	Filename in NAME1
 24481                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 24482                                  ; Function:
 24483                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 24484                                  ; Outputs:
 24485                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 24486                                  ;	ELSE
 24487                                  ;	Zero flag set
 24488                                  ;	BH = Bit 7,6 = 1, bit 5 = 0 (cooked mode)
 24489                                  ;	     bits 0-4 set from low byte of attribute word
 24490                                  ;	DEVPT = DWORD pointer to Device header of device
 24491                                  ; BX destroyed, others preserved
 24492                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24493                                  
 24494                                  DEVNAME:
 24495                                  	; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24496                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 49FBh

 24501 0000427F 50                      	PUSH	AX
 24502                                  
 24503                                  ; E5 special code

 24507 0000428B C606[4B05]E5            	MOV	byte [NAME1],0E5h

 24509                                  	;test	byte [ATTRIB],8

 24511                                  					; If looking for VOL id don't find devs

 24513

 24515 00004297 BE[4800]                	MOV	SI,NULDEV
 24516                                  LOOKIO:
 24517                                  	; 21/11/2022
 24518                                  	;test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],80h
 24519                                  	; 17/12/2022
 24520                                  	;test	byte [si+5],80h
 24521 0000429A F6440580                	test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVTYP>>8)
 24522                                  	;;test	word [si+4],8000h
 24523                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVTYP
 24524 0000429E 7411                    	JZ	short SKIPDEV 		; Skip block devices (NET and LOCAL)
 24525 000042A0 89F0                    	MOV	AX,SI
 24526                                  	;add	si,10
 24527 000042A2 83C60A                  	ADD	SI,SYSDEV.NAME
 24528                                  
 24529                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA

 24531 000042A8 B90400                  	MOV	CX,4			; All devices are 8 letters

 24541                                  RETNV:

 24543 000042BB 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX
 24544                                  
 24545 000042BD 8F06[4B05]              	POP	WORD [NAME1]
 24546 000042C1 58                      	POP	AX
 24547 000042C2 59                      	POP	CX
 24548 000042C3 5F                      	POP	DI
 24549 000042C4 5E                      	POP	SI

 24563                                  ;BREAK <Build_device_ent - Make a Directory entry>
 24564                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24565                                  ; Procedure Name : Build_device_ent
 24566                                  ;
 24567                                  ; Inputs:
 24568                                  ;	[NAME1] has name
 24569                                  ;	BH is attribute field (supplied by DEVNAME)
 24570                                  ;	[DEVPT] points to device header (supplied by DEVNAME)
 24571                                  ; Function:
 24572                                  ;	Build a directory entry for a device at DEVFCB
 24573                                  ; Outputs:
 24574                                  ;	BX points to DEVFCB
 24575                                  ;	SI points to dir_first field
 24576                                  ;	AH = input BH
 24577                                  ;	AL = 0
 24578                                  ;	dir_first = DEVPT
 24579                                  ;	Zero Set, Carry Clear
 24580                                  ; DS,ES,BP preserved, others destroyed
 24581                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24582                                  
 24583                                  Build_device_ent:
 24584 000042DB B82020                  	MOV	AX,"  " ; 2020h
 24585                                  
 24586                                  ;hkn; DEVFCB is in DOSDATA
 24587 000042DE BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,DEVFCB+8		; Point to extent field
 24588                                  
 24589                                  ;	Fill dir_ext	BUGBUG - use ERRNZs for this stuff!
 24590                                  
 24591 000042E1 AB                      	STOSW
 24592 000042E2 AA                      	STOSB				; Blank out extent field
 24593                                  	;mov	al,40h
 24594 000042E3 B040                    	MOV	AL,attr_device
 24595                                  
 24596                                  ;	Fill Dir_attr
 24597                                  
 24598 000042E5 AA                      	STOSB				; Set attribute field
 24599 000042E6 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 24600 000042E8 B90A00                  	MOV	CX,10
 24601                                  
 24602                                  ; Fill dir_pad
 24603                                  
 24604 000042EB F3AB                    	REP	STOSW			; Fill rest with zeros
 24605 000042ED E856C8                  	call	DATE16
 24606                                  
 24607                                  ;hkn; DEVFCB is in DOSDATA
 24608 000042F0 BF[6105]                	MOV	DI,DEVFCB+dir_entry.dir_time ; 09/08/2018
 24609 000042F3 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 24610                                  
 24611                                  ; Fill dir_time
 24612                                  
 24613 000042F4 AB                      	STOSW
 24614 000042F5 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 24615                                  
 24616                                  ; Fill dir_date
 24617                                  
 24618 000042F6 AB                      	STOSW
 24619 000042F7 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; SI points to dir_first field
 24620 000042F9 A1[9A05]                	MOV	AX,[DEVPT]
 24621                                  
 24622                                  ; Fill dir_first
 24623                                  
 24624 000042FC AB                      	STOSW				; Dir_first points to device
 24625 000042FD A1[9C05]                	MOV	AX,[DEVPT+2]
 24626                                  ;
 24627                                  ; Fill dir_size_l
 24628                                  ;
 24629 00004300 AB                      	STOSW
 24630 00004301 88FC                    	MOV	AH,BH			; Put device atts in AH
 24631                                  
 24632                                  ;hkn; DEVFCB is in DOSDATA
 24633 00004303 BB[4B05]                	MOV	BX,DEVFCB
 24634 00004306 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; Set zero, clear carry
 24635 00004308 C3                      	retn

 24641                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.
 24642                                  ;   If invalid, reset original CDS to root.

 24699

 24801                                  ; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24802                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - offset 43BDh
 24803                                  
 24804                                  ;Break	<CheckThisDevice - Check for being a device>
 24805                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24806                                  ;
 24807                                  ;   CheckThisDevice - Examine the area at DS:SI to see if there is a valid
 24808                                  ;   device specified. We will return carry if there is a device present. 
 24809                                  ;   The forms of devices we will recognize are:
 24810                                  ;
 24811                                  ;	[path]device
 24812                                  ;
 24813                                  ;   Note that the drive letter has *already* been removed. All other forms
 24814                                  ;   are not considered to be devices. If such a device is found we change
 24815                                  ;   the source pointer to point to the device component.
 24816                                  ;
 24817                                  ;   Inputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 24818                                  ;		DS:SI contains name
 24819                                  ;   Outputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 24820                                  ;		DS:SI point to name or device
 24821                                  ;		Carry flag set if device was found
 24822                                  ;		Carry flag reset otherwise
 24823                                  ;   Registers Modified: all except ES:DI, DS
 24824                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24825                                  
 24826                                  CheckThisDevice:
 24827 000043C5 57                      	push	di
 24828 000043C6 56                      	push	si
 24829 000043C7 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 24830                                  
 24831                                  ; Check for presence of \dev\ (Dam multiplan!)
 24832                                  
 24833 000043C9 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 24834 000043CB E8A10D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; is it a path char?
 24835 000043CE 7517                    	JNZ	short ParseDev		; no, go attempt to parse device
 24836 000043D0 46                      	INC	SI			; simulate LODSB
 24837                                  
 24838                                  ; We have the leading path separator. Look for DEV part.
 24839                                  
 24840 000043D1 AD                      	LODSW
 24841 000043D2 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020h
 24842 000043D5 3D6465                  	cmp	ax,"de"
 24843                                  	;CMP	AX,"e"<< 8 + "d"
 24844 000043D8 752D                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; not "de", assume not device
 24845 000043DA AC                      	LODSB
 24846 000043DB 0C20                    	OR	AL,20h
 24847 000043DD 3C76                    	CMP	AL,"v"                  ; Not "v", assume not device
 24848 000043DF 7526                    	JNZ	short NotDevice
 24849 000043E1 AC                      	LODSB
 24850 000043E2 E88A0D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; do we have the last path separator?
 24851 000043E5 7520                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; no. go for it.
 24852                                  
 24853                                  ; DS:SI now points to a potential drive. Preserve them as NameTrans advances
 24854                                  ; SI and DevName may destroy DS.
 24855                                  
 24856                                  ParseDev:
 24857 000043E7 1E                      	push	ds
 24858 000043E8 56                      	push	si			; preserve the source pointer
 24859 000043E9 E8C10C                  	call	NameTrans		; advance DS:SI
 24860 000043EC 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		; parse entire string?
 24861 000043EF F9                      	STC				; simulate a Carry return from DevName
 24862 000043F0 750B                    	JNZ	short SkipSearch	; no parse. simulate a file return.
 24863                                  
 24864                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 24865 000043F2 16                      	push	ss
 24866 000043F3 1F                      	pop	ds
 24867                                  
 24868                                  ; M026 - start - fix ported from ROMDOS2 for bug # 2849
 24869                                  ;
 24870                                  ; SR;
 24871                                  ; We have to set Attrib before invoking DevName. Otherwise, the value from
 24872                                  ; a previous DOS call is used and DevName thinks it is not a device if the
 24873                                  ; old call set the volume attribute bit.
 24874                                  
 24875 000043F4 A0[6D05]                	mov	al,[SATTRIB]
 24876 000043F7 A2[6B05]                	mov	[ATTRIB],al		;set Attrib for DevName
 24877                                  
 24878                                  ; M026 - end
 24879                                  
 24880 000043FA E87FFE                  	call	DEVNAME
 24881                                  
 24882                                  SkipSearch:
 24883 000043FD 5E                      	pop	si
 24884 000043FE 1F                      	pop	ds
 24885                                  
 24886                                  ; SI points to the beginning of the potential device. If we have a device
 24887                                  ; then we do not change SI. If we have a file, then we reset SI back to the
 24888                                  ; original value. At this point Carry set indicates FILE.
 24889                                  
 24890                                  CheckReturn:
 24891 000043FF 5F                      	pop	di			; get original SI
 24892 00004400 7302                    	JNC	short Check_Done	; if device then do not reset pointer
 24893 00004402 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 24894                                  Check_Done:
 24895 00004404 5F                      	pop	di
 24896 00004405 F5                      	CMC				; invert carry. Carry => device
 24897 00004406 C3                      	retn
 24898                                  NotDevice:
 24899 00004407 F9                      	STC
 24900 00004408 EBF5                    	JMP	short CheckReturn
 24901                                  
 24902                                  ;BREAK <LookupPath - call fastopen to get dir entry info>
 24903                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24904                                  ;
 24905                                  ; Procedure Name : LookupPath
 24906                                  ;
 24907                                  ; Output  DS:SI -> path name,
 24908                                  ;	  ES:DI -> dir entry info buffer
 24909                                  ;	  ES:CX -> extended dir info buffer
 24910                                  ;
 24911                                  ;	  carry flag clear : tables pointed by ES:DI and ES:CX are filled by
 24912                                  ;			     FastOpen, DS:SI points to char just one after
 24913                                  ;			     the last char of path name which is fully or
 24914                                  ;			     partially found in FastOPen
 24915                                  ;	  carry flag set : FastOpen not in memory or path name not found
 24916                                  ;

 24918

 25155                                  ;		length of packets
 25156 00004532 160E160D0F0E            LenTab:	 DB	DRDWRHL, DRDNDHL, DRDWRHL, DSTATHL, DFLSHL, DRDNDHL
 25157                                  ;LenTab: db	22,14,22,13,15,14
 25158                                  
 25159                                  ;	Error Function
 25160                                  
 25161                                  CmdTab:
 25162 00004538 8604                    	DB	86h, DEVRD	; 0 input
 25163 0000453A 8605                    	DB	86h, DEVRDND	; 1 input status

 25165 0000453E 870A                    	DB	87h, DEVOST	; 3 output status

 25170                                  
 25171                                  ;CmdTab:
 25172                                  ;	db	86h, 4

 25180                                  
 25181                                  ; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25182                                  ; DOSCODE:8413h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25183                                  
 25184                                  ;Break	<IOFUNC -- DO FUNCTION 1-12 I/O>
 25185                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25186                                  ;
 25187                                  ; Procedure Name : IOFUNC
 25188                                  ;
 25189                                  ; Inputs:
 25190                                  ;	DS:SI Points to SFT
 25191                                  ;	AH is function code
 25192                                  ;		= 0 Input
 25193                                  ;		= 1 Input Status
 25194                                  ;		= 2 Output
 25195                                  ;		= 3 Output Status
 25196                                  ;		= 4 Flush
 25197                                  ;		= 5 Input Status - System WAIT invoked for K09 if no char
 25198                                  ;				   present.
 25199                                  ;	AL = character if output
 25200                                  ; Function:
 25201                                  ;	Perform indicated I/O to device or file
 25202                                  ; Outputs:
 25203                                  ;	AL is character if input
 25204                                  ;	If a status call
 25205                                  ;		zero set if not ready
 25206                                  ;		zero reset if ready (character in AL for input status)
 25207                                  ; For regular files:
 25208                                  ;	Input Status
 25209                                  ;		Gets character but restores position
 25210                                  ;		Zero set on EOF
 25211                                  ;	Input
 25212                                  ;		Gets character advances position
 25213                                  ;		Returns ^Z on EOF
 25214                                  ;	Output Status
 25215                                  ;		Always ready
 25216                                  ; AX altered, all other registers preserved
 25217                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25218                                  
 25219                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25220                                  ; DOSCODE:83D8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25221
