 27447                                  ;Break	<OPTIMIZE -- DO A USER DISK REQUEST WELL>
 27448                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27449                                  ;
 27450                                  ; Procedure Name : OPTIMIZE
 27451                                  ;
 27452                                  ; Inputs:
 27453                                  ;       BX = Physical cluster
 27454                                  ;       CX = No. of records
 27455                                  ;       DL = sector within cluster
 27456                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27457                                  ;       [NEXTADD] = transfer address
 27458                                  ; Outputs:
 27459                                  ;       AX = No. of records remaining
 27460                                  ;       BX = Transfer address
 27461                                  ;       CX = No. or records to be transferred
 27462                                  ;       DX = Physical sector address            (LOW)
 27463                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR] = Physical sector address (HIGH)
 27464                                  ;       DI = Next cluster
 27465                                  ;       [CLUSNUM] = Last cluster accessed
 27466                                  ;       [NEXTADD] updated
 27467                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27468                                  ; ES:BP unchanged. Note that segment of transfer not set.
 27469                                  ;
 27470                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27471                                  
 27472                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27473                                  OPTIMIZE:
 27474 00004E58 52                      	PUSH    DX
 27475 00004E59 53                              PUSH    BX
 27476                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 27477 00004E5A 268A4604                        MOV     AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 27478 00004E5E FEC0                            INC     AL              ; Number of sectors per cluster
 27479 00004E60 88C4                            MOV     AH,AL
 27480 00004E62 28D0                            SUB     AL,DL           ; AL = Number of sectors left in first cluster
 27481 00004E64 89CA                            MOV     DX,CX
 27482                                  	;MOV	CX,0
 27483                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27484                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27485 00004E66 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx	; sub cx,cx
 27486                                  OPTCLUS:
 27487                                  ; AL has number of sectors available in current cluster
 27488                                  ; AH has number of sectors available in next cluster
 27489                                  ; BX has current physical cluster
 27490                                  ; CX has number of sequential sectors found so far
 27491                                  ; DX has number of sectors left to transfer
 27492                                  ; ES:BP Points to DPB
 27493                                  ; ES:SI has FAT pointer
 27494                                  
 27495                                  do_norm3:
 27496 00004E68 E8A807                          call	UNPACK
 27497 00004E6B 7237                            JC	short OP_ERR
 27498                                  clusgot2:
 27499 00004E6D 00C1                    	ADD	CL,AL
 27500 00004E6F 80D500                          ADC     CH,0
 27501 00004E72 39D1                            CMP     CX,DX
 27502 00004E74 7333                            JAE	short BLKDON
 27503 00004E76 88E0                            MOV     AL,AH
 27504 00004E78 43                              INC     BX
 27505 00004E79 39DF                            CMP     DI,BX
 27506 00004E7B 74EB                            JZ	short OPTCLUS
 27507 00004E7D 4B                              DEC     BX
 27508                                  FINCLUS:
 27509 00004E7E 891E[BC05]                      MOV     [CLUSNUM],BX    ; Last cluster accessed
 27510 00004E82 29CA                            SUB     DX,CX           ; Number of sectors still needed
 27511 00004E84 52                              PUSH    DX
 27512 00004E85 89C8                            MOV     AX,CX
 27513                                  	;mul	word[ES:BP+2]
 27514 00004E87 26F76602                        MUL	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] 
 27515                                  				; Number of sectors times sector size
 27516 00004E8B 8B36[B805]                      MOV     SI,[NEXTADD]
 27517 00004E8F 01F0                            ADD     AX,SI           ; Adjust by size of transfer
 27518 00004E91 A3[B805]                        MOV     [NEXTADD],AX
 27519 00004E94 58                              POP     AX              ; Number of sectors still needed
 27520 00004E95 5A                              POP     DX              ; Starting cluster
 27521 00004E96 29D3                            SUB     BX,DX           ; Number of new clusters accessed
 27522 00004E98 011E[BA05]                      ADD     [LASTPOS],BX
 27523 00004E9C 5B                              POP     BX              ; BL = sector position within cluster
 27524 00004E9D E81700                  	call	FIGREC
 27525 00004EA0 89F3                            MOV     BX,SI
 27526 00004EA2 F8                      	CLC
 27527 00004EA3 C3                              retn
 27528                                  OP_ERR:
 27529 00004EA4 83C404                          ADD     SP,4
 27530 00004EA7 F9                      	STC
 27531 00004EA8 C3                              retn
 27532                                  BLKDON:
 27533 00004EA9 29D1                            SUB     CX,DX           ; Number of sectors in cluster we don't want
 27534 00004EAB 28CC                            SUB     AH,CL           ; Number of sectors in cluster we accepted
 27535 00004EAD FECC                            DEC     AH              ; Adjust to mean position within cluster
 27536 00004EAF 8826[7305]                      MOV     [SECCLUSPOS],AH
 27537 00004EB3 89D1                            MOV     CX,DX           ; Anyway, make the total equal to the request
 27538 00004EB5 EBC7                            JMP     SHORT FINCLUS
 27539                                  
 27540                                  ;Break	<FIGREC -- Figure sector in allocation unit>
 27541                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27542                                  ;
 27543                                  ; Procedure Name : FIGREC
 27544                                  ;
 27545                                  ; Inputs:
 27546                                  ;       DX = Physical cluster number
 27547                                  ;       BL = Sector position within cluster
 27548                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27549                                  ; Outputs:
 27550                                  ;       DX = physical sector number           (LOW)
 27551                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR] Physical sector address (HIGH)
 27552                                  ; No other registers affected.
 27553                                  ;
 27554                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27555                                  
 27556                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27557                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27558                                  	; DOSCODE:8D96h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27559                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27560                                  	; DOSCODE:8D5Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 27561                                  FIGREC:
 27562 00004EB7 51                              PUSH    CX
 27563                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27564 00004EB8 268A4E05                        MOV     CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27565 00004EBC 4A                              DEC     DX
 27566 00004EBD 4A                              DEC     DX
 27567                                  
 27568                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 27569                                  	;SHL	DX,CL
 27570                                  
 27571                                  ;hkn; SS override HIGH_SECTOR
 27572                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27573 00004EBE 36C706[0706]0000        	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0		;F.C. >32mb
 27574 00004EC5 08C9                    	OR	CL,CL				;F.C. >32mb
 27575 00004EC7 740C                    	JZ	short noshift			;F.C. >32mb

 27577                                  rotleft:					;F.C. >32mb
 27578 00004ECB F8                      	CLC					;F.C. >32mb
 27579 00004ECC D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1				;F.C. >32mb
 27580                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27581 00004ECE 36D116[0706]            	RCL	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],1		;F.C. >32mb
 27582 00004ED3 E2F6                    	LOOP	rotleft				;F.C. >32mb
 27583                                  noshift:
 27584                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 27585 00004ED5 08DA                            OR      DL,BL
 27586                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+0Bh]
 27587 00004ED7 2603560B                        ADD     DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_SECTOR]
 27588                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27589                                  	; 10/06/2019
 27590 00004EDB 368316[0706]00                  ADC	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],0		;F.C. >32mb
 27591                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0        
 27592 00004EE1 59                      	POP     CX
 27593                                  figrec_retn:
 27594 00004EE2 C3                              retn
 27595                                  
 27596                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27597                                  ; DOSCODE:8DC2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27598                                  
 27599                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27600                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 
 27601                                  
 27602                                  ;Break   <ALLOCATE -- Assign disk space>
 27603                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27604                                  ;
 27605                                  ; Procedure Name : ALLOCATE - Allocate Disk Space
 27606                                  ;
 27607                                  ;   ALLOCATE is called to allocate disk clusters. The new clusters are
 27608                                  ;   FAT-chained onto the end of the existing file.
 27609                                  ;
 27610                                  ;   The DPB contains the cluster # of the last free cluster allocated
 27611                                  ;   (dpb_next_free). We start at this cluster and scan towards higher
 27612                                  ;   numbered clusters, looking for the necessary free blocks.
 27613                                  ;
 27614                                  ;   Once again, fancy terminology gets in the way of correct coding. When
 27615                                  ;   using next_free, start scanning AT THAT POINT and not the one following it.
 27616                                  ;   This fixes the boundary condition bug when only free = next_free = 2.
 27617                                  ;
 27618                                  ;       If we get to the end of the disk without satisfaction:
 27619                                  ;
 27620                                  ;           if (dpb_next_free == 2) then we've scanned the whole disk.
 27621                                  ;               return (insufficient_disk_space)
 27622                                  ;           ELSE
 27623                                  ;               dpb_next_free = 2; start scan over from the beginning.
 27624                                  ;
 27625                                  ;   Note that there is no multitasking interlock. There is no race when
 27626                                  ;   examining the entrys in an in-core FAT block since there will be no
 27627                                  ;   context switch. When UNPACK context switches while waiting for a FAT read
 27628                                  ;   we are done with any in-core FAT blocks, so again there is no race. The
 27629                                  ;   only special concern is that V2 and V3 MSDOS left the last allocated
 27630                                  ;   cluster as "00"; marking it EOF only when the entire alloc request was
 27631                                  ;   satisfied. We can't allow another activation to think this cluster is
 27632                                  ;   free, so we give it a special temporary mark to show that it is, indeed,
 27633                                  ;   allocated.
 27634                                  ;
 27635                                  ;   Note that when we run out of space this algorithem will scan from
 27636                                  ;   dpb_next_free to the end, then scan from cluster 2 through the end,
 27637                                  ;   redundantly scanning the later part of the disk. This only happens when
 27638                                  ;   we run out of space, so sue me.
 27639                                  ;
 27640                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 27641                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 27642                                  ;                                                                          ;
 27643                                  ;   The use of FATBYT and RESTFATBYT is somewhat mysterious. Here is the
 27644                                  ;   explanation:
 27645                                  ;
 27646                                  ;   In the NUL file case (sf_firclus currently 0) ALLOCATE is called with
 27647                                  ;   entry BX = 0. What needs to be done in this case is to stuff the cluster
 27648                                  ;   number of the first cluster allocated in sf_firclus when the ALLOCATE is
 27649                                  ;   complete. THIS VALUE IS SAVED TEMPORARILY IN CLUSTER 0, HENCE THE CURRENT
 27650                                  ;   VALUE IN CLUSTER 0 MUST BE SAVED AND RESTORED. This is a side effect of
 27651                                  ;   the fact that PACK and UNPACK don't treat requests for clusters 0 and 1 as
 27652                                  ;   errors. This "stuff" is done by the call to PACK which is right before
 27653                                  ;   the
 27654                                  ;           LOOP   findfre         ; alloc more if needed
 27655                                  ;   instruction when the first cluster is allocated to the nul file. The
 27656                                  ;   value is recalled from cluster 0 and stored at sf_firclus at ads4:
 27657                                  ;
 27658                                  ;   This method is obviously useless (because it is non-reentrant) for
 27659                                  ;   multitasking, and will have to be changed. Storing the required value on
 27660                                  ;   the stack is recommended. Setting sf_firclus at the PACK of cluster 0
 27661                                  ;   (instead of actually doing the PACK) is BAD because it doesn't handle
 27662                                  ;   problems with INT 24 well.
 27663                                  ;
 27664                                  ;            C  A  V  E  A  T     P  A  T  T  E  R  S  O  N                ;
 27665                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
 27666                                  ;                                                                          ;
 27667                                  ;       ENTRY   BX = Last cluster of file (0 if null file)
 27668                                  ;               CX = No. of clusters to allocate
 27669                                  ;               ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27670                                  ;               [THISSFT] = Points to SFT
 27671                                  ;
 27672                                  ;       EXIT    'C' set if insufficient space
 27673                                  ;                 [FAILERR] can be tested to see the reason for failure
 27674                                  ;                 CX = max. no. of clusters that could be added to file
 27675                                  ;               'C' clear if space allocated
 27676                                  ;                 BX = First cluster allocated
 27677                                  ;                 FAT is fully updated
 27678                                  ;                 sf_FIRCLUS field of SFT set if file was null
 27679                                  ;
 27680                                  ;       USES    ALL but SI, BP
 27681                                  
 27682                                  ;callmagic  proc near
 27683                                  ;       push    ds                             ;push segment of routine 
 27684                                  ;       push    Offset MagicPatch              ;push offset for routine
 27685                                  ;       retf                                   ;simulate jmp far
 27686                                  ;                                              ;far return address is on
 27687                                  ;                                              ;stack, so far return from
 27688                                  ;                                              ;call will return this routine
 27689                                  ;callmagic  endp
 27690                                  
 27691                                  ALLOCATE:
 27692                                  	; 10/09/2018
 27693                                  ;BEGIN MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 27694                                  ;
 27695                                  ;7/5/92 scottq
 27696                                  ;
 27697                                  ;This is the disk compression patch location which allows
 27698                                  ;the disk compression software to fail allocations if the
 27699                                  ;FAT would allows allocation, but the free space for compressed
 27700                                  ;data would not.
 27701                                  ;        
 27702                                  ;;;	call    far ptr MAGICPATCH
 27703                                  ;;; We cannot do a far call since we cannot have fix-ups[romdos,hidos],
 27704                                  ;;; but we do know the segment and offset of the routine
 27705                                  ;;; so simulate a far call to dosdata:magicpatch
 27706                                  ;;; note dosassume above, so DS -> dosdata
 27707                                  
 27708                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27709                                          ;clc				;clear carry so we fall through
 27710                                  	;				;if no patch is present
 27711                                  	;push	cs			;push segment for far return
 27712                                          ;call	callmagic		;this is a near call
 27713                                          ;jnc	short Regular_Allocate_Path
 27714                                  	;jmp	Disk_Full_Return
 27715                                  
 27716                                  ;Regular_Allocate_Path:
 27717                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27718                                  ;END MAGICDRV MODIFICATIONS
 27719                                  
 27720                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27721                                  	; DOSCODE:8D87h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27722                                  
 27723 00004EE3 53                              PUSH    BX                      ; save (bx)
 27724 00004EE4 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 27725 00004EE6 E82A07                  	call	UNPACK
 27726 00004EE9 893E[9605]                      MOV     [FATBYT],DI             ; save correct cluster 0 value
 27727 00004EED 5B                              POP     BX
 27728 00004EEE 72F2                            jc	short figrec_retn	; abort if error   [INTERR?]
 27729                                  
 27730 00004EF0 51                              PUSH    CX
 27731 00004EF1 53                              PUSH    BX
 27732                                  
 27733 00004EF2 89DA                            MOV     DX,BX
 27734                                  	;;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Ch]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 27735                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+1Dh]	; MSDOS 6.0
 27736 00004EF4 268B5E1D                        mov     bx,[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE]
 27737 00004EF8 83FB02                          cmp     bx,2
 27738 00004EFB 7709                            ja	short FINDFRE
 27739                                  
 27740                                  ;   couldn't find enough free space beyond dpb_next_free, or dpb_next_free is
 27741                                  ;   <2 or >dpb_max_clus. Reset it and restart the scan
 27742                                  
 27743                                  ads1:
 27744                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Ch],2 ; MSDOS 3.3
 27745                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Dh],2 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27746 00004EFD 26C7461D0200                    mov     word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 27747 00004F03 BB0100                          mov     bx,1                    ; Counter next instruction so first
 27748                                                                          ;       cluster examined is 2
 27749                                  
 27750                                  ;   Scanning both forwards and backwards for a free cluster
 27751                                  ;
 27752                                  ;       (BX) = forwards scan pointer
 27753                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 27754                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 27755                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file
 27756                                  
 27757                                  FINDFRE:
 27758 00004F06 43                              INC     BX
 27759                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 27760 00004F07 263B5E0D                        CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 27761 00004F0B 7757                    	ja	short ads7	; at end of disk
 27762 00004F0D E80307                          call	UNPACK          ; check out this cluster
 27763 00004F10 722F                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 27764 00004F12 75F2                            jnz	short FINDFRE	; not free, keep on truckin
 27765                                  
 27766                                  ;   Have found a free cluster. Chain it to the file
 27767                                  ;
 27768                                  ;       (BX) = found free cluster #
 27769                                  ;       (DX) = current last cluster in file
 27770                                  
 27771                                  	;;mov	[es:bp+1Ch],bx
 27772                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1Dh],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 27773 00004F14 26895E1D                        mov	[ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],bx ; next time start search here
 27774 00004F18 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; save (dx) in ax
 27775 00004F19 BA0100                          mov     dx,1            ; mark this free guy as "1"
 27776 00004F1C E84807                  	call	PACK            ; set special "temporary" mark
 27777 00004F1F 7220                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error             [INTERR?]
 27778                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 27779                                          ;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27780 00004F21 26837E1FFF              	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 27781 00004F26 7404                            JZ	short NO_ALLOC	; No
 27782                                  	;;dec	word [es:bp+1Eh]
 27783                                          ;dec	word [es:bp+1Fh] ; MSDOS 6.0
 27784 00004F28 26FF4E1F                        DEC     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Reduce free count by 1
 27785                                  NO_ALLOC:
 27786 00004F2C 92                              xchg    ax,dx           ; (dx) = current last cluster in file
 27787 00004F2D 87DA                            XCHG    BX,DX
 27788 00004F2F 89D0                            MOV     AX,DX
 27789 00004F31 E83307                  	call	PACK            ; link free cluster onto file
 27790                                                                  ;  CAVEAT.. On Nul file, first pass stuffs
 27791                                                                  ;    cluster 0 with FIRCLUS value.
 27792 00004F34 720B                            jc	short ads4	; FAT error [INTERR?]
 27793 00004F36 93                              xchg    BX,AX           ; (BX) = last one we looked at
 27794 00004F37 89DA                            mov     dx,bx           ; (dx) = current end of file
 27795 00004F39 E2CB                            LOOP    FINDFRE         ; alloc more if needed
 27796                                  
 27797                                  ;   We've successfully extended the file. Clean up and exit
 27798                                  ;
 27799                                  ;       (BX) = last cluster in file
 27800                                  
 27801 00004F3B BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 27802 00004F3E E82607                  	call	PACK            ; mark last cluster EOF
 27803                                  
 27804                                  ;   Note that FAT errors jump here to clean the stack and exit. This saves us
 27805                                  ;   2 whole bytes. Hope its worth it...
 27806                                  ;
 27807                                  ;       'C' set if error
 27808                                  ;       calling (BX) and (CX) pushed on stack
 27809                                  
 27810                                  ads4:   
 27811 00004F41 5B                      	POP     BX
 27812 00004F42 59                              POP     CX              ; Don't need this stuff since we're successful
 27813 00004F43 729D                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27814 00004F45 E8CB06                          call	UNPACK          ; Get first cluster allocated for return
 27815                                                                  ; CAVEAT... In nul file case, UNPACKs cluster 0.
 27816 00004F48 7298                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27817 00004F4A E83200                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Restore correct cluster 0 value
 27818 00004F4D 7293                            jc	short figrec_retn
 27819 00004F4F 87DF                            XCHG    BX,DI           ; (DI) = last cluster in file upon our entry
 27820 00004F51 09FF                            OR      DI,DI           ; clear 'C'
 27821 00004F53 758D                    	jnz	short figrec_retn ; we were extending an existing file
 27822                                  
 27823                                  ;   We were doing the first allocation for a new file. Update the SFT cluster
 27824                                  ;   info
 27825                                  dofastk:
 27826                                  	; 20/05/2019
 27827                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27828                                  	;push	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 27829                                  	;;mov	dl,[es:bp+0]
 27830                                  	;;MOV	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]	; get drive #
 27831                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 27832                                  
 27833                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27834                                  	; DOSCODE:8DF9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27835                                  	
 27836                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27837                                  	;push	dx ; *
 27838                                  	;mov	dl,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] 
 27839                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27840                                  	;mov	dl,[es:bp]
 27841                                  	
 27842                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 27843 00004F55 06                      	PUSH	ES
 27844 00004F56 C43E[9E05]              	LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 27845                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Bh],bx
 27846 00004F5A 26895D0B                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus],BX
 27847                                  	;;mov	[es:di+1Bh],bx ; MSDOS 3.3
 27848                                  	;mov	[es:di+35h],bx ; MSDOS 6.0
 27849 00004F5E 26895D35                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_lstclus],BX
 27850 00004F62 07                      	POP	ES
 27851                                  	;retn
 27852                                  
 27853                                  	;pop	dx ; * MSDOS 6.0
 27854                                  
 27855                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27856                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27857                                  	;pop	dx ; *
 27858                                  
 27859 00004F63 C3                      	retn	
 27860                                  
 27861                                  ;** we're at the end of the disk, and not satisfied. See if we've scanned ALL
 27862                                  ;   of the disk...
 27863                                  
 27864                                  ads7:   
 27865 00004F64 26837E1D02              	cmp	word [ES:BP+DPB.NEXT_FREE],2
 27866 00004F69 7592                    	jnz	short ads1	; start scan from front of disk
 27867                                  
 27868                                  ;   Sorry, we've gone over the whole disk, with insufficient luck. Lets give
 27869                                  ;   the space back to the free list and tell the caller how much he could have
 27870                                  ;   had.  We have to make sure we remove the "special mark" we put on the last
 27871                                  ;   cluster we were able to allocate, so it doesn't become orphaned.
 27872                                  ;
 27873                                  ;       (CX) = clusters remaining to be allocated
 27874                                  ;       (TOS) = last cluster of file (before call to ALLOCATE)
 27875                                  ;       (TOS+1) = # of clusters wanted to allocate
 27876                                  
 27877 00004F6B 5B                              POP     BX              ; (BX) = last cluster of file
 27878 00004F6C BAFFFF                          MOV     DX,0FFFFH
 27879 00004F6F E81F00                  	call	RELBLKS         ; give back any clusters just alloced
 27880 00004F72 58                              POP     AX              ; No. of clusters requested
 27881                                                                  ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 27882                                                                  ;   Alloc failed, so proceed with return CX
 27883                                                                  ;   setup.
 27884 00004F73 29C8                            SUB     AX,CX           ; AX=No. of clusters allocated
 27885 00004F75 E80700                  	call	RESTFATBYT      ; Don't "retc". We are setting Carry anyway,
 27886                                                                  ;   Alloc failed.
 27887                                  Disk_Full_Return:               ;label added for magic patch 8-6-92 scottq
 27888                                          ; MSDOS 6.0
 27889 00004F78 C606[0B06]01            	MOV	byte [DISK_FULL],1 ;MS. indicating disk full
 27890 00004F7D F9                              STC
 27891 00004F7E C3                              retn
 27892                                  
 27893                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27894                                  ;
 27895                                  ; Procedure Name : RESTFATBYT
 27896                                  ;
 27897                                  ; SEE ALLOCATE CAVEAT
 27898                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27899                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 27900                                  
 27901                                  RESTFATBYT:
 27902 00004F7F 53                              PUSH    BX
 27903 00004F80 52                              PUSH    DX
 27904 00004F81 57                              PUSH    DI
 27905 00004F82 31DB                            XOR     BX,BX
 27906 00004F84 8B16[9605]                      MOV     DX,[FATBYT]
 27907 00004F88 E8DC06                  	call	PACK
 27908 00004F8B 5F                              POP     DI
 27909 00004F8C 5A                              POP     DX
 27910 00004F8D 5B                              POP     BX
 27911                                  ; 16/12/2022
 27912                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27913                                  ;RELEASE_flush:
 27914 00004F8E C3                      	retn
 27915                                  
 27916                                  ;Break	<RELEASE -- DEASSIGN DISK SPACE>
 27917                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27918                                  ;
 27919                                  ; Procedure Name : RELEASE
 27920                                  ;
 27921                                  ; Inputs:
 27922                                  ;       BX = Cluster in file
 27923                                  ;       ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 27924                                  ; Function:
 27925                                  ;       Frees cluster chain starting with [BX]
 27926                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27927                                  ; AX,BX,DX,DI all destroyed. Other registers unchanged.
 27928                                  ;
 27929                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27930                                  
 27931                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27932                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27933                                  RELEASE:
 27934 00004F8F 31D2                            XOR     DX,DX
 27935                                  
 27936                                  	;entry	RELBLKS
 27937                                  RELBLKS:
 27938                                  
 27939                                  ;   Enter here with DX=0FFFFH to put an end-of-file mark in the first cluster
 27940                                  ;   and free the rest in the chain.
 27941                                  
 27942 00004F91 E87F06                  	call	UNPACK
 27943 00004F94 7224                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 27944 00004F96 7422                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush
 27945 00004F98 89F8                            MOV     AX,DI
 27946 00004F9A 52                              PUSH    DX
 27947 00004F9B E8C906                  	call	PACK
 27948 00004F9E 5A                              POP     DX
 27949 00004F9F 7219                    	jc	short RELEASE_flush
 27950 00004FA1 09D2                            OR      DX,DX
 27951 00004FA3 750B                            JNZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; Was putting EOF mark
 27952                                  	;;cmp	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1 ; MSDOS 3.3
 27953                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 27954 00004FA5 26837E1FFF              	CMP     word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Free count valid?
 27955 00004FAA 7404                            JZ	short NO_DEALLOC	; No
 27956 00004FAC 26FF461F                        INC	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT] ; Increase free count by 1
 27957                                  NO_DEALLOC:
 27958 00004FB0 89C3                            MOV     BX,AX
 27959 00004FB2 48                              dec     ax              ; check for "1"
 27960 00004FB3 7405                    	jz	short RELEASE_flush	; is last cluster of incomplete chain
 27961 00004FB5 E84406                  	call	IsEOF
 27962 00004FB8 72D5                            JB	short RELEASE	; Carry clear if JMP not taken
 27963                                  
 27964                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27965                                  ; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27966                                  ;%if 0
 27967                                  RELEASE_flush:
 27968                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27969 00004FBA 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27970                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 27971 00004FBE 56                      	push	si		; FLUSHBUF may trash these and we guarantee
 27972 00004FBF 51                      	push	cx		;  them to be preserved.
 27973 00004FC0 06                      	push	es
 27974 00004FC1 55                      	push	bp
 27975 00004FC2 E86E0B                  	call	FLUSHBUF	; commit buffers for this drive
 27976 00004FC5 5D                      	pop	bp
 27977 00004FC6 07                      	pop	es
 27978 00004FC7 59                      	pop	cx
 27979 00004FC8 5E                      	pop	si
 27980                                  ;%endif
 27981                                  RET12:
 27982 00004FC9 C3                      	retn
 27983                                  
 27984                                  ;Break	<GETEOF -- Find the end of a file>
 27985                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27986                                  ;
 27987                                  ; Procedure Name : GETEOF
 27988                                  ;
 27989                                  ; Inputs:
 27990                                  ;       ES:BP Points to DPB
 27991                                  ;       BX = Cluster in a file
 27992                                  ;       DS = CS
 27993                                  ; Outputs:
 27994                                  ;       BX = Last cluster in the file
 27995                                  ;       Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27996                                  ; DI destroyed. No other registers affected.
 27997                                  ;
 27998                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27999                                  
 28000                                  GETEOF:
 28001 00004FCA E84606                  	call	UNPACK
 28002 00004FCD 72FA                            jc	short RET12
 28003 00004FCF 53                              PUSH    BX
 28004 00004FD0 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28005 00004FD2 E82706                  	call	IsEOF
 28006 00004FD5 5B                              POP     BX
 28007 00004FD6 73F1                            JAE     short RET12
 28008 00004FD8 89FB                            MOV     BX,DI
 28009 00004FDA EBEE                            JMP     short GETEOF
 28010

 28016                                  
 28017                                  ;	TITLE	FCB - FCB parse calls for MSDOS
 28018                                  ;	NAME	FCB
 28019                                  
 28020                                  ;**	FCB.ASM - Low level routines for parsing names into FCBs and analyzing
 28021                                  ;		  filename characters
 28022                                  ;
 28023                                  ;	MakeFcb
 28024                                  ;	NameTrans
 28025                                  ;	PATHCHRCMP
 28026                                  ;	GetLet
 28027                                  ;	UCase
 28028                                  ;	GetLet3
 28029                                  ;	GetCharType
 28030                                  ;	TESTKANJ
 28031                                  ;	NORMSCAN
 28032                                  ;	DELIM
 28033                                  ;
 28034                                  ;	Revision history:
 28035                                  ;
 28036                                  ;		A000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 28037                                  ;	
 28038                                  ;	M048 - access FILE_UCASE_TAB using DS rather than SS.
 28039                                  
 28040                                  TableLook	EQU	-1
 28041                                  
 28042                                  SCANSEPARATOR	EQU	1
 28043                                  DRVBIT		EQU	2
 28044                                  NAMBIT		EQU	4
 28045                                  EXTBIT		EQU	8
 28046                                  
 28047                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28048                                  ;
 28049                                  ; Procedure : MakeFcb
 28050                                  ;
 28051                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28052                                  
 28053                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28054                                  	; DOSCODE:8E77h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28055                                  MAKEFCB:
 28056                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28057 00004FDC 36C606[4E03]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],0
 28058 00004FE2 30D2                    	XOR	DL,DL		; Flag--not ambiguous file name
 28059                                  	;test	al,2
 28060 00004FE4 A802                    	test	AL,DRVBIT	; Use current drive field if default?
 28061 00004FE6 7504                    	JNZ	short DEFDRV
 28062 00004FE8 26C60500                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0	; No - use default drive
 28063                                  DEFDRV:
 28064 00004FEC 47                      	INC	DI
 28065 00004FED B90800                  	MOV	CX,8
 28066                                  	;test	al,4
 28067 00004FF0 A804                    	test	AL,NAMBIT	; Use current name fields as default?
 28068 00004FF2 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX		; Save bits in BX
 28069 00004FF3 B020                    	MOV	AL," "
 28070 00004FF5 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB	; If not, go fill with blanks
 28071 00004FF7 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28072 00004FF9 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX		; Don't fill any
 28073                                  FILLB:
 28074 00004FFB F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28075 00004FFD B103                    	MOV	CL,3
 28076 00004FFF F6C308                  	test	BL,EXTBIT	; Use current extension as default
 28077 00005002 7404                    	JZ	short FILLB2
 28078 00005004 01CF                    	ADD	DI,CX
 28079 00005006 31C9                    	XOR	CX,CX
 28080                                  FILLB2:
 28081 00005008 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28082 0000500A 91                      	XCHG	AX,CX		; Put zero in AX
 28083 0000500B AB                      	STOSW
 28084 0000500C AB                      	STOSW			; Initialize two words after to zero
 28085 0000500D 83EF10                  	SUB	DI,16		; Point back at start
 28086                                  	;test	bl,1
 28087 00005010 F6C301                  	test	BL,SCANSEPARATOR; Scan off separators if not zero
 28088 00005013 7409                    	JZ	short SKPSPC
 28089 00005015 E88D00                  	CALL	SCANB		; Peel off blanks and tabs
 28090 00005018 E82701                  	CALL	DELIM		; Is it a one-time-only delimiter?
 28091 0000501B 7504                    	JNZ	short NOSCAN
 28092 0000501D 46                      	INC	SI		; Skip over the delimiter
 28093                                  SKPSPC:

 28107 00005035 730A                    	JNC	short HAVDRV
 28108

 28110                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 28112 00005037 36803E[1006]1A          	CMP	byte [SS:DrvErr],error_not_DOS_disk ; 1Ah
 28113                                  					; if not FAT drive ;AN000;
 28114 0000503D 7402                    	JZ	short HAVDRV		; assume ok	   ;AN000;

 28144                                  contvol:

 28148

 28213                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28214                                  ;
 28215                                  ; Procedure Name : NameTrans
 28216                                  ;
 28217                                  ; NameTrans is used by FindPath to scan off an element of a path. We must
 28218                                  ; allow spaces in pathnames
 28219                                  ;
 28220                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI points to start of path element
 28221                                  ;   Outputs:	Name1 has unpacked name, uppercased
 28222                                  ;		ES = DOSGroup
 28223                                  ;		DS:SI advanced after name
 28224                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AX,DX,CX
 28225                                  ;
 28226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28227                                  
 28228                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28229                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28230                                  NameTrans:
 28231                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28232 000050AD 36C606[4E03]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SpaceFlag],1
 28233 000050B3 16                      	push	ss
 28234 000050B4 07                      	pop	es
 28235                                  
 28236                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28237 000050B5 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28238 000050B8 57                      	PUSH	DI
 28239 000050B9 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  '
 28240 000050BC B90500                  	MOV	CX,5
 28241 000050BF AA                      	STOSB
 28242 000050C0 F3AB                    	REP	STOSW		; Fill "FCB" at NAME1 with spaces
 28243 000050C2 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL		; Set stuff for NORMSCAN
 28244 000050C4 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 28245 000050C6 AA                      	STOSB
 28246 000050C7 5F                      	POP	DI
 28247                                  
 28248 000050C8 E87BFF                  	CALL	NORMSCAN
 28249                                  
 28250                                  ;hkn; SS override for NAME1
 28251 000050CB 36803E[4B05]E5          	CMP	byte [SS:NAME1],0E5H
 28252 000050D1 75D9                    	jnz	short scanb_retn
 28253 000050D3 36C606[4B05]05          	MOV	byte [SS:NAME1],5 ; Magic name translation
 28254 000050D9 C3                      	retn

 28262                                  ;If TableLook
 28263                                  
 28264                                  ;hkn; Table	SEGMENT
 28265                                  ;	PUBLIC	CharType
 28266                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28267                                  
 28268                                  ; Character type table for file name scanning
 28269                                  ; Table provides a mapping of characters to validity bits.
 28270                                  ; Four bits are provided for each character. Values 7Dh and above
 28271                                  ; have all bits set, so that part of the table is chopped off, and
 28272                                  ; the translation routine is responsible for screening these values.
 28273                                  ; The bit values are defined in DOSSYM.INC
 28274                                  
 28275                                  ;	      ; ^A and NUL
 28276                                  ;CharType:
 28277                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28278                                  ;	      ; ^C and ^B
 28279                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28280                                  ;	      ; ^E and ^D
 28281                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28282                                  ;	      ; ^G and ^F
 28283                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28284                                  ;	      ; TAB and BS
 28285                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28286                                  ;	      ; ^K and ^J
 28287                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28288                                  ;	      ; ^M and ^L
 28289                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28290                                  ;	      ; ^O and ^N
 28291                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28292                                  ;	      ; ^Q and ^P
 28293                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28294                                  ;	      ; ^S and ^R
 28295                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28296                                  ;	      ; ^U and ^T
 28297                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28298                                  ;	      ; ^W and ^V
 28299                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28300                                  ;	      ; ^Y and ^X
 28301                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28302                                  ;	      ; ESC and ^Z
 28303                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28304                                  ;	      ; ^] and ^;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28306                                  ;	      ; ^_ and ^^
 28307                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28308                                  ;	      ; ! and SPACE
 28309                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FCHK+FDELIM+FSPCHK)
 28310                                  ;	      ; # and "
 28311                                  ;	 db   LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK)
 28312                                  ;	      ; $ - )
 28313                                  ;	 db   3 dup (0FFh)
 28314                                  ;	      ; + and *
 28315                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28316                                  ;	      ; - and '
 28317                                  ;	 db   NOT (FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM)
 28318                                  ;	      ; / and .
 28319                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28320                                  ;	      ; 0 - 9
 28321                                  ;	 db   5 dup (0FFh)
 28322                                  ;	      ; ; and :
 28323                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28324                                  ;	      ; = and <
 28325                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM) AND 0Fh
 28326                                  ;	      ; ? and >
 28327                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28328                                  ;	      ; A - Z
 28329                                  ;	 db   13 dup (0FFh)
 28330                                  ;	      ; \ and [
 28331                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR 0Fh
 28332                                  ;	      ; ^ and ]
 28333                                  ;	 db   LOW ((NOT FFCB+FCHK) SHL 4) OR LOW (NOT FFCB+FCHK) AND 0Fh
 28334                                  ;	      ; _ - {
 28335                                  ;	 db   15 dup (0FFh)
 28336                                  ;	      ; } and |
 28337                                  ;	 db   NOT FFCB+FCHK+FDELIM
 28338                                  
 28339                                  ;CharType_last equ ($ - CharType) * 2	; This is the value of the last
 28340                                  ;					; character in the table
 28341                                  
 28342                                  ;FCHK	equ 1		; normal name char, no chks needed
 28343                                  ;FDELIM	equ 2		; is a delimiter

 28345                                  ;FFCB	equ 8		; is valid in an FCB

 28406                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28407                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28408                                  
 28409                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28410                                  ;
 28411                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 28412                                  ;
 28413                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 28414                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 28415                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 28416                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 28417                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 28418                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 28419                                  ;
 28420                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 28421                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 28422                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 28423                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 28424                                  ;
 28425                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 28426                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 28427                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 28428                                  ;
 28429                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28430                                  
 28431                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 28432                                  
 28433                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 28434                                  GETLET:	
 28435 00005119 AC                      	LODSB
 28436                                  
 28437                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 28438                                  
 28439                                  	;entry	UCase
 28440                                  UCase:	
 28441                                  	; 09/08/2018
 28442                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 28443                                  _UCase:
 28444 0000511A 53                      	PUSH	BX
 28445 0000511B BB[310B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 28446                                  
 28447                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 28448                                  
 28449                                  gl_0:
 28450 0000511E 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 28451 00005120 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 28452 00005122 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 28453 00005124 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 28454 00005126 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 28455                                  
 28456                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 28457                                  
 28458                                  gl_1:
 28459 00005128 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 28460 0000512A 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 28461 0000512C 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 28462                                  
 28463                                  	; M048 - Start 
 28464                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 28465                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 28466                                  	; preserve it.
 28467                                  
 28468                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28469                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28470                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 28471                                  	;CS	XLAT
 28472                                  
 28473                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28474                                  
 28475                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28476 0000512E 1E                      	push	ds
 28477                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 28478 0000512F 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 28479 00005134 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 28480 00005135 1F                      	pop	ds
 28481                                  
 28482                                  	; M048 - End
 28483                                  
 28484                                  ; Now check the type
 28485                                  
 28486                                  ;If TableLook
 28487                                  gl_2:
 28488                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28489 00005136 50                      	PUSH	AX
 28490                                  
 28491                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28492                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 28493                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 28494                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 28495                                  	;cs	xlat	
 28496                                  	
 28497                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28498 00005137 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 28499                                  	
 28500                                  	;test	al,1	
 28501 0000513A A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 28502 0000513C 58                      	POP	AX
 28503 0000513D 5B                      	POP	BX
 28504 0000513E C3                      	RETN
 28505                                  
 28506                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 28507                                  
 28508                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28509                                  ;	;entry GetLet3

 28618                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28619                                  ;
 28620                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 28621                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 28622                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 28623                                  ;
 28624                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 28625                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 28626                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 28627                                  ;
 28628                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28629                                  
 28630                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28631                                  
 28632                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28633                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28634                                  GetCharType:
 28635                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 28636 00005152 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 28637 00005154 7316                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 28638                                  
 28639 00005156 53                      	push	bx
 28640 00005157 BB[DA50]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 28641 0000515A D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 28642                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 28643 0000515C 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 28644 0000515E 5B                      	pop	bx
 28645                                  
 28646                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 28647                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 28648                                  
 28649 0000515F 7308                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 28650                                  
 28651 00005161 D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 28652 00005163 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28653 00005165 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28654 00005167 D0E8                    	shr	al,1
 28655                                  gct_80:
 28656 00005169 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 28657 0000516B C3                      	retn
 28658                                  gct_90:
 28659 0000516C B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 28660 0000516E C3                      	retn
 28661

 28675 00005178 C3                      	retn
 28676                                  PathRet:
 28677 00005179 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 28678 0000517B C3                      	retn

 28688                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 28689                                  
 28690                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 28691                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 28692                                  
 28693                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 28694                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 28695                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 28696                                  ;
 28697                                  ;	FATAL
 28698                                  ;	FATAL1
 28699                                  ;	reset_environment
 28700                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 28701                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 28702                                  ;	STATCHK
 28703                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 28704                                  ;	DIVOV
 28705                                  ;	CHARHARD
 28706                                  ;	HardErr
 28707                                  ;
 28708                                  ;	Revision history:
 28709                                  ;
 28710                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 28711                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 28712                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 28713                                  ;
 28714                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 28715                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 28716                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 28717                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 28718                                  ;
 28719                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 28720                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 28721                                  ;	      charhard.
 28722

 29057                                  
 29058                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29059                                  ;
 29060                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 29061                                  ;
 29062                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 29063                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 29064                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 29065                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 29066                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 29067                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 29068                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 29069                                  ; is simulated.
 29070                                  ;
 29071                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29072                                  
 29073                                  CNTCHAND:
 29074                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 29075                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 29076                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 29077                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29078                                  
 29079                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29080 000052C7 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 29081 000052CD 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 29082                                  
 29083 000052CF B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 29084 000052D1 E8A3C4                          CALL	BUFOUT
 29085 000052D4 E83EC3                          CALL	CRLF
 29086                                  around_deadlock:
 29087 000052D7 16                              PUSH    SS
 29088 000052D8 1F                              POP     DS
 29089 000052D9 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 29090 000052DE 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 29091 000052E0 E856E0                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 29092                                  NOSWAP:
 29093 000052E3 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 29094 000052E4 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 29095 000052E8 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 29096 000052EC E8A5B1                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 29097                                  
 29098                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 29099                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 29100                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 29101                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 29102                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 29103                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 29104                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 29105                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29106                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 29107                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 29108                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 29109                                  			; else
 29110                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 29111                                  
 29112                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29113                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 29114                                  
 29115                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 29116

 29120                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 29121 000052F1 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 29122 000052F6 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 29123 000052FB C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 29124 00005300 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 29125                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 29126 00005304 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 29127                                  
 29128 00005309 803E[1112]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 29129 0000530E 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 29130 0000530F 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 29131 00005311 F8                      	CLC				
 29132 00005312 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 29133 00005314 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 29134

 29136                                  do_low_int23:
 29137 00005316 F8                      	clc
 29138 00005317 2EFF1E[7C51]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]	
 29139                                  
 29140                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 29141                                  
 29142                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 29143                                  
 29144                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 29145                                  ;
 29146                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 29147                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 29148                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 29149                                  ;

 29411                                  ;
 29412                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 29413                                  ;
 29414                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 29415                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 29416                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 29417                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 29418                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 29419                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 29420                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 29421                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 29422                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 29423                                  ; Output:
 29424                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 29425                                  ;
 29426                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29427                                  
 29428                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 29497 0000542B 368C06[8205]            	MOV     [SS:EXITHOLD+2],ES
 29498 00005430 36892E[8005]                    MOV     [SS:EXITHOLD],BP	; The only things we preserve

 29501 00005435 26C47613                	LES	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR]
 29502 00005439 8CC5                            MOV     BP,ES                   ; BP:SI points to the device involved
 29503                                  
 29504                                  	; DI has the INT-24-style extended error. We now map the error code 
 29505                                  	; for this into the normalized get extended error set by using the 
 29506                                  	; ErrMap24 table as a translate table. Note that we translate ONLY 
 29507                                  	; the device returned codes and leave all others beyond the look up 
 29508                                  	; table alone.

 29693                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29694                                  ;
 29695                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 29696                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 29697                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 29698                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 29699                                  ;
 29700                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 29701                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 29702                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 29703                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 29704                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 29705                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 29706                                  ;
 29707                                  ; output:   none.
 29708                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29709                                  
 29710                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 29711                                  	
 29712                                  reset_environment:

 29717

 29719                                  
 29720                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter 
 29721                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 29722                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.

 29735                                  					; On process exit.
