 29921                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29922                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29923                                  
 29924                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 29925                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 29926                                  
 29927                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 29928                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29929                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 29930                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 29931                                  ;
 29932                                  ;	IsEof
 29933                                  ;	UNPACK
 29934                                  ;	PACK
 29935                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 29936                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 29937                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 29938                                  ;	FAT_operation
 29939                                  ;
 29940                                  ;	Revision history:
 29941                                  ;
 29942                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 29943                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 29944                                  ;
 29945                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 29946                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 29947                                  
 29948                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29949                                  
 29950                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 29951                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29952                                  ;
 29953                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 29954                                  ;
 29955                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 29956                                  ;
 29957                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 29958                                  ;		BX has fat value
 29959                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 29960                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 29961                                  ;
 29962                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29963                                  
 29964                                  IsEOF:
 29965                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 29966 000055FC 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 29967 00005602 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 29968                                  
 29969                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 29970                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 29971                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 29972                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 29973                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 29974                                  
 29975 00005604 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 29976 00005608 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 29977                                  
 29978 0000560A 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 29979                                  IsEOF_other:
 29980 0000560E C3                      	retn
 29981                                  EOF16:
 29982 0000560F 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 29983 00005612 C3                      	retn
 29984                                  
 29985                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 29986                                  
 29987                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 29988                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29989                                  ;
 29990                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 29991                                  ;
 29992                                  ; Inputs:
 29993                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 29994                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 29995                                  ; Outputs:
 29996                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 29997                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 29998                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 29999                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 30000                                  ;
 30001                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 30002                                  ;
 30003                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30004                                  	
 30005                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30006                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30007                                  
 30008                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30009                                  UNPACK:
 30010                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 30011 00005613 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 30012 00005615 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 30013 00005617 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 30014 0000561B 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 30015 0000561D C3                      	retn				; done
 30016                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 30017                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30018                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 30019 0000561E 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 30020 00005622 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 30021 00005624 E8DC00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30022 00005627 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 30023 00005629 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 30024 0000562B 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 30025 0000562D 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 30026 00005631 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 30027 00005635 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 30028 00005637 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 30029 00005639 EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 30030                                  High12:
 30031 0000563B D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30032 0000563D D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30033 0000563F D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30034 00005641 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 30035                                  Unpack12:
 30036 00005643 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 30037                                  _DoContext:
 30038 00005647 16                      	PUSH	SS
 30039 00005648 1F                      	POP	DS
 30040 00005649 C3                      	retn
 30041                                  HURTFAT:
 30042                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 30043                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 30044 0000564A 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 30045 00005650 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30046 00005651 B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 30047                                  
 30048                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30049 00005653 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 30050                                  ;
 30051                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 30052                                  ;
 30053 00005659 BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 30054 0000565C E8C8FD                  	call	FATAL
 30055 0000565F 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 30056 00005661 F8                      	CLC
 30057 00005662 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 30058 00005664 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 30059                                  OKU_RET:
 30060 00005665 58                      	POP	AX
 30061                                  hurtfat_retn:
 30062 00005666 C3                      	retn
 30063                                  
 30064                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30065                                  
 30066                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 30067                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30068                                  ;
 30069                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 30070                                  ;
 30071                                  ; Inputs:
 30072                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 30073                                  ;	DX = Data
 30074                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 30075                                  ; Outputs:
 30076                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 30077                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 30078                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30079                                  ;	No other registers affected
 30080                                  ;
 30081                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 30082                                  ;
 30083                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30084                                  
 30085                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30086                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30087                                  PACK:
 30088                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 30089 00005667 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 30090 00005669 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 30091 0000566B 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 30092 0000566F C3                      	retn				; done
 30093                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 30094                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30095 00005670 E89000                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 30096 00005673 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 30097 00005675 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 30098 00005677 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 30099 00005679 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 30100 0000567A B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 30101 0000567C D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 30102 0000567E 59                      	POP	CX
 30103 0000567F 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 30104 00005682 EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 30105                                  ALIGNED:
 30106                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 30107 00005684 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 30108 0000568A 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 30109 0000568C 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 30110 00005690 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 30111 00005694 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 30112                                  Pack16:
 30113 00005696 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 30114                                  PACKIN:
 30115 00005698 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 30116 0000569A 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 30117                                  
 30118                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30119 0000569C 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 30120                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30121 000056A1 F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30122                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 30123 000056A5 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 30124                                  	; 10/06/2019
 30125 000056A7 E89105                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 30126                                  	
 30127                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 30128 000056AA 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30129                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 30130                                  ;hkn; SS override
 30131 000056AE 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 30132                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30133 000056B4 16                      	push	ss
 30134 000056B5 1F                      	pop	ds
 30135 000056B6 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 30136 000056B8 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30137 000056B9 53                      	PUSH	BX
 30138 000056BA 51                      	PUSH	CX
 30139 000056BB A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 30140 000056BE 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 30141                                  	;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 30142                                  	;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30143 000056C2 83C614                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 30144 000056C5 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 30145                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30146                                  	;Context DS
 30147 000056C7 16                      	push	ss
 30148 000056C8 1F                      	pop	ds
 30149                                  	
 30150 000056C9 50                      	PUSH	AX
 30151                                  	
 30152                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30153 000056CA 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30154 000056CE 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 30155                                  
 30156                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 30157 000056D2 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 30158 000056D6 BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30159 000056D9 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30160 000056DB E85903                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30161 000056DE 58                      	POP	AX
 30162 000056DF 721C                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 30163 000056E1 C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 30164                                  	
 30165                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30166 000056E5 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 30167                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 30168 000056E9 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty12	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 30169 000056EB E84D05                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 30170                                  	
 30171                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 30172 000056EE 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 30173                                  yesdirty12:
 30174                                  	;;add	di,16
 30175                                  	;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 30176 000056F2 83C714                  	ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 30177 000056F5 4F                      	DEC	DI
 30178                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 30179 000056F6 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30180 000056FA 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 30181 000056FC F8                      	CLC
 30182                                  POPP_RET:

 30184 000056FE 1F                      	POP	DS
 30185 000056FF 59                      	POP	CX
 30186 00005700 5B                      	POP	BX
 30187 00005701 58                      	POP	AX
 30188 00005702 C3                      	retn

 30192                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 30193                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30194                                  ;
 30195                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 30196                                  ;
 30197                                  ; Inputs:
 30198                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 30199                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 30200                                  ; Function:
 30201                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 30202                                  ; Outputs:
 30203                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 30204                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 30205                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 30206                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 30207                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 30208                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 30209                                  ;
 30210                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30211                                  
 30212                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30213                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30214                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30215                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30216                                  
 30217                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 30218                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 30219 00005703 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 30220                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 30221 00005708 50                      	push	ax
 30222 00005709 53                      	push	bx
 30223 0000570A 51                      	push	cx
 30224 0000570B 52                      	push	dx
 30225 0000570C 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 30226 0000570E 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 30227 00005714 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 30228 00005716 D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 30229                                  Map16:	
 30230                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 30231 00005718 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 30232                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30233 0000571A 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 30234 0000571C 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 30235 0000571E 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 30236                                  
 30237                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30238                                  ;
 30239                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 30240                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 30241                                  ;
 30242                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 30243                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 30244                                  ;
 30245                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 30246                                  
 30247 00005722 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 30248 00005726 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 30249 00005728 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 30250 0000572A 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 30251 0000572E 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 30252                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 30253                                  	;shr	al,1	
 30254                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 30255 00005730 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 30256 00005732 D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 30257                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30258 00005734 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 30259 00005736 EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 30260                                  _DoDiv:
 30261                                  ;ENDIF
 30262                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 30263                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 30264                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30265 00005738 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 30266                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 30267 0000573A F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 30268                                  ;IF FastDiv
 30269                                  DivDone:
 30270                                  ;ENDIF
 30271                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 30272 0000573C 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 30273 00005740 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 30274                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 30275 00005741 50                      	push	ax
 30276 00005742 52                      	push	dx
 30277 00005743 51                      	push	cx
 30278 00005744 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 30279                                  
 30280                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30281 00005746 C706[0706]0000          	MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 	;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 30282                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30283 0000574C 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30284 0000574E BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30285                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFRB
 30286 00005751 E8E302                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30287                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 30288 00005754 59                      	pop	cx
 30289 00005755 58                      	pop	ax
 30290 00005756 5A                      	pop	dx
 30291 00005757 7257                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30292                                  
 30293 00005759 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 30294                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 30295                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30296 0000575D 8D7C14                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 30297 00005760 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 30298 00005762 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 30299 00005764 7537                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 30300 00005766 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 30301                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30302 00005768 16                      	push	ss
 30303 00005769 1F                      	pop	ds	
 30304 0000576A FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 30305 0000576E A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 30306 00005771 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 30307                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30308 00005775 C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 30309 0000577B 42                      	INC	DX
 30310 0000577C C706[0706]0000          	MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 30311                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 30312 00005782 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 30313 00005784 BE0100                  	MOV	SI,1
 30314                                  	;invoke	GETBUFFRB
 30315 00005787 E8AD02                  	call	GETBUFFRB
 30316 0000578A 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 30317 0000578C C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 30318 00005790 8D7C14                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 30319 00005793 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 30320                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30321 00005795 16                      	push	ss
 30322 00005796 1F                      	pop	ds
 30323 00005797 A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 30324                                  
 30325                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 30326 0000579A BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 30327                                  MAPRET:
 30328                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 30329 0000579D 5A                      	pop	dx
 30330 0000579E 59                      	pop	cx
 30331 0000579F 5B                      	pop	bx
 30332 000057A0 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 30333 000057A2 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 30334 000057A8 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 30335 000057AA 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 30336                                  MapSet:
 30337 000057AC A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 30338                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 30339 000057AE 58                      	pop	ax
 30340 000057AF C3                      	retn
 30341                                  
 30342                                  MAP_POP:
 30343                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 30344 000057B0 5A                      	pop	dx
 30345 000057B1 59                      	pop	cx
 30346 000057B2 5B                      	pop	bx
 30347 000057B3 58                      	pop	ax
 30348                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 30349 000057B4 C3                      	retn
 30350                                  
 30351                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30352                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30353                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30354                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30355                                  
 30356                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 30357                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30358                                  ;
 30359                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 30360                                  ;
 30361                                  ; Inputs:
 30362                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of intrest (local only,
 30363                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 30364                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 30365                                  ; Function:
 30366                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 30367                                  ;	if disk changed.
 30368                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 30369                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 30370                                  ; Outputs:
 30371                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30372                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 30373                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 30374                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 30375                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 30376                                  ;
 30377                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30378                                  
 30379                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 30380 000057B5 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 30381                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30382                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 30383                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30384 000057B9 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 30385 000057BD A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 30386 000057C0 E8B8AE                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 30387                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30388                                  	; 17/12/2022
 30389 000057C3 EB78                    	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30390                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 30391                                  	;retn
 30392                                  
 30393                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30394                                  ;
 30395                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 30396                                  ;
 30397                                  ; Inputs:
 30398                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 30399                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of intrest (local only,
 30400                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 30401                                  ; Function:
 30402                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 30403                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 30404                                  ; Outputs:
 30405                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 30406                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 30407                                  ;	THISDRV set
 30408                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 30409                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 30410                                  ;
 30411                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30412                                  
 30413                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30414                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30415                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30416                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30417                                  
 30418                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 30419 000057C5 06                      	PUSH	ES
 30420 000057C6 57                      	PUSH	DI
 30421                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 30422 000057C7 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 30423                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30424                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 30425                                  	; 15/12/2022
 30426 000057CB 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 30427 000057CF A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 30428 000057D2 E8A6AE                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 30429 000057D5 E86500                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 30430 000057D8 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 30431 000057D9 07                      	POP	ES
 30432 000057DA 72D8                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 30433 000057DC 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 30434                                  
 30435                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 30436                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 30437                                  
 30438                                  MED_CHANGE:
 30439 000057DE 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 30440 000057E0 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 30441 000057E1 1E                      	PUSH	DS

 30506                                  FATERR:

 30523 0000583C C3                      	retn

 30561                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 30562 00005874 26866618                	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 30563 00005878 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Use physical unit number
 30564                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 30565 0000587B 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 30566 0000587F 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT

 30568 00005886 E9A700                  	jmp	GOGETBPB		; Need to get device driver to read in
 30569                                  					; new volume label.
 30570                                  CHECK_BYT:

 30572                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 30573                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 30574                                  	; 17/12/2022
 30575 0000588D 7865                    	js	short NEWDSK
 30576                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 30577                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 30578                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK

 30611                                  	;invoke	HARDERR

 30614 000058C5 1F                      	POP	DS

 30856                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30857                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 - 12/03/2018
 30858                                  ;
 30859                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 30860                                  ;
 30861                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 30862                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 30863                                  ;
 30864                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 30865                                  ;
 30866                                  ;SETVISIT:
 30867                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30868                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 30869                                  ;; Inputs:
 30870                                  ;;      None
 30871                                  ;; Function:
 30872                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 30873                                  ;; Outputs:
 30874                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 30875                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 30876                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 30877                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 30878                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 30879                                  ;; No other registers altered
 30880                                  ;
 30881                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 30882                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 30883                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 30884                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 30885                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 30886                                  ;SETLOOP:
 30887                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 30888                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 30889                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 30890                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 30891                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 30892                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 30893                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 30894                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 30895                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 30896                                  ;       RETN
 30897                                  ;
 30898                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 30899                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 30900                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 30901                                  ;
 30902                                  ;; Inputs:
 30903                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 30904                                  ;; Function:
 30905                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 30906                                  ;; Outputs:
 30907                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 30908                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 30909                                  ;; No other registers altered
 30910                                  ;
 30911                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 30912                                  ;       ;retz
 30913                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 30914                                  ;
 30915                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 30916                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 30917                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 30918                                  ;
 30919                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 30920                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 30921                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 30922                                  ;	
 30923                                  ;	push	ax
 30924                                  ;	or	al,1
 30925                                  ;	pop	ax
 30926                                  ;	retn

 30961                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 30962                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30963                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 30964                                  ; Inputs:
 30965                                  ;	 No Inputs
 30966                                  ; Function:
 30967                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 30968                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 30969                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 30970                                  ; Outputs:
 30971                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 30972                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 30973                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 30974                                  ; No other registers altered
 30975                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30976                                  
 30977                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30978                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 30979                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 30980                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 30981                                  
 30982                                  GETCURHEAD:
 30983 000059D0 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 30984 000059D5 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 30985 000059DC 36893E[BB0E]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	;save first buffer addr
 30986 000059E1 C3                      	retn
 30987

 31013                                  ;	retn

 31208                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 31209                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31210                                  ;
 31211                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 31212                                  ; Inputs:
 31213                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 31214                                  ; Function:
 31215                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 31216                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 31217                                  ;	   same segment
 31218                                  ;
 31219                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 31220                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 31221                                  ; No Registers altered
 31222                                  ;
 31223                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31224                                  
 31225                                  POINTCOMP:
 31226                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31227                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 31228 00005A26 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 31229 00005A28 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 31230                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 31231 00005A2A 51                      	PUSH	CX
 31232 00005A2B 52                      	PUSH	DX
 31233 00005A2C 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 31234 00005A2E 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 31235 00005A30 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 31236 00005A32 5A                      	POP	DX
 31237 00005A33 59                      	POP	CX
 31238                                  _ret_label:
 31239 00005A34 C3                      	retn
 31240                                  
 31241                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31242                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 31243                                  
 31244                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 31245                                  
 31246                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31247                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31248                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 31249                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31250                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 31251                                  ; 
 31252                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31253                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31254                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 31255                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31256                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31257                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31258                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31259                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31260                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31261                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31262                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31263                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31264                                  
 31265                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 31266                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31267                                  ;	GetBuffr reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 31268                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 31269                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 31270                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 31271                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 31272                                  ; 
 31273                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 31274                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 31275                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 31276                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 31277                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 31278                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 31279                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 31280                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 31281                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 31282                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 31283                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 31284                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 31285                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31286                                  
 31287                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31288                                  	; DOSCODE:9937h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 31289                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 31290                                  	; DOSCODE:98DBh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 31291                                  GETBUFFR:
 31292 00005A35 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI
 31293                                  
 31294                                  ;	This entry point is called for FAT buffering with SI != 0
 31295                                  
 31296                                  GETBUFFRB:
 31297 00005A37 A3[9405]                	MOV	[PREREAD],AX			; save pre-read flag
 31298                                  	; 15/12/2022
 31299 00005A3A 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 31300                                  	; 27/11/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31301                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; mov al,[es:bp+0]
 31302 00005A3E C53E[1E00]              	LDS	DI,[LastBuffer]			; Get the recency pointer
 31303                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31304                                  ;hkn; SS override
 31305 00005A42 368B0E[0706]            	MOV	CX,[SS:HIGH_SECTOR]		; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31306                                  
 31307                                  ;	See if this is the buffer that was most recently returned.
 31308                                  ;	A big performance win if it is.
 31309                                  
 31310 00005A47 83FFFF                  	CMP	DI,-1				; Recency pointer valid?
 31311 00005A4A 7412                    	je	short getb5			; No
 31312                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 31313 00005A4C 3B5506                  	CMP	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 31314 00005A4F 750D                    	JNZ	short getb5			; Wrong sector
 31315                                  	
 31316                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31317                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+8]
 31318 00005A51 3B4D08                  	CMP	CX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]	; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31319 00005A54 7508                    	JNZ	short getb5			; F.C. >32mb		;AN000;
 31320                                  	
 31321                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 31322 00005A56 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31323                                  	;JZ	getb35				; Just asked for same buffer
 31324 00005A59 7503                    	jnz	short getb5
 31325                                  	;jmp	getb35
 31326                                  	; 17/12/2022
 31327                                  	; 28/07/2019
 31328 00005A5B E9C800                  	jmp	getb35x
 31329                                  	; 07/12/2022 MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 31330                                  	;jmp	getb35
 31331                                  
 31332                                  ;	It's not the buffer most recently returned. See if it's in the
 31333                                  ;	cache.
 31334                                  ;
 31335                                  ;	(cx:dx) = sector #
 31336                                  ;	(al) = drive #
 31337                                  ;	(si) = 0 iff non fat sector, != 0 if FAT sector read
 31338                                  ;	??? list may be incomplete ???
 31339                                  
 31340                                  getb5:	
 31341                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 31342                                  	;lds	di,[SS:BUFFHEAD]
 31343                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31344 00005A5E E86FFF                  	CALL	GETCURHEAD			; get Q Head
 31345                                  getb10:	
 31346                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 31347 00005A61 3B5506                  	CMP	DX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 31348 00005A64 750D                    	jne	short getb12			; wrong sector lo
 31349                                  	
 31350                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31351                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+8]
 31352 00005A66 3B4D08                  	CMP	CX,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 31353 00005A69 7508                    	jne	short getb12			; wrong sector hi

 31706                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31707                                  ;
 31708                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 31709                                  ;
 31710                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 31711                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 31712                                  ;
 31713                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 31714                                  ;
 31715                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31716                                  ;
 31717                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31718                                  
 31719                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 31720                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 31721 00005B72 B4FF                    	mov	ah, -1 ; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 31722                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 31723 00005B74 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 31724 00005B77 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 31725 00005B79 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 31726 00005B7B 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 31727                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 31728 00005B7D 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31729 00005B80 F8                      	CLC
 31730 00005B81 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 31731                                  DOBUFFER:
 31732                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 31733 00005B83 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 31734 00005B87 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 31735 00005B89 50                      	PUSH	AX
 31736                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 31737 00005B8A FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 31738 00005B8D E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 31739 00005B90 58                      	POP	AX
 31740 00005B91 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 31741                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 31742 00005B93 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 31743                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 31744 00005B96 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 31745                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 31746 00005B99 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 31747                                  checkflush_retn:
 31748 00005B9A C3                      	retn

 31750                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 31751                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31752                                  ;
 31753                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 31754                                  ;
 31755                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 31756                                  ;
 31757                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 31758                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 31759                                  ;
 31760                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 31761                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
 31762                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31763                                  
 31764                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 31780                                  	;test	ah,40h

 31782 00005BA8 74F0                    	jz      short checkflush_retn	; Buffer is clean, carry clear.

 31892                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 31893                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31894                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 31895                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 31896                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 31897                                  ;	code and time

 31971                                  
 31972                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 31973                                  
 31974                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 31975                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 31976                                  
 31977                                  ; =========================================================================
 31978                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 31979                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 31980                                  ;
 31981                                  ;	$WAIT
 31982                                  ;	$EXEC
 31983                                  ;	$Keep_process
 31984                                  ;	Stay_resident
 31985                                  ;	$EXIT
 31986                                  ;	$ABORT
 31987                                  ;	abort_inner
 31988                                  ;
 31989                                  ;	Modification history:
 31990                                  ;
 31991                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 31992                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 31993                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 31994                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 31995                                  ;
 31996                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 31997                                  ;
 31998                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 31999                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 32000                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 32001                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 32002                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 32003                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 32004                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 32005                                  ;
 32006                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 32007                                  ;
 32008                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 32009                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 32010                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 32011                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 32012                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 32013                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 32014                                  ;
 32015                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 32016                                  ;
 32017                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 32018                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 32019                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 32020                                  ;
 32021                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 32022                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 32023                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 32024                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 32025                                  ;
 32026                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 32027                                  ;
 32028                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 32029                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 32030                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 32031                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 32032                                  ;
 32033                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 32034                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 32035                                  ;		       UMBs.
 32036                                  ;
 32037                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 32038                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 32039                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 32040                                  ;
 32041                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 32042                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 32043                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 32044                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 32045                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 32046                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 32047                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 32048                                  ;

 32071                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 32072                                  _$WAIT:
 32073                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32074                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 32075                                  
 32076 00005C4F 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX

 32080                                  ; =========================================================================
 32081                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 32082                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 32083                                  ;
 32084                                  ;
 32085                                  ; Assembler usage:
 32086                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 32087                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 32088                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 32089                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 32090                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 32091                                  ;
 32092                                  ;	AL  Function
 32093                                  ;	--  --------
 32094                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 32095                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 32096                                  ;	    begin execution.
 32097                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 32098                                  ;
 32099                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 32100                                  ;
 32101                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32102                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32103                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32104                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32105                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32106                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32107                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32108                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32109                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32110                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32111                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32112                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32113                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32114                                  ;
 32115                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 32116                                  ;
 32117                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32118                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 32119                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 32120                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32121                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 32122                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 32123                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32124                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32125                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 32126                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32127                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 32128                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 32129                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32130                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32131                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 32132                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32133                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 32134                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 32135                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32136                                  ;
 32137                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 32138                                  ;
 32139                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32140                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 32141                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 32142                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32143                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 32144                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 32145                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 32146                                  ;
 32147                                  ; Returns:
 32148                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 32149                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 32150                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 32151                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 32152                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 32153                                  ; =========================================================================
 32154                                  ;
 32155                                  ;   Revision history:
 32156                                  ;
 32157                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 32158                                  ;
 32159                                  ; =========================================================================
 32160                                  
 32161                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 32162                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)

 32168                                  ;%out	following sizes:

 32184                                  
 32185                                  	; 30/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 32186                                  	; DOSCODE:9B04h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 32187                                  	
 32188                                  _$EXEC:
 32189                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 32190                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 32191                                  
 32192                                  EXEC001S:
 32193                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 32194                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 32195                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE
 32196                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_FH		,WORD
 32197                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Rel_Fac	,WORD
 32198                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Res_Len_Para	,WORD
 32199                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Environ	,WORD
 32200                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Size		,WORD
 32201                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD
 32202                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA		,WORD
 32203                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 32204                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD
 32205                                  	;
 32206                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_DMA_Save	,WORD
 32207                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_NoStack	,BYTE
 32208                                  
 32209                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 32210                                  	;%define	Exec_Blk	dword [bp-4]
 32211                                  	%define		Exec_Blk	[bp-4] ; 09/08/2018
 32212                                  	%define		Exec_BlkL	word [bp-4]	
 32213                                  	%define		Exec_BlkH	word [bp-2]
 32214                                  	%define		Exec_Func	byte [bp-5]
 32215                                  	%define		Exec_Load_High	byte [bp-6]
 32216                                  	%define		Exec_FH		word [bp-8]
 32217                                  	%define		Exec_Rel_Fac	word [bp-10]
 32218                                  	%define		Exec_Res_Len_Para word [bp-12]
 32219                                  	%define		Exec_Environ	word [bp-14]
 32220                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]
 32221                                  	%define		Exec_Load_Block	word [bp-18]
 32222                                  	%define		Exec_DMA	word [bp-20]
 32223                                  	%define		ExecNameLen	word [bp-22]
 32224                                  	;%define	ExecName	dword [bp-26]
 32225                                  	%define		ExecName	[bp-26] ; 09/08/2018
 32226                                  	%define		ExecNameL	word [bp-26]	
 32227                                  	%define		ExecNameH	word [bp-24]
 32228                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32229                                  	%define		Exec_DMA_Save	word [bp-28]
 32230                                  	%define		Exec_NoStack	byte [bp-29]
 32231                                  	
 32232                                  	; ==================================================================
 32233                                  	; validate function
 32234                                  	; ==================================================================
 32235                                  		      	
 32236                                  	; M068 - Start
 32237                                  	;
 32238                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 32239                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 32240                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 32241                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 32242                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 32243                                  
 32244                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32245 00005C59 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 32246                                  
 32247                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 32248                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 32249                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 32250                                  
 32251 00005C5F 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 32252                                  	;jne	short @f
 32253 00005C61 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 32254                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 32255 00005C63 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 32256 00005C64 B9[4C04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 32257 00005C67 51                      	push	cx
 32258                                  ;@@:
 32259                                  Exec_@f:
 32260                                  	; M068 - End
 32261                                  	
 32262                                  	;Enter
 32263                                  
 32264 00005C68 55                      	push	bp
 32265 00005C69 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 32266                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 32267                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 32268                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 32269                                  	; 17/12/2022
 32270                                  	; 20/05/2019
 32271 00005C6B 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 32272                                  
 32273                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32274 00005C6E 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 32275                                  					; M030
 32276 00005C70 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 32277                                  
 32278                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 32279                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 32280                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 32281                                  
 32282                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 32283 00005C72 36C606[2303]01          	mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 32284                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 32285                                  	;mov	al,1
 32286 00005C78 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 32287                                  
 32288                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 32289                                  	;Leave
 32290 00005C7A 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 32291 00005C7C 5D                      	pop	bp
 32292                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_ERR
 32293 00005C7D E90DAA                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 32294                                  
 32295                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32296                                  ExecReadyJ:
 32297 00005C80 E80318                  	call	ExecReady		; M028
 32298 00005C83 E90504                  	jmp	norm_ovl		; do a Leave & xfer sysret_OK ; M028
 32299                                  
 32300                                  Exec_Check_2:
 32301 00005C86 3C02                    	cmp	AL,2			
 32302 00005C88 74E8                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun
 32303                                  
 32304                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 32305 00005C8A 3C04                    	cmp	al,4			; 2 & 4 are not allowed
 32306 00005C8C 74E4                    	je	short Exec_Bad_Fun

 33207 0000605A E8D601                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 33208                                  ;SR;
 33209                                  ;The current lie strategy uses the PSP to store the lie version. However,
 33210                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 33211                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 33212                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 33213                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie 
 33214                                  ;version for this driver and put it into the Sysinit PSP. When the driver
 33215                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 33216                                  ;call is issued.
 33217

 33227

 33737                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 33738                                  ;

 33740                                  ;	    truncate the current block.

 33742                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 33743                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 33744                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.

 33985                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 33986                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33987                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 33988                                  ;
 33989                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 33990                                  ;	EXIT	none
