 33992                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33993                                  
 33994                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 33997                                  arena_free_process:
 33998                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 33999                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34000 00006306 36A1[2400]                      MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head]
 34001                                  arena_free_process_start:

 34003                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head] ; 15/04/2018

 34005                                  
 34006                                  arena_free_process_loop:
 34007                                          ;retc

 34016

 34020                                                                          ; end of road, Jack?

 34025 00006321 7405                    	jz	short arena_chk_umbs
 34026

 34028 00006326 EBE8                            JMP     SHORT arena_free_process_loop
 34029

 34031                                  arena_chk_umbs:				; M010 - Start

 34034 0000632C 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh		; Q: is umb_head initialized
 34035 0000632F 741E                    	je	short ret_label		; N: we're done
 34036

 34040 00006337 EBD1                    	jmp	short arena_free_process_start
 34041                                  					; M010 - End

 34047                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 34048                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34049                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 34050                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34051                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 34052                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 34053                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34054                                  
 34055                                  arena_next:
 34056 00006339 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 34057 0000633B 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 34058 0000633F 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 34059                                  
 34060                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 34061                                  ;
 34062                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 34063                                  ;       RETN
 34064                                  
 34065                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 34066                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34067                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 34068                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34069                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 34070                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 34071                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 34072                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 34073                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34074                                  
 34075                                  check_signature:        
 34076                                  
 34077 00006340 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 34078                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 34079 00006342 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 34080                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 34081 00006346 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34082                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34083 00006348 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 34084                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 34085 0000634C 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 34086 0000634E F9                              STC                             ; set error
 34087                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 34088                                  AFP_RETN:
 34089                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 34090                                  check_signature_ok:
 34091                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 34092 0000634F C3                      	RETN
 34093                                  
 34094                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 34095                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34096                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 34097                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 34098                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 34099                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 34100                                  ;
 34101                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 34102                                  ;		(di) = 0
 34103                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34104                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 34105                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 34106                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 34107                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 34108                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34109                                          
 34110                                  Coalesce:
 34111                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 34112 00006350 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 34113                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 34114                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 34115 00006353 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 34116 00006355 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 34117                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 34118 00006358 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 34119                                  
 34120                                  coalesce_check:
 34121                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 34122 0000635A 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 34123                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 34124 0000635F 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 34125                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 34126 00006361 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 34127 00006366 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 34128                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 34129 00006367 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 34130 0000636B 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 34131 0000636E 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 34132 00006370 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 34133                                  
 34134                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34135                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 34136                                  
 34137                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 34138                                  
 34139                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34140                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34141                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 34142                                  ;
 34143                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 34144                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 34145                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 34146                                  ;
 34147                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 34148                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 34149                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 34150                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 34151                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 34152                                  ;
 34153                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 34154                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 34155                                  ;
 34156                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34157                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34158                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 34159                                  ;           INT     21h
 34160                                  ;
 34161                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 34162                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 34163                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 34164                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 34165                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 34166                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 34167                                  ;
 34168                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 34169                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 34170                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 34171                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 34172                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 34173                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 34174                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 34175                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 34176                                  ;	USES	All
 34177                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34178                                  
 34179                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34180                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34181                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 34182                                  ;
 34183                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34184                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 34185                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc

 34515                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34516                                  
 34517                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34518                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34519                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 34520                                  ;
 34521                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 34522                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 34523                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 34524                                  ;
 34525                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 34526                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 34527                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 34528                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 34529                                  ;
 34530                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 34531                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 34532                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 34533                                  ;		code.
 34534                                  ;
 34535                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 34536                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 34537                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 34538                                  ;
 34539                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34540                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34541                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 34542                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 34543                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 34544                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 34545                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 34546                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 34547                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34548                                  
 34549                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34550                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34551                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 34552                                  ;
 34553                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34554                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 34555                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 34556                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 34557                                  ;           INT     21h
 34558                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 34559                                  ;         size possible
 34560                                  ;   Error return:
 34561                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 34562                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 34563                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 34564                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 34565                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34566                                  
 34567                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 34568                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 34569                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 34570 000064C8 E8BDAE                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34571                                  
 34572 000064CB BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 34573 000064CE 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 34574 000064D0 48                              DEC     AX
 34575 000064D1 E86CFE                          CALL    check_signature
 34576 000064D4 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 34577

 34579 000064D6 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed

 34581                                  setblock_grab:
 34582 000064D9 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 34583 000064DB E872FE                          CALL    Coalesce

 34586 000064E4 51                              PUSH    CX

 34592

 34594                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34595                                  ;**	$DEALLOC - Free Heap Memory
 34596                                  ;
 34597                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = address of item
 34598                                  ;
 34599                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear of OK
 34600                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34601                                  ;		  (AX) = error_invalid_block
 34602                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 34603                                  
 34604                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34605                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34606                                  ;SUBTTL $DEALLOC - free previously allocated piece of memory
 34607                                  ;
 34608                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34609                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 34610                                  ;           MOV     AH,dealloc

 34612                                  ;

 34615                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed

 34650 0000651A E886AE                  	call    LCritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 34651                                          ;error	error_invalid_block
 34652                                  	;mov	al,9
 34653 0000651D B009                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_block
 34654                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34655                                  dealloc_errj:
 34656                                  AllocOperErrj:	; 17/12/2022
 34657 0000651F E96BA1                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 34658                                  
 34659                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34660                                  
 34661                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34662                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34663                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 34664                                  ;
 34665                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 34666                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34667                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34668                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34669                                  ;           INT     21h
 34670                                  ;
 34671                                  ;	ENTRY	
 34672                                  ;		(al) = 0
 34673                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 34674                                  ;
 34675                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 34676                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 34677                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 34678                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 34679                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 34680                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 34681                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 34682                                  ;
 34683                                  ;		(al) = 2
 34684                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 34685                                  ;
 34686                                  ;		(al) = 3
 34687                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 34688                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 34689                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 34690                                  ;
 34691                                  ;
 34692                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 34693                                  ;
 34694                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 34695                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 34696                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 34697                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 34698                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 34699                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 34700                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 34701                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 34702                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 34703                                  ;
 34704                                  ;		'C' set if error
 34705                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 34706                                  ;
 34707                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 34708                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 34709                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 34710                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 34711                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 34712                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34713                                  
 34714                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 34715                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34716                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 34717                                  ;
 34718                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 34719                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 34720                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 34721                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 34722                                  ;           INT     21h
 34723                                  ;
 34724                                  ;   Error return:
 34725                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 34726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34727                                  
 34728                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34729                                  _$ALLOCOPER:
 34730                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 34892                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 34893                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34894                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 34895                                  ;
 34896                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 34897                                  ;
 34898                                  ;
 34899                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 34900                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 34901                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 34902                                  ;		   else
 34903                                  ;			DS = last arena
 34904                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 34905                                  ;
 34906                                  ;		   CY if error
 34907                                  ;
 34908                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 34909                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34910                                  
 34911                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 34912                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 34913                                  
 34914                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 34915                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 34916                                  	
 34917                                  GetLastArena:
 34918 000065AD 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 34919                                  
 34920 000065AE 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 34921 000065B2 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 34922 000065B4 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 34923                                  
 34924 000065B6 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34925                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34926 000065BA 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 34927                                  					
 34928                                  GLA_next:
 34929 000065BC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34930 000065BE E878FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34931                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34932                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34933                                  	; 17/12/2022
 34934 000065C1 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34935                                  
 34936 000065C3 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34937 000065C9 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 34938                                  					;    umb_head
 34939                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 34940                                  
 34941 000065CB 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 34942                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 34943 000065CF EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 34944                                  GLA_chkumb:
 34945 000065D1 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34946                                  GLA_@f:
 34947 000065D3 75E7                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 34948                                  
 34949                                  GLA_done:
 34950                                  					; M061 - Start
 34951 000065D5 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 34952 000065DB 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 34953                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next 
 34954                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 34955 000065DD 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 34956 000065DF E857FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 34957                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 34958 000065E2 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 34959 000065E4 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 34960 000065E6 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 34961                                  					; M061 - End
 34962                                  GLA_ret:
 34963                                  	; 17/12/2022				
 34964                                  	;clc
 34965                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 34966                                  	;clc
 34967 000065E8 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 34968 000065E9 C3                      	retn				; M061
 34969                                  
 34970                                  GLA_err:
 34971 000065EA F9                      	stc				; M061
 34972                                  GLA_err2:
 34973 000065EB 58                      	pop	ax
 34974 000065EC C3                      	retn

 35000                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35001                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 35003                                  ;BREAK <ServerCall -- Server DOS call>
 35004                                  
 35005                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35006                                  ; DOSCODE:A4B7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 35012                                  SRVC001S:
 35013                                  
 35014 000065ED [F165]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 35015 000065EF [4366]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 35016 000065F1 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 35017 000065F2 [AB66]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 35018 000065F4 [4466]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1
 35019 000065F6 [7A66]                  		dw	CLOSE_NAME	; 2
 35020 000065F8 [8566]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID	; 3
 35021 000065FA [8C66]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID_PID	; 4
 35022 000065FC [9366]                  		dw	GET_LIST	; 5
 35023 000065FE [EC66]                  		dw	GET_DOS_DATA	; 6
 35024 00006600 [1067]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 7
 35025 00006602 [1067]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 8
 35026 00006604 [1067]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 9

 35028

 35031                                  ;SRVC001E label byte
 35032                                  
 35033                                  SRVC001E:
 35034                                  
 35035                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 35036                                  
 35037                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35038                                  ;
 35039                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 35040                                  ;
 35041                                  ; Inputs:
 35042                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 35043                                  ; Function:
 35044                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 35045                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 35046                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 35047                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 35048                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 35049                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 35050                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 35051                                  ;			CX User Index
 35052                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 35053                                  ;			BX = UID
 35054                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 35055                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 35056                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 35057                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 35058                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 35059                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 35060                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 35061                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 35062                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 35063                                  ;
 35064                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35065                                  
 35066                                  _$ServerCall:
 35067                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35068                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 35069                                  	; 10/06/2019
 35070                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35071                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 35072                                  
 35073                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35074                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 657Bh
 35075 00006608 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7
 35076 0000660A 7204                    	JB	short SET_STUFF
 35077 0000660C 3C09                    	CMP	AL,9
 35078 0000660E 761A                    	JBE	short NO_SET_ID		; No DPL on calls 7,8,9
 35079                                  SET_STUFF:
 35080 00006610 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point to DPL with DS:SI
 35081                                  	;mov	bx,[si+12h]
 35082 00006612 8B5C12                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.UID]
 35083                                  
 35084                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35085                                  ;SR;
 35086                                  ; WIN386 updates the USER_ID itself. If WIN386 is present we skip the updating
 35087                                  ; of USER_ID
 35088                                  
 35089 00006615 36F606[3010]01          	test	byte [SS:IsWin386],1

 35093                                  	; 15/08/2018

 35095                                  
 35096                                  skip_win386:
 35097 00006622 8B5C14                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.PID]
 35098 00006625 36891E[3C03]            	MOV	[SS:PROC_ID],BX		; Set process ID
 35099                                  NO_SET_ID:
 35100                                  	; 10/06/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35101 0000662A 2EFF36[EF65]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERLEAVE]	; push return address
 35102 0000662F 2EFF36[ED65]            	PUSH	word [cS:SERVERTAB]	; push table address
 35103 00006634 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35104 00006635 E860AC                  	call	TableDispatch
 35105                                  
 35106                                  ;hkn; SS override
 35107                                  	;mov 	byte [SS:EXETERR_LOCUS],1
 35108 00006638 36C606[2303]01          	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; Extended Error Locus
 35109                                  	;error	error_invalid_function
 35110                                  	;mov	al,1
 35111 0000663E B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 35112                                  servercall_error:
 35113 00006640 E94AA0                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 35114                                  
 35115                                  SERVERRETURN:
 35116 00006643 C3                      	retn
 35117                                  
 35118                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 35119                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 35120                                  
 35121                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35122                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 35123 00006644 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			;   for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)
 35124 00006646 16                      	push	ss
 35125 00006647 1F                      	pop	ds
 35126 00006648 E83DAD                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 35127                                  CommitLoop:
 35128 0000664B 53                      	push	bx
 35129 0000664C E82401                  	call	SFFromSFN
 35130 0000664F 7222                    	JC	short CommitDone
 35131 00006651 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 35132                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 35133                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)
 35134 00006655 7418                    	JZ	short CommitNext
 35135                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 35136 00006657 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 35137                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],sf_busy  
 35138                                  					; BUSY SFTs have god knows what
 35139 0000665B 7412                    	JZ	short CommitNext	;   in them.
 35140                                  	; 17/12/2022

 35378                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 35379                                  
 35380                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 35381                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35382                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 35383                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 35384                                  ;
 35385                                  ;	NOTE:
 35386                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35387                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35388                                  ;
 35389                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35390                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 35391                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 35392                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35393                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 35394                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 35395                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35396                                  
 35397                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35398                                  
 35399                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 35400                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35401                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35402 00006740 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35403                                  	
 35404                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 35405 00006745 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 35406                                  
 35407                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 35408 0000674A 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 35409 0000674F 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 35410                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35411                                  	;mov	al,6
 35412 00006751 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35413                                  ReturnCarry:
 35414 00006753 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 35415 00006754 C3                      	retn				; go back
 35416                                  pjfn10: 
 35417                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 35418 00006755 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 35419 0000675A 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 35420                                  	;clc
 35421                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 35422 0000675C C3                      	retn
 35423                                  
 35424                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 35425                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35426                                  ;
 35427                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 35428                                  ;
 35429                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 35430                                  ;
 35431                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 35432                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 35433                                  ;                   AX has error code
 35434                                  ;               Carry Reset
 35435                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 35436                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 35437                                  ; NOTE:
 35438                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 35439                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35440                                  ;
 35441                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35442                                  
 35443                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35444                                  
 35445                                  SFFromHandle:
 35446 0000675D E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 35447                                  	;retc				; return if error
 35448 00006760 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 35449 00006762 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 35450                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35451                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35452                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35453                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35454                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35455                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35456 00006766 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 35457                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 35458                                  	;;mov	al,6
 35459                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 35460                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 35461                                  GetSF:
 35462 00006768 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 35463 00006769 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 35464 0000676C 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 35465 0000676E E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 35466 00006771 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 35467 00006772 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 35468                                  
 35469                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 35470                                  
 35471                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 35472                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35473                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 35474                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 35475                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 35476                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 35477                                  ;
 35478                                  ;   NOTE:
 35479                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 35480                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 35481                                  ;
 35482                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 35483                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35484                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 35485                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 35486                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 35487                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35488                                  
 35489                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35490                                  
 35491                                  SFFromSFN:
 35492                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35493                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 35494 00006773 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35495                                  
 35496                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 35497 00006778 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 35498                                  sfsfn5:	
 35499                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 35500 0000677D 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 35501 00006781 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 35502                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 35503 00006783 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 35504 00006787 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 35505                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 35506 0000678A 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 35507 0000678D 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 35508 0000678F F9                      	STC
 35509 00006790 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 35510                                  sfsfn7:
 35511 00006791 50                      	push	ax
 35512                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 35513                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 35514                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 35515                                  	
 35516                                  	; 17/12/2022
 35517 00006792 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 35518                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35519                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 35520                                  	
 35521 00006794 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 35522 00006796 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 35523 00006798 58                      	pop	ax
 35524                                  	;add	di,6
 35525 00006799 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 35526 0000679C C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 35527                                  
 35528                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 35529                                  
 35530                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 35531                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35532                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 35533                                  ;
 35534                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35535                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 35536                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 35537                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 35538                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35539                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35540                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 35541                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35542                                  
 35543                                  JFNFree:
 35544 0000679D 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 35545                                  jfnf1:	
 35546 0000679F E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 35547 000067A2 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 35548 000067A4 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 35549 000067A8 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 35550 000067AA 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 35551 000067AB EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 35552                                  
 35553                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 35554                                  jfnf5:	
 35555                                  	;mov	al,4
 35556 000067AD B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 35557                                  jfnfx:	
 35558 000067AF C3                      	retn				; bye
 35559                                  
 35560                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 35561                                  
 35562                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 35563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35564                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 35565                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35566                                  ;
 35567                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 35568                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 35569                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 35570                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 35571                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 35572                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 35573                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 35574                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 35575                                  ;
 35576                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 35577                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 35578                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 35579                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 35580                                  ;
 35581                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 35582                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 35583                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 35584                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 35585                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 35586                                  ;		'C' set if error
 35587                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 35588                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 35589                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35590                                  
 35591                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35592                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35593                                  
 35594                                  SFNFree:
 35595                                  	; 12/08/2018
 35596                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35597                                  	;
 35598                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35599 000067B0 50                      	push	ax
 35600 000067B1 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 35601                                  sfnf5:	
 35602 000067B3 53                      	push	bx
 35603 000067B4 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 35604 000067B7 5B                      	pop	bx
 35605 000067B8 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 35606 000067BA 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 35607                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 35608 000067BE 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 35609                                  	
 35610                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 35611 000067C0 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 35612                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 35613 000067C4 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 35614                                  sfnf7:

 35684                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 35685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35686                                  ;
 35687                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 35688                                  ;
 35689                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 35690                                  ;		path
 35691                                  ;
 35692                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 35693                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 35694                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 35695                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 35696                                  ;
 35697                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 35698                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 35699                                  ;	USES	all
 35700                                  ;
 35701                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35702                                  
 35703                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35704                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35705                                  
 35706                                  _$CLOSE:
 35707                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 35708                                  
 35709 000067F8 E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 35710 000067FB 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 35711 000067FD 16                      	push	ss
 35712 000067FE 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 35713 000067FF 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 35714 00006803 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 35715                                  
 35716                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 35717                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 35718                                  ;
 35719                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 35720                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 35721                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 35722                                  
 35723                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 35724 00006807 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 35725 0000680B 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 35726                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 35727 0000680D 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 35728                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 35729 00006811 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 35730                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 35731 00006813 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 35732 00006815 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 35733                                  
 35734                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 35735                                  ; -1.
 35736                                  
 35737                                  FreeJFN:
 35738 00006817 E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 35739 0000681A 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 35740                                  PostFree:
 35741                                  
 35742                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 35743                                  
 35744 0000681E E875C7                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 35745                                  
 35746                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 35747                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 35748                                  
 35749 00006821 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 35750                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 35751 00006823 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 35752                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 35753                                  CloseOk:
 35754 00006825 E95C9E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 35755                                  CloseError:
 35756 00006828 E9629E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 35757

 35761                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 35762                                  ;
 35763                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 35764                                  ;	flushed out.  BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 35765                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check

 35767                                  ;

 35849                                  chck_handles:

 35986                                  ;	BREAK <$READ - Read from a file handle>
 35987                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35988                                  ;
 35989                                  ;**	$Read - Read from a File Handle
 35990                                  ;
 35991                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 35992                                  ;
 35993                                  ;	LDS	DX, buf
 35994                                  ;	MOV	CX, count
 35995                                  ;	MOV	BX, handle
 35996                                  ;	MOV	AH, Read
 35997                                  ;	INT	int_command
 35998                                  ;	  AX has number of bytes read
 35999                                  ;
 36000                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = file handle
 36001                                  ;		(cx) = byte count
 36002                                  ;		(ds:dx) = buffer address
 36003                                  ;	EXIT	Through system call return so that to user:
 36004                                  ;		  'C' clear if OK
 36005                                  ;		    (ax) = bytes read
 36006                                  ;		  'C' set if error
 36007                                  ;		    (ax) = error code
 36008                                  ;
 36009                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36010                                  
 36011                                  _$READ:

 36019 00006917 7303                    	JNC	short ReadSetup		; no errors do the operation
 36020                                  
 36021                                  ;	Have an error. 'C' set
 36022                                  
 36023                                  ReadError:
 36024                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 36026                                  	;jmp	short CommitErrorj3

 36034                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 
 36035                                  ;; Extended Open

 36043                                  ;; Extended Open

 36065                                  	;MOV	CL,4			; bits to shift bytes->para

 36078 00006941 1F                      	pop	ds

 36499                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 36500                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36501                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 36502                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 36503                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 36504                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 36505                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 36506                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 36507                                  ;
 36508                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 36509                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 36510                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 36511                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 36512                                  ;	USES	none
 36513                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36514                                  
 36515                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36516                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36517                                  CheckOwner:
 36518                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36519                                  
 36520 00006A55 E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 36521 00006A58 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 36522                                  
 36523 00006A5A 50                      	push	ax
 36524                                  
 36525                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36526                                  
 36527                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 36528                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 36534

 36557                                  ;============================================================================
 36558                                  ; MACRO.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36559                                  ;============================================================================
 36560                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018
 36561                                  ; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36562                                  
 36563                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 36564                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 36565                                  
 36566                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 36567                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 36568                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 36569                                  
 36570                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 36571                                  ;
 36572                                  ;	$AssignOper
 36573                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 36574                                  ;	InitCDS
 36575                                  ;	$UserOper
 36576                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 36577                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 36578                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 36579                                  ;
 36580                                  ;   Revision history:
 36581                                  ;
 36582                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 36583                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 36584                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 36585                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 36586                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 36587                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 36588                                  ;				    aliasing.
 36589                                  ;
 36590                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 36591                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 36592                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 36593                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 36594                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 36595                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 36596                                  ;
 36597                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 36598                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 36599                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 36600                                  ;
 36601                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 36602                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 36603                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 36604                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 36605                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 36606                                  ;
 36607                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 36608                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 36609                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 36610                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 36611                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 36612                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 36613                                  ;
 36614                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 36615                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 36616                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 36617                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 36618                                  ;   number.
 36619                                  ;
 36620                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 36621                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 36622                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 36623                                  ;   TransPath.
 36624                                  ;
 36625                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 36626                                  
 36627                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 36628                                  
 36629                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 36630                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 36631                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 36632                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 36633                                  ;					; current drive)
 36634                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 36635                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 36636                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 36637                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 36638                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 36639                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 36640                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 36641                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 36642                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 36643                                  
 36644                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 36645                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36646                                  ; Inputs:
 36647                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 36648                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 36649                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 36650                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 36651                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 36652                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 36653                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 36654                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 36655                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 36656                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 36657                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36658                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 36659                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 36660                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 36661                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 36662                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 36663                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 36664                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 36665                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 36666                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 36667                                  ; Function:
 36668                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 36669                                  ; Returns:
 36670                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 36671                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36672                                  
 36673                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36674                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36840                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 36841                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36842                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 36843                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 36844                                  ;
 36845                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 36846                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 36847                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 36848                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 36849                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 36850                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 36851                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 36852                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 36853                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 36854                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 36855                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 36856                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36857                                  
 36858                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36859                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36860                                  _$UserOper:
 36861                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36862                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)

 36865 00006B14 58                      	POP	AX

 36867 00006B17 742E                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user
 36868 00006B19 3C05                    	CMP	AL,5			; test for 2,3,4 or 5
 36869 00006B1B 763D                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep

 36874                                  	;mov	al,1
