 37106                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 37107                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37108                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 37109                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 37110                                  ;
 37111                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 37112                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 37113                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 37114                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 37115                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 37116                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 37117                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37118                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37119                                  
 37120                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37121                                  TransFCB:
 37122                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37123                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37124                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 37125                                  	;ENTER
 37126 00006BFA 55                      	push	bp
 37127 00006BFB 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 37128                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 37129 00006BFD 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 37130 00006C00 16                      	push	ss
 37131 00006C01 07                      	pop	es
 37132 00006C02 06                      	push	es
 37133 00006C03 57                      	push	di
 37134                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37135                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 37136 00006C04 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 37137 00006C07 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 37138 00006C0D 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37139 00006C13 E8CCB0                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 37140                                  	; 06/12/2022
 37141 00006C16 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 37142 00006C18 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 37143 00006C1B 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 37144 00006C1F 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 37145                                  GetDrive:
 37146 00006C25 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 37147 00006C26 E858FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 37148 00006C29 722A                    	jc	short BadPack

 37150

 37152

 37161                                  	;es	xlat

 37165

 37169                                  NextCh:

 37171 00006C3C 5E                      	pop	si
 37172 00006C3D 89FB                    	mov	bx,di

 37174 00006C42 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 37175 00006C43 07                      	pop	es
 37176 00006C44 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 37177 00006C45 1F                      	pop	ds
 37178                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37179                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 37180 00006C46 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]

 37182 00006C4C 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 37183 00006C4E 55                      	push	bp
 37184 00006C4F E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 37185 00006C52 5D                      	pop	bp

 37187                                  BadPack:

 37200                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 37201                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37202                                  ;
 37203                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 37204                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 37205                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 37206                                  ;       exactly.
 37207                                  ;
 37208                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 37209                                  ;       matches splice.
 37210                                  ;
 37211                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 37212                                  ;
 37213                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 37214                                  ;
 37215                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 37216                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 37217                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 37218                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 37219                                  ;
 37220                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 37221                                  ;
 37222                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 37223                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 37224                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 37225                                  ;
 37226                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 37227                                  ;
 37228                                  ;       if fSharing then
 37229                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37230                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37231                                  ;           splice
 37232                                  ;           fatRead
 37233                                  ;           return
 37234                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 37235                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 37236                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37237                                  ;           return
 37238                                  ;       if device then
 37239                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 37240                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 37241                                  ;           return
 37242                                  ;       if file then
 37243                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 37244                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 37245                                  ;           Copy current dir
 37246                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 37247                                  ;           splice
 37248                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 37249                                  ;           if local then
 37250                                  ;               fatread
 37251                                  ;           return
 37252                                  ;
 37253                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37254                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 37255                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37256                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 37257                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 37258                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 37259                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 37260                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 37261                                  ;
 37262                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37263                                  
 37264                                  ; 22/05/2019
 37265                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37266                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37267                                  
 37268                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37269                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37270                                  
 37271                                  TransPath:
 37272 00006C5C 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 37273 00006C5E EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 37274                                  TransPathSet:
 37275 00006C60 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 37276                                  SetSplice:
 37277 00006C62 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	;   NoSetDir = !fExact; ;smr;SS Override
 37278 00006C66 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 37279                                  TransPathNoSet:
 37280 00006C68 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		;   fSplice = TRUE;     ;smr;SS Override
 37281 00006C6C 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 37282 00006C72 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 37283 00006C77 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 37284 00006C7E 16                      	push	ss
 37285 00006C7F 07                      	pop	es
 37286                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 37287 00006C80 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 37288                                  ;
 37289                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 37290                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 37291                                  ;
 37292 00006C84 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 37293 00006C8A 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 37294                                  ;
 37295                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 37296                                  ;
 37297 00006C8C E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 37298 00006C8F E8EFFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 37299 00006C92 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 37300 00006C94 E80B03                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 37301 00006C97 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 37302 00006C9A E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 37303 00006C9D 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 37304                                  ;
 37305                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 37306                                  ;
 37307 00006C9F 16                      	push	ss
 37308 00006CA0 1F                      	pop	ds
 37309 00006CA1 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 37310 00006CA5 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 37311 00006CAA 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 37312 00006CAC E83102                  	CALL    Splice
 37313                                  NoServerSplice:
 37314 00006CAF 16                      	push	ss
 37315 00006CB0 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 37316 00006CB1 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 37317 00006CB5 E8D0A6                  	call	ECritDisk
 37318 00006CB8 E80AEB                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 37319 00006CBB E8E5A6                  	call	LCritDisk
 37320                                  NoPath:
 37321                                  	;mov	al,3
 37322 00006CBE B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 37323 00006CC0 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 37324                                  
 37325                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 37326                                  ; the name if so.
 37327                                  
 37328                                  CheckUNC:
 37329 00006CC1 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 37330                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 37331 00006CC8 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 37332 00006CCB CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 37333                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 37334                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 37335                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 37336 00006CCD 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 37337                                  
 37338                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 37339                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 37340                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 37341                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 37342                                  
 37343                                  NO_CHECK:
 37344 00006CCF E8B902                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 37345 00006CD2 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 37346 00006CD3 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 37347 00006CD5 E897E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 37348 00006CD8 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 37349 00006CDA E892E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 37350 00006CDD 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 37351 00006CDF 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 37352 00006CE1 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 37353                                  
 37354                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 37355                                  ; local machine root path

 37357 00006CE3 58                      	POP     AX

 37359                                  UNCCpy:

 37364 00006CED E87FE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?

 37366 00006CF2 AA                      	STOSB
 37367 00006CF3 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 37368 00006CF5 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 37369                                  UNCDone:

 37371 00006CF9 1F                      	pop	ds
 37372 00006CFA C3                       	retn				; return error code
 37373                                  UNCTerm:
 37374 00006CFB AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 37375 00006CFC EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 37376                                  
 37377                                  CheckDevice:
 37378                                  
 37379                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 37380                                  
 37381 00006CFE 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 37382 00006CFF 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 37383 00006D02 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 37384                                  	;mov	al,2 
 37385 00006D04 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 37386 00006D06 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 37387 00006D07 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 37388                                  CheckPath:
 37389 00006D08 50                      	push	ax
 37390 00006D09 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 37391                                  
 37392                                  
 37393                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37394                                  %if 0
 37395                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37396                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 37397                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 37398                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 37399                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 37400                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 37401                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 37402                                  ;;;
 37403                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 37404                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 37405                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 37406                                  ;;;
 37407                                  ;;;More info:
 37408                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 37409                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 37410                                  ;;;
 37411                                  	call	no5Dshere
 37412                                  start5Dhack:
 37413                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice         
 37414                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 37415                                  
 37416                                  %endif
 37417                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37418                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 37419 00006D0A E8B8D6                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 37420

 37508 00006D59 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL

 37516 00006D61 5E                      	pop	si
 37517 00006D62 1F                      	pop	ds
 37518                                  
 37519                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 37520                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 37521                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading

 37614                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 37615                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37616                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 37617                                  ;
 37618                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 37619                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 37620                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 37621                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 37622                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 37623                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 37624                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 37625                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 37626                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 37627                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 37628                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37629                                  
 37630                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37631                                  
 37632                                  Canonicalize:
 37633                                  
 37634                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 37635                                  
 37636 00006DD1 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 37637 00006DD2 E89AE3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 37638 00006DD5 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 37639 00006DD7 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 37640 00006DD9 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 37641 00006DDB AA                      	STOSB
 37642 00006DDC EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 37643                                  CanonDec:
 37644 00006DDE 4E                      	DEC     SI
 37645                                  
 37646                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 37647                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 37648                                  ; buffer.
 37649                                  
 37650                                  CanonLoop:
 37651                                  
 37652                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 37653                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 37654                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 37655

 37658 00006DE3 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 37659 00006DE5 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 37660 00006DEA 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 37661 00006DEC B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 37662 00006DEE AA                      	STOSB
 37663 00006DEF 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH

 37668                                  
 37669                                  CanonBad:

 37682                                  ; it to 8.3

 37684                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }

 37689

 37705

 37709                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path

 37735                                  ;BREAK <PathSep - determine if char is a path separator>
 37736                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37737                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 37738                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 37739                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 37740                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL

 37757                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37758                                  ;   SkipBack - look at ES:DI and backup until it points to a / ;   Inputs:     ES:DI - point to a char
 37760                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)

 37783                                  ;Break <CopyComponent - copy out a file path component>
 37784                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37785                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI
 37786                                  ;
 37787                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source path
 37788                                  ;               ES:DI - destination

 37899                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 37900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37901                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 37902                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 37903                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 37904                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 37905                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 37906                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 37907                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 37908                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 37909                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 37910                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 37911                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 37912                                  ;                   left alone
 37913                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 37914                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 37915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37916

 37935                                  	;TEST	word [SI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice
 37936 00006F03 74F3                    	JZ	short SpliceScan 	;       if ( Spliced (i) ) {
 37937 00006F05 57                      	push	di
 37938 00006F06 E8A100                  	CALL    PathPref                ;           if (!PathPref (s, d))
 37939 00006F09 7403                    	JZ	short SpliceFound	;
 37940                                  SpliceSkip:
 37941 00006F0B 5F                      	pop	di
 37942 00006F0C EBEA                    	JMP	short SpliceScan	;               continue;
 37943                                  SpliceFound:

 37945 00006F12 7508                    	JNZ	short SpliceDo
 37946 00006F14 36F606[4C03]FF          	TEST	byte [ss:NoSetDir],-1			;smr;SS Override
 37947 00006F1A 75EF                    	JNZ	short SpliceSkip

 37949 00006F1C 89FE                    	MOV     SI,DI                   ;               p = src + strlen (p);
 37950 00006F1E 06                      	push	es
 37951 00006F1F 1F                      	pop	ds

 37953 00006F21 E88000                  	CALL	TextFromDrive1          ;               src = TextFromDrive1(src,i);
 37954 00006F24 36A1[B605]              	MOV     AX,[SS:CURR_DIR_END]			;smr;SS Override
 37955 00006F28 09C0                    	OR      AX,AX
 37956 00006F2A 7808                    	JS	short NoPoke
 37957 00006F2C 01F8                    	ADD     AX,DI                   ;               curdirend += src-p;
 37958 00006F2E 29F0                    	SUB     AX,SI
 37959 00006F30 36A3[B605]              	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],AX			;smr;SS Override
 37960                                  NoPoke:
 37961 00006F34 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		;               if (*p)
 37962 00006F37 7503                    	JNZ	short SpliceCopy	;                   *src++ = '\\';
 37963 00006F39 B05C                    	MOV     AL,"\"
 37964 00006F3B AA                      	STOSB

 37966 00006F3C E81BA3                  	call	FStrCpy

 37968 00006F42 80C901                  	OR      CL,1                    ; signal splice done.
 37969 00006F45 EB0C                    	JMP     SHORT DoSet             ;               return;
 37970                                  SpliceDone:                             ;               }
 37971 00006F47 368F06[A405]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS+2]     ;   ThisCDS = TmpCDS;
 37972 00006F4C 368F06[A205]            	pop	word [SS:THISCDS]			;smr;SS Override
 37973                                  AllDone:

 37990                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 37991                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37992                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 37993                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 37994                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 37995                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 37996                                  ;
 37997                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 37998                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 37999                                  ;   Outputs:
 38000                                  ;       Carry Clear
 38001                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 38002                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 38003                                  ;       Carry Set
 38004                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 38005                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 38006                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38007

 38010 00006F67 56                      	push	si

 38013 00006F6A 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 38014                                  	
 38015                                  	; MSDOS 6.0	
 38016                                  ; M027 - Start
 38017                                  ;
 38018                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 38019                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 38020                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 38021                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 38022                                  ; and restore CX.
 38023                                  
 38024                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 38025 00006F6B B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 38026 00006F6D E8BA02                  	call	SetAttrib

 38033 00006F76 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 38034 00006F77 5F                      	pop     di
 38035 00006F78 07                      	pop	es

 38048                                  ;Break   <DriveFromText - return drive number from a text string>
 38049                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38050                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 38051                                  ;   pointer.
 38052                                  ;

 38054                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has drive number

 38074                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38075                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 38076                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 38077                                  ;

 38093                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 38094                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38095                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 38096                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 38097                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 38098                                  ;
 38099                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 38100                                  ;               ES:DI string
 38101                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 38102                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 38103                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 38104                                  ;   Registers modified: CX

 38107                                  PathPref:

 38109 00006FAD 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 38110 00006FAE F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 38111 00006FB0 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 38112 00006FB2 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 38113 00006FB3 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 38114 00006FB6 E8B6E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 38115 00006FB9 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 38116                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 38118 00006FBE E877FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 38119                                  Prefix:
 38120 00006FC1 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 38121 00006FC2 C3                      	retn

 38154                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 38155                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 38156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38157                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 38158                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 38159                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 38160                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 38161                                  ;           INT     int_command
 38162                                  ;
 38163                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 38164                                  ;       ------          --------
 38165                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 38166                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 38167                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 38168                                  ;
 38169                                  ;   Error returns:
 38170                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 38171                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 38172                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 38173                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 38174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38175                                  
 38176                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38177                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 38178                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38179                                  ;
 38180                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 38181                                  ;
 38182                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 38183                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 38184                                  ;
 38185                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 38186                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 38187                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 38188                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 38189                                  ;		'C' set if error
 38190                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 38191                                  ;	USES	all
 38192                                  ;
 38193                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38194                                  
 38195                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38196                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38197                                  
 38198                                  _$OPEN:       
 38199 00006FCC 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 38200                                  _$Open2:
 38201                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 38202 00006FCE B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 38203 00006FD0 E85702                  	call	SetAttrib
 38204 00006FD3 B9[DA2B]                	mov	cx,DOS_OPEN
 38205                                  
 38206                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 38207                                  
 38208 00006FD6 50                      	push	ax
 38209                                  
 38210                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 38211                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 38212                                  ;
 38213                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 38214                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 38215                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 38216                                  ;
 38217                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 38218                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 38219                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 38220                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 38221                                  
 38222                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 38223                                  
 38224                                  AccessFile:
 38225 00006FD7 E8AEA3                  	call	ECritSFT
 38226 00006FDA E8D3F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 38227 00006FDD E8C3A3                  	call	LCritSFT
 38228 00006FE0 7214                    	jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 38229 00006FE2 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 38230 00006FE7 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 38231 00006FEC 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 38232                                  
 38233                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 38234                                  
 38235 00006FF1 E8A9F7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 38236 00006FF4 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 38237                                  OpenFailJ:
 38238 00006FF6 E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 38239                                  
 38240                                  SaveJFN:
 38241 00006FF9 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 38242 00006FFE 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 38243 00007003 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 38244                                  
 38245                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 38246                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 38247                                  
 38248 00007008 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 38249 0000700D 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 38250 00007010 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 38251 00007012 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 38252 00007015 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 38253 00007016 E843FC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path
 38254 00007019 5B                      	pop	bx			; (bx) = routine to call
 38255                                  
 38256 0000701A 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 38257 0000701F 720A                    	JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 38258 00007021 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 38259 00007027 7404                    	JZ	short SetSearch
 38260                                  	;mov	al,2
 38261 00007029 B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found ; no meta chars allowed
 38262                                  OpenCleanJ:
 38263 0000702B EB50                    	JMP	short OpenClean
 38264                                  
 38265                                  SetSearch:
 38266 0000702D 58                      	pop	ax			; Mode (Open), Attributes (Create)
 38267                                  
 38268                                  ;	We need to get the new inheritance bits.
 38269                                  
 38270 0000702E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 38271                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38272                                  	;mov	[si+2],cx ; 0
 38273 00007030 894C02                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],cx ; initialize mode field to 0
 38274                                  	;mov    [si+51],cx ; 0
 38275 00007033 894C33                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],cx	 ; clean out sharing info
 38276                                  	;
 38277 00007036 81FB[DA2B]              	CMP	BX,DOS_OPEN
 38278 0000703A 7509                    	JNZ	short _DoOper
 38279                                  	;test   al,80h
 38280 0000703C A880                    	test	AL,SHARING_NO_INHERIT	; look for no inher
 38281 0000703E 7405                    	JZ	short _DoOper ; 10/08/2018
 38282 00007040 247F                    	AND	AL,7Fh			; mask off inherit bit
 38283                                  	;mov	cx,1000h
 38284 00007042 B90010                  	MOV	CX,sf_no_inherit
 38285                                  _DoOper:
 38286                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 38287                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0
 38288                                  	;;mov	word [si+33h], 0
 38289                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],0
 38290                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],0
 38291                                  
 38292                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38293                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 38294                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 38295                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm
 38296                                  
 38297                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38298                                  	;SAVE	<di, es>                ;M022 conditional removed here
 38299 00007045 57                      	push	di
 38300 00007046 06                      	push	es
 38301 00007047 1E                      	push	ds
 38302 00007048 07                      	pop	es
 38303 00007049 56                      	push	si
 38304 0000704A 5F                      	pop	di			; (es:di) = SFT address
 38305 0000704B E878BB                  	call	Set_EXT_mode
 38306                                  	;RESTORE <es, di>
 38307 0000704E 07                      	pop	es
 38308 0000704F 5F                      	pop	di
 38309                                  
 38310                                  	;Context DS
 38311 00007050 16                      	push	ss
 38312 00007051 1F                      	pop	ds	
 38313                                  
 38314 00007052 51                      	push	cx
 38315 00007053 FFD3                    	CALL	BX			; blam!
 38316 00007055 59                      	pop	cx

 38672                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 38673                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38674                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry.  Return a file handle if there
 38675                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 38676                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 38677                                  ;
 38678                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 38679                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 38680                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 38681                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 38682                                  ;		Carry Set:
 38683                                  ;		    AX has error code
 38684                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 38685                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38686                                  
 38687                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 38688 0000718C 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 38689 0000718D B9[7D2B]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 38690 00007190 E914FF                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 38691                                  
 38692                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 38693                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38694                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 38695                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 38696                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 38697                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 38698                                  ;
 38699                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 38700                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 38701                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 38702                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 38703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38704                                  
 38705                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 38706                                  ;BinToAscii:
 38707                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 38708                                  ;bta5:
 38709                                  ;	push    cx
 38710                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 38711                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 38712                                  ;	push    ax
 38713                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 38714                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 38715                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 38716                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 38717                                  ;	add     al,7
 38718                                  ;bta6: 
 38719                                  ;	stosb
 38720                                  ;	pop     ax
 38721                                  ;	pop     cx
 38722                                  ;	loop    bta5
 38723                                  ;	retn
 38724                                  
 38725                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 38726                                  BinToAscii:
 38727 00007193 B90404                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 38728                                  bta5:	
 38729 00007196 D3C0                    	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 38730 00007198 50                      	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 38731 00007199 240F                    	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 38732 0000719B 0441                    	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 38733 0000719D AA                      	STOSB				; drop in the character
 38734 0000719E 58                      	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 38735 0000719F FECD                    	dec	ch
 38736 000071A1 75F3                    	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 38737 000071A3 C3                      	retn
 38738                                  
 38739                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 38740                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38741                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 38742                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 38743                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 38744                                  ;
 38745                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 38746                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 38747                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 38748                                  ;		AX has handle
 38749                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 38750                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38751                                  
 38752                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38753                                  
 38754                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 38755                                  	;Enter
 38756 000071A4 55                      	push	bp
 38757 000071A5 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 38758                                  
 38759                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 38760                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 38761                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 38762                                  
 38763 000071A7 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 38764                                  
 38765                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 38766 000071AA F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 38767 000071AE 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 38768                                  
 38769                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 38770                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 38771                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 38772                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 38773                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 38774                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 38775                                  
 38776                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 38777 000071B0 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 38778 000071B3 EB69                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 38779                                  
 38780                                  OKatts:
 38781                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 38782 000071B5 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 38783                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 38784 000071B8 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 38785                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 38786 000071BB 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 38787                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir

 38915                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 38916                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38917                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 38918                                  ;	 BX= mode
 38919                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 38920                                  ;	 DX= flag
 38921                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 38922                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list

 38924                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 38925                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 38926                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE

 39136                                  ; 14/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 39138                                  
 39139                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 39140                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39141                                  ;
 39142                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39143                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 39144                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 39145                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 39146                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 39147                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 39148                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 39149                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 39150                                  ;	    INT     21h
 39151                                  ;
 39152                                  ;   Error returns:
 39153                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 39154                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 39155                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 39156                                  ;
 39157                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 39158                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 39159                                  ;
 39160                                  ;				    0? lock all
 39161                                  ;				    8? lock write
 39162                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple

 39497                                  ; SHARE_CHECK
 39498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39499                                  ; Inputs:
 39500                                  ;       [THISSFT] Points to filled in local file/device SFT for new
 39501                                  ;               instance of file sf_mode ALWAYS has mode (even on FCB SFTs)
 39502                                  ;       [WFP_START] has full path of name
 39503                                  ;       [USER_ID] Set

 39505                                  ; Function:
 39506                                  ;       Check for sharing violations on local file/device access
 39507                                  ; Outputs:
 39508                                  ;    Carry clear
 39509                                  ;       Sharing approved
 39510                                  ;    Carry set
 39511                                  ;       A sharing violation detected
 39512                                  ;           AX is error code
 39513                                  ; USES    ALL but DS

 39515                                  
 39516                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39517                                  SHARE_CHECK:
 39518                                  	; 26/07/2019

 39520                                  shchk_retn:
