 41118                                  ;
 41119                                  ;	Procedure Name	: chk_patchsum
 41120                                  ;
 41121                                  ;	Input		: DS:SI -> string we're looking for
 41122                                  ;			: ES:DI -> offset in packed file
 41123                                  ;			: CX 	= scan length
 41124                                  ;			: BX	= length of check sum
 41125                                  ;			: AX 	= value of check sum
 41126                                  ;
 41127                                  ;	Output		: if patch & check sum compare
 41128                                  ;				NC
 41129                                  ;			  else
 41130                                  ;				CY
 41131                                  ;
 41132                                  ;	Uses		: AX, BX, CX, SI
 41133                                  ;
 41134                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41135                                  
 41136                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41137                                  chk_patchsum:
 41138 0000773C 57                      	push	di
 41139                                  
 41140 0000773D F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb			   
 41141                                  
 41142 0000773F 751A                    	jnz	short cp_fail		; Q: does the patch match
 41143                                  					; N: exit
 41144                                  					; Y:	
 41145                                  
 41146                                  		; we do a check sum starting from the location of the 
 41147                                  		; exepack signature 'RB' up to 11c/2 bytes, the end of the
 41148                                  		; unpacking code.
 41149                                  
 41150 00007741 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; di -> start of unpack code
 41151 00007746 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			; cx = length of check sum
 41152                                  
 41153 00007748 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; save check sum passed to us in bx
 41154 0000774A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 41155                                  ep_chksum:
 41156 0000774C 260305                  	add	ax,[es:di]
 41157 0000774F 83C702                  	add	di,2
 41158 00007752 E2F8                    	loop	ep_chksum
 41159                                  
 41160 00007754 5F                      	pop	di			; restore di
 41161                                  
 41162 00007755 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		 	; Q: does the check sum match
 41163 00007757 7502                    	jne	short cp_fail		; N: exit
 41164                                  					; Y: 
 41165 00007759 F8                      	clc	
 41166 0000775A C3                      	retn
 41167                                  
 41168                                  cp_fail:
 41169 0000775B F9                      	stc
 41170 0000775C C3                      	retn
 41171                                  
 41172                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 41173                                  ;
 41174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41175                                  ;
 41176                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 41177                                  ;
 41178                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 41179                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 41180                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 41181                                  ;
 41182                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 41183                                  ;
 41184                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 41185                                  ;90		even				; word align
 41186                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 41187                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 41188                                  ;
 41189                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 41190                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 41191                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 41192                                  ; a mov & loop.
 41193                                  ;
 41194                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 41195                                  ; ====================================
 41196                                  ;
 41197                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 41198                                  ;
 41199                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 41200                                  ; ------				--------
 41201                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 41202                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 41203                                  ;
 41204                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 41205                                  ;
 41206                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 41207                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 41208                                  ;
 41209                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 41210                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 41211                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 41212                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 41213                                  ;
 41214                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 41215                                  ;				from the program image
 41216                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 41217                                  ;
 41218                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 41219                                  ;
 41220                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41221                                  
 41222                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41223                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41224                                  
 41225                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41226                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41227                                  
 41228                                  RScanPattern1:
 41229 0000775D 000020000000400001-     	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 41229 00007766 00                 
 41230                                  
 41231                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 41232                                  
 41233                                  RScanPattern2:
 41234 00007767 8B0E100090E2FEE8        	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 41235                                  
 41236                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 41237                                  
 41238                                  RScanPattern3:
 41239 0000776F 8B0E1000E2FEE8          	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 41240                                  
 41241                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 41242                                  
 41243                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41244                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41245                                  
 41246                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41247                                  ;
 41248                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 41249                                  ;
 41250                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41251                                  
 41252                                  RationalPatch:
 41253 00007776 FC                      	cld
 41254 00007777 50                      	push	ax
 41255 00007778 53                      	push	bx
 41256 00007779 51                      	push	cx
 41257 0000777A 52                      	push	dx
 41258 0000777B 56                      	push	si
 41259 0000777C 57                      	push	di
 41260 0000777D 06                      	push	es
 41261 0000777E 1E                      	push	ds			; we use all of them
 41262 0000777F BF0A00                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 41263 00007782 0E                      	push	cs
 41264 00007783 1F                      	pop	ds
 41265                                  	
 41266 00007784 BE[5D77]                	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 41267                                  	;mov	cx,10
 41268 00007787 B90A00                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 41269 0000778A F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 41270 0000778C 754A                    	jne	short rpexit
 41271 0000778E 26A10000                	mov	ax,[es:0]
 41272 00007792 3D5C01                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 41273 00007795 7241                    	jb	short rpexit
 41274 00007797 3D7F01                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version
 41275 0000779A 773C                    	ja	short rpexit
 41276                                  
 41277 0000779C E85A00                  	call	VerifyVersion
 41278 0000779F 7537                    	jne	short rpexit
 41279                                  
 41280 000077A1 268B0E1600              	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 41281 000077A6 81E90002                	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 41282                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 41283 000077AA 268E062000              	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 41284 000077AF BE[6777]                	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 41285                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 41286 000077B2 BA0800                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 41287 000077B5 E82900                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 41288 000077B8 740B                    	jz	short rpfound
 41289                                  
 41290 000077BA BE[6F77]                	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 41291                                  	;mov	dx,15
 41292 000077BD BA0F00                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 41293 000077C0 E81E00                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 41294 000077C3 7513                    	jnz	short rpexit
 41295                                  
 41296                                  rpfound:
 41297                                  	
 41298                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 41299                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 41300                                  
 41301 000077C5 B09A                    	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 41302 000077C7 AA                      	stosb
 41303 000077C8 B8[1612]                	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 41304 000077CB AB                      	stosw
 41305 000077CC 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss
 41306 000077CE AB                      	stosw
 41307 000077CF 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 41308 000077D1 83E906                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 41309 000077D4 B090                    	mov	al,90h
 41310 000077D6 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 41311                                  rpexit:
 41312 000077D8 1F                      	pop	ds
 41313 000077D9 07                      	pop	es
 41314 000077DA 5F                      	pop	di
 41315 000077DB 5E                      	pop	si
 41316 000077DC 5A                      	pop	dx
 41317 000077DD 59                      	pop	cx
 41318 000077DE 5B                      	pop	bx
 41319 000077DF 58                      	pop	ax
 41320 000077E0 C3                      	retn
 41321                                  
 41322                                  ; M020 END
 41323                                  
 41324                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41325                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41326                                  
 41327                                  ; DOSCODE:B6D8h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41328                                  
 41329                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41330                                  ;
 41331                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 41332                                  ;
 41333                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 41334                                  ;
 41335                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 41336                                  ;
 41337                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41338                                  
 41339                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 41340                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41341 000077E1 BF0002                  	mov	di,200h
 41342                                  ;ScanCodeSeq_di:
 41343 000077E4 51                      	push	cx
 41344 000077E5 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx
 41345 000077E7 41                      	inc	cx
 41346                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41347                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41348                                  	;mov	di,200h
 41349                                  scsagain:
 41350 000077E8 56                      	push	si
 41351 000077E9 57                      	push	di
 41352 000077EA 51                      	push	cx
 41353 000077EB 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 41354 000077ED F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 41355 000077EF 59                      	pop	cx
 41356 000077F0 5F                      	pop	di
 41357 000077F1 5E                      	pop	si
 41358 000077F2 7403                    	je	short scsfound
 41359 000077F4 47                      	inc	di
 41360 000077F5 E2F1                    	loop	scsagain
 41361                                  scsfound:
 41362 000077F7 59                      	pop	cx
 41363                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 41364 000077F8 C3                      	retn
 41365                                  
 41366                                  
 41367                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41368                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41369                                  
 41370                                  ; DOSCODE:B6F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41371                                  
 41372                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41373                                  ;
 41374                                  ; VerifyVersion
 41375                                  ;
 41376                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 41377                                  ; from ES:2A.
 41378                                  ;
 41379                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 41380                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 41381                                  ;
 41382                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41383                                  
 41384                                  VerifyVersion:
 41385 000077F9 268B362A00              	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 41386                                  					;  in ascii
 41387 000077FE B30A                    	mov	bl,10
 41388 00007800 83C603                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 41389                                  
 41390 00007803 E80E00                  	call	VVDigit
 41391 00007806 75F0                    	jne	short vvexit
 41392 00007808 E80900                  	call	VVDigit
 41393 0000780B 75EB                    	jne	short vvexit
 41394 0000780D 26803C2E                	cmp	byte [es:si],'.' ; 2Eh
 41395 00007811 75E5                    	jne	short vvexit
 41396 00007813 4E                      	dec	si
 41397                                  	;call	VVDigit
 41398                                  	; 18/12/2022
 41399                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 41400                                  ;vvexit:
 41401                                  	;retn
 41402                                  VVDigit:
 41403 00007814 F6F3                    	div	bl
 41404 00007816 80C430                  	add	ah,'0' ; 30h
 41405 00007819 4E                      	dec	si
 41406 0000781A 26386401                	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 41407 0000781E B400                    	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 41408 00007820 C3                      	retn

 41410                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41411                                  ;
 41412                                  ;	M068
 41413                                  ;
 41414                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 41415                                  ;
 41416                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 41417                                  ;
 41418                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 41419                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 41420                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 41421                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 41422                                  ;
 41423                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 41424                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 41425                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 41426                                  ;				to the user. 
 41427                                  ;
 41428                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 41429                                  ;
 41430                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41431                                  
 41432                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41433                                  
 41434                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 41435                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 41436                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 41437                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 41438                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 41439                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 41440                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 41441                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 41442                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 41443                                  
 41444                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41445                                  
 41446                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41447                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41448                                  
 41449                                  CPScanPattern:
 41450 00007821 89264801                	db	89h,26h,48h,01h		 ; mov [148],sp
 41451 00007825 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 41452 00007829 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 41453 0000782F 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 41454 00007833 B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 41455 00007836 BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 41456                                  
 41457                                  CPSPlen	EQU $ - CPScanPattern
 41458                                  
 41459                                  ; DOSCODE:BA12h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41460                                  ; DOSCODE:B734h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41461                                  
 41462                                  IsCopyProt:
 41463 00007839 813E1B014353            	cmp	word [CPID1Offset],ID1
 41464 0000783F 752D                    	jne	short CP_done
 41465                                  
 41466 00007841 813E73014450            	cmp	word [CPID2Offset],ID2
 41467 00007847 7525                    	jne	short CP_done
 41468                                  
 41469 00007849 813E460113F4            	cmp	word [CPID3Offset],ID3
 41470 0000784F 751D                    	jne	short CP_done
 41471                                  
 41472 00007851 813E24010080            	cmp	word [CPID4Offset],ID4
 41473 00007857 7515                    	jne	short CP_done
 41474                                  
 41475 00007859 0E                      	push	cs
 41476 0000785A 07                      	pop	es
 41477 0000785B BF[2178]                	mov	di,CPScanPattern	; es:di -> Pattern to find
 41478                                  
 41479 0000785E BE7501                  	mov	si,CPStartOffset	; ds:si -> possible location 
 41480                                  					; of pattern
 41481                                  
 41482 00007861 B91800                  	mov	cx,CPSPlen ; 24		; cx = length of pattern
 41483 00007864 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 41484 00007866 7506                    	jnz	short CP_done
 41485                                  
 41486 00007868 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; M071
 41487                                  CP_done:
 41488 0000786E C3                      	retn

 41554                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 41555                                  DOSINIT:
 41556                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 41557                                  	;
 41558                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 41559                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 41560                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 41561                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)

 41564                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 41565

 42388                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42389                                  ;
 42390                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 42391                                  ;
 42392                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 42393                                  ;
 42394                                  ;	USED:	none
 42395                                  ;
 42396                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42397                                  
 42398                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 42399                                  ;
 42400                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 42401                                  ;
 42402 00007B73 50                      	push	ax
 42403                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 42404 00007B74 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 42405 00007B77 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 42406                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 42407                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 42408                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 42409 00007B79 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 42410 00007B7B 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 42411                                  ;
 42412                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 42413                                  ; need to call it later.
 42414                                  ;
 42415 00007B7D 53                      	push	bx
 42416 00007B7E 52                      	push	dx
 42417 00007B7F 1E                      	push	ds
 42418 00007B80 06                      	push	es
 42419                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 42420 00007B81 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 42421 00007B84 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 42422                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 42423                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 42424                                  
 42425 00007B86 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42426                                  
 42427 00007B8B 891E[6311]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 42428 00007B8F 8C06[6511]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 42429                                  cXMMexit:
 42430 00007B93 F8                      	clc
 42431 00007B94 07                      	pop	es
 42432 00007B95 1F                      	pop	ds
 42433 00007B96 5A                      	pop	dx
 42434 00007B97 5B                      	pop	bx
 42435 00007B98 58                      	pop	ax
 42436 00007B99 C3                      	retn				; done
 42437                                  ;
 42438                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 42439                                  ;
 42440                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 42441 00007B9A F9                      	stc
 42442 00007B9B 58                      	pop	ax
 42443 00007B9C C3                      	retn

 42445                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42446                                  ;
 42447                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 42448                                  ;
 42449                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 42450                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 42451                                  ;
 42452                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 42453                                  ;		   if AX =0
 42454                                  ;		      if first entry
 42455                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 42456                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 42457                                  ;		      else
 42458                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 42459                                  ;
 42460                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 42461                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES	
 42462                                  ;
 42463                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 42464                                  ;
 42465                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 42466                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42467                                  
 42468 00007B9D 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 42469                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 42470                                  
 42471                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 42472                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 42473                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 42474                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 42475                                  
 42476                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 42477 00007B9E 1E                      	push	ds
 42478                                  
 42479 00007B9F 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42480                                  
 42481 00007BA4 E8B500                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 42482                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 42483                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42484                                  	; cx = 0
 42485 00007BA7 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 42486                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 42487 00007BA9 756C                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 42488                                  
 42489                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42490 00007BAB 2E380E[9D7B]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 42491                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this 
 42492 00007BB0 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 42493                                  					;    segment in ES
 42494                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub 
 42495 00007BB2 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 42496 00007BB4 E86D00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 42497 00007BB7 E8EC00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors 
 42498                                  					; with those in the stub.
 42499                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42500                                  	; cx = 0
 42501                                  second_entry:
 42502 00007BBA 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; patch the stub with segment in es
 42503                                  
 42504                                  	;mov	di,OFFSET DOSDATA:DOSINTTABLE
 42505                                  	;mov	di,1062h	; (same table addr for MSDOS 5.0 and MSDOS 6.21)
 42506 00007BBC BF[6210]                	mov	di,DOSINTTABLE
 42507                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42508                                  	; cx = 0
 42509                                  	;mov	cx,9
 42510 00007BBF B109                    	mov	cl,9
 42511 00007BC1 1E                      	push	ds			
 42512 00007BC2 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 42513                                  
 42514                                  dosinttabloop:
 42515 00007BC3 83C702                  	add	di,2
 42516 00007BC6 AB                      	stosw
 42517 00007BC7 E2FA                    	loop	dosinttabloop	
 42518                                  
 42519                                  ; For ROMDOS, this routine will only be called when the DOS wants to
 42520                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS
 42521                                  
 42522                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 42523 00007BC9 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; Q: is the DOS running in the HMA
 42524 00007BCC 724E                    	jb	short sr_done		; N: done
 42525                                  ;endif
 42526 00007BCE E8A2FF                  	call	check_XMM		; Y: set up the XMS entry point
 42527 00007BD1 7249                    	jc	short sr_done		; failed to set up XMS do not do
 42528                                  					; A20 toggling in the stub.
 42529                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42530                                  	; cx = 0
 42531 00007BD3 E84B01                  	call	patch_in_nops		; enable the stub to check A20 state
 42532                                  ; M021-
 42533                                  	;mov	byte [1211h],1
 42534 00007BD6 C606[1112]01            	mov	byte [DosHasHMA],1	; set flag telling DOS control of HMA 
 42535                                  				
 42536                                  					; set pointer to the routine that 
 42537                                  					; patches buggy exepacked code.
 42538                                  	;mov	[FixExePatch],offset DOSCODE:ExePatch
 42539 00007BDB C706[1212][3976]        	mov	word [FixExePatch],ExePatch
 42540                                  					; M068: set pointer to the routine 
 42541                                  					; M068: that detects copy protected
 42542                                  					; M068: apps
 42543                                  	;mov	[ChkCopyProt],offset DOSCODE:IsCopyProt
 42544 00007BE1 C706[6100][3978]        	mov	word [ChkCopyProt],IsCopyProt
 42545                                  
 42546                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDF1h
 42547                                  
 42548                                  ;	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42549                                  ;
 42550                                  ;; M020 - begin
 42551                                  ;
 42552                                  ;	call	WhatCPUType
 42553                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 42554                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42555                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 42556                                  ;	;mov	[RationalPatchPtr],offset DOSCODE:RationalPatch
 42557                                  ;	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 42558                                  ;
 42559                                  ;; M020 - end
 42560                                  ;
 42561                                  ;	jmp	short sr_done
 42562                                  ;
 42563                                  ;patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 42564                                  ;	mov	ax,es
 42565                                  ;	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42566                                  ;					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42567                                  ;					; offsets as they have been already
 42568                                  ;					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42569                                  ;					; DOSINIT.
 42570                                  ;sr_done:
 42571                                  ;	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 42572                                  ;	pop	ds
 42573                                  ;	retf	; ! far return !
 42574                                  
 42575                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42576                                  ;
 42577                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 42578                                  ;
 42579                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 42580                                  ;
 42581                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 42582                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 42583                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 42584                                  ;
 42585                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 42586                                  ;
 42587                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42588                                  
 42589                                  WhatCPUType:
 42590                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42591                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 42592                                  
 42593                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 42594                                  
 42595                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 42596                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 42597                                  ;
 42598                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 42599                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 42600                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 42601                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 42602                                  
 42603                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42604                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 42605                                  
 42606                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 42607 00007BE7 9C                      	pushf
 42608 00007BE8 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 42609 00007BE9 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 42610                                  
 42611 00007BEB 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 42612 00007BED 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 42613 00007BEE 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 42614 00007BEF 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 42615 00007BF0 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 42616 00007BF1 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 42617 00007BF4 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 42618 00007BF7 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 42619                                  
 42620 00007BF9 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 42621 00007BFC 50                      	push	ax
 42622 00007BFD 9D                      	popf
 42623 00007BFE 9C                      	pushf
 42624 00007BFF 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 42625 00007C00 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 42626 00007C03 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 42627                                  
 42628                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 42629 00007C05 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 42630                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 42631 00007C06 43                      	inc	bx
 42632                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 42633 00007C07 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 42634 00007C09 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 42635 00007C0A 9D                      	popf
 42636                                  	
 42637                                  	;endm
 42638                                  
 42639                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42640                                  	;retn
 42641                                  
 42642                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42643                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 42644 00007C0B 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 42645 00007C0D 750D                    	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 42646                                  					;  on 286 systems
 42647 00007C0F C706[1412][7677]        	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 42648                                  
 42649 00007C15 EB05                    	jmp	short sr_done
 42650                                  
 42651                                  patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 42652 00007C17 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 42653 00007C19 E80800                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 42654                                  					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 42655                                  					; offsets as they have been already
 42656                                  					; set to the doscode offsets at
 42657                                  					; DOSINIT.
 42658                                  sr_done:
 42659 00007C1C 2EC606[9D7B]01          	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 42660 00007C22 1F                      	pop	ds
 42661 00007C23 CB                      	retf	; ! far return !
 42662                                  
 42663                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42664                                  ;
 42665                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_vec_segments
 42666                                  ;
 42667                                  ; Inputs	 : ax -> has segment address to patch in
 42668                                  ;		   ds -> DOSDATA
 42669                                  ;

 42671                                  ;			
 42672                                  ;			0,20-28,3a-3f
 42673                                  ;

 42676                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42677

 42680 00007C24 06                      	push	es

 42687

 42689

 42701                                  	;loop	ps_set1
 42702

 42704 00007C33 AB                      	stosw	; int 21h segment
 42705                                  	;inc	di
 42706                                  	;inc	di
 42707

 42709 00007C34 83C706                  	add	di,6 ; *
 42710

 42713                                  
 42714                                  					; set vectors 25-28 and 2a-3f 
 42715                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42716                                  	;mov	cx,4			; set 4 segments
 42717                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42718 00007C3B B104                    	mov	cl,4
 42719                                  ps_set2:
 42720 00007C3D AB                      	stosw				
 42721                                  	;add	di,2
 42722                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42723 00007C3E 47                      	inc	di
 42724 00007C3F 47                      	inc	di
 42725 00007C40 E2FB                    	loop	ps_set2
 42726

 42728                                  					;   already be set.
 42729                                  	; 04/11/2022
 42730                                  	;mov	cx,6			; set 6 segs (skip 2 between each)
 42731                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42733                                  ps_set3:
 42734 00007C47 AB                      	stosw
 42735                                  	;add	di,2
 42736                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42737 00007C48 47                      	inc	di
 42738 00007C49 47                      	inc	di
 42739 00007C4A E2FB                    	loop	ps_set3
 42740                                  
 42741                                  ; 30h & 31H is the CPM call entry point whose segment address is set up by
 42742                                  ; below. So skip it.
 42743                                  
 42744 00007C4C 83C708                  	add	di,8			; skip vector 30h & 31h 
 42745

 42748                                  	; 17/12/2022

 42753                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42754 00007C52 47                      	inc	di

 42756 00007C54 E2FB                    	loop	ps_set4
 42757

 42762                                  ;endif

 42764 00007C56 26A3C300                	mov	[es:ENTRYPOINT+3],ax

 42768 00007C5B C3                      	retn

 43010                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43011                                  ;
 43012                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 43013                                  ;
 43014                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 43015                                  ;
 43016                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 43017                                  ;
 43018                                  ;	Description:
 43019                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 43020                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 43021                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 43022                                  ;
 43023                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43024                                  
 43025                                  	; 04/11/2022
 43026                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43027                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 43028                                  
 43029                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 43030                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 43031                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 43032                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 43033                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 43034                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 43035                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 43036                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 43037                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 43038 00007D11 [8A10]                  	dw	i0patch
 43039 00007D13 [9410]                  	dw	i20patch
 43040 00007D15 [9E10]                  	dw	i21patch
 43041 00007D17 [A810]                  	dw	i25patch
 43042 00007D19 [B210]                  	dw	i26patch
 43043 00007D1B [BC10]                  	dw	i27patch
 43044 00007D1D [C610]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 43045 00007D1F [D010]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 43046                                  
 43047                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 43048                                  
 43049                                  patch_in_nops:
 43050 00007D21 50                      	push	ax
 43051 00007D22 56                      	push	si
 43052 00007D23 BE[117D]                	mov	si,patch_table
 43053 00007D26 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 43054                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43055                                  	; cx = 0
 43056                                  	;mov	cx,8
 43057                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 43058 00007D29 B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 43059                                  pin_loop:
 43060 00007D2B 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 43061 00007D2E AB                      	stosw
 43062                                  	;add	si,2
 43063                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43064 00007D2F 46                      	inc	si
 43065 00007D30 46                      	inc	si
 43066 00007D31 E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop

 43257                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 43258                                  ;;
 43259                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 43260                                  ;;
 43261                                  ;;	on return:
 43262                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 43263                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 43264                                  ;;
 43265                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 43266                                  ;;
 43267                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43268                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 43269                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 43270                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 43271                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 43272                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 43273                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 43274                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 43275                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 43276                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 43277                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 43278                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 43279                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 43280                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 43281                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 43282                                  ;;
 43283                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 43491                                  ;============================================================================
 43492                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 43493                                  ;============================================================================
 43494                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 43495                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 43496                                  
 43497                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 43498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43499                                  
 43500                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 43501                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 43502                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 43503                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 43504                                  ;
 43505                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 43506                                  ; describing that data item.
 43507                                  
 43508                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43509                                  
 43510                                  ;
 43511                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 43512                                  ;
 43513                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 43514                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 43515                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 43516                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 43517                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 43518                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 43519                                  ;
 43520                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 43521                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 43522                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 43523                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 43524                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 43525                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 43526                                  ;   as EOF).
 43527                                  
 43528                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 43529                                  
 43530                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 43531                                  
 43532                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 43533 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 43534 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 43535 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 43536                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 43537 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 43538                                  
 43539                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 43540                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 43541                                  ; console.
 43542                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 43543 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 43544 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 43545                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 43546 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 43547 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 43548                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 43549 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 43550 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off

 43755                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 43756                                  ;============================================================================
 43757                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 43758                                  
 43759                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 43760                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 43761                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 43762                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 43763                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 43764                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 43765                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 43766                                  ; **********************************************************
 43767                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 43768                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 43769                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 43770                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 43771                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 43772                                  ; **********************************************************	
 43773                                  
 43774                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 43775                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43776                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 43777                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 43778                                  
 43779                                  ; 	ORG     0
 43780                                  
 43781                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 43782                                  
 43783                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 43784                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 43785 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 43786 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 43787                                  
 43788                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 43789                                  
 43790                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 43791                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 43792 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 43793                                  RENBUF:	
 43794 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 43795                                  
 43796                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 43797                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 43798 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 43799                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 43800 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 43801                                  
 43802                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 43803                                   
 43804                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 43805                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 43806                                  
 43807                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 43808

 43810                                  
 43811                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 43812                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 43813                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 43814                                  
 43815                                  NAME1:	
 43816 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 43817                                  NAME2:
 43818 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 43819                                  DESTSTART:

 43822                                  	;times	5  db	0

 44028                                  ; DOSDATA:0AA0h 
 44029                                   
 44030                                  ; patch space for Boca folks.
 44031                                  ; Say What????!!! This does NOT go into the swappable area!
 44032                                  ; NOTE: We include the decl of ibmpatch in ms-dos even though it is not needed.
 44033                                  ;       This allows the REDIRector to work on either IBM or MS-DOS.
 44034                                   
 44035                                  IBMPATCH: ; label byte
 44036                                  PRINTER_FLAG:
 44037 00000AA0 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] status of PRINT utility
 44038                                  VOLCHNG_FLAG:
 44039 00000AA1 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] true if volume label created
 44040                                  VIRTUAL_OPEN:
 44041 00000AA2 00                      	db	0		; [SYSTEM] non-zero if we opened a virtual file
 44042                                   
 44043                                  ; Following 4 variables moved to MSDATA.asm from MSTABLE.asm (P4986)
 44044                                  
 44045                                  FSeek_drive:
 44046 00000AA3 00                      	db	0		;AN000; fastseek drive #
 44047                                  FSeek_firclus:
 44048 00000AA4 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek first cluster #
 44049                                  FSeek_logclus:
 44050 00000AA6 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek logical cluster #
 44051                                  FSeek_logsave:
 44052 00000AA8 0000                    	dw	0		;AN000; fastseek returned log clus #
 44053                                  
 44054                                  ; DOSDATA:0AAAh
 44055                                  
 44056                                  TEMP_DOSLOC:
 44057 00000AAA FFFF                    	dw	-1		;stores the temporary location of dos
 44058                                  				;at SYSINIT time.
 44059                                  SWAP_END:  ; LABEL   BYTE
 44060                                   
 44061                                  ; THE FOLLOWING BYTE MUST BE HERE, IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING SWAP_END. IT CANNOT
 44062                                  ; BE USED. If the size of the swap data area is ODD, it will be rounded up
 44063                                  ; to include this byte.
 44064                                   
 44065 00000AAC 00                      	db	0

 44224                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 44225                                  
 44226                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44227                                  ;
 44228                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 44229                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 44230                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 44231                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 44232                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 44233                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44234                                  ; Example:
 44235                                  
 44236                                  MAP_CASE:
 44237                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 44238                                  
 44239 00000CF5 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 44240 00000CF7 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 44241 00000CF9 CB                      	RETF
 44242                                  Map1:
 44243 00000CFA 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 44244 00000CFC 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 44245 00000CFD 53                      	PUSH	BX
 44246 00000CFE BB[AF0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 44247                                  FINISH:
 44248 00000D01 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 44249 00000D02 1F                      	POP	DS
 44250 00000D03 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 44251 00000D04 5B                      	POP	BX
 44252 00000D05 1F                      	POP	DS
 44253                                  L_RET:	
 44254 00000D06 CB                      	RETF
 44255                                  
 44256                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 44257                                  
 44258                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44259

 44502                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 44503                                  ; 
 44504                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 44505                                  ;
 44506                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 44507                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 44508                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 44509                                  ;
 44510                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 44511                                  ;
 44512                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 44513                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 44514                                  ;
 44515                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 44516                                  ;
 44517                                  ;############################################################################
 44518                                  
 44519                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 44520                                  
 44521                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44522                                  
 44523                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44524                                  ;
 44525                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 44526                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 44527                                  ;
 44528                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 44529                                  ;
 44530                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 44531                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 44532                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 44533                                  ;
 44534                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44535                                  
 44536                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 44537                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 44538                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 44539                                  ;ELSE
 44540                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 44541                                  ;ENDIF
 44542                                  ;ENDM
 44543
