 44822                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44823                                  ; 04/11/2022
 44824                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 44825                                  
 44826                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44827                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 44828                                  ;
 44829                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the 
 44830                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data) 
 44831                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 44832                                  ;
 44833                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 44834                                  ;
 44835                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 44836                                  ;
 44837                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44838                                  
 44839 00001044 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 44840 0000104A 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 44841 0000104C 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 44842 00001051 CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 44843                                  
 44844                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44845                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 44846                                  ;
 44847                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 44848                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in 
 44849                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 44850                                  ;
 44851                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44852                                  
 44853 00001053 803E200300              	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 44854 00001058 7537                    	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 44855 0000105A BCA00A                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 44856                                  
 44857                                  ; DOSDATA:105Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44858                                  
 44859                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44860                                  
 44861                                  ;*** New FCB Implementation
 44862                                  ; This variable is used as a cache in the new FCB implementation to remember
 44863                                  ;the address of a local SFT that can be recycled for a regenerate operation
 44864                                  
 44865 0000105D 00000000                LocalSFT: dd	0		; 0 to indicate invalid pointer
 44866                                  
 44867                                  ;DOSDATA ENDS
 44868                                  
 44869                                  ;============================================================================
 44870                                  ; LMSTUB.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 44871                                  ;============================================================================
 44872                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 44873                                  
 44874                                  ;DOSDATA  SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 44875                                  
 44876                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44877                                  ;	Low Memory Stub for DOS when DOS runs in HMA
 44878                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44879                                  	
 44880                                  	;db	90h
 44881                                  
 44882                                  	;EVEN
 44883 00001061 90                      align 2
 44884                                  
 44885                                  ; DOSDATA:1062h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44886                                  
 44887                                  DOSINTTABLE:	; LABEL	DWORD
 44888                                  
 44889                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:DIVOV 		, 0
 44890                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:QUIT 		, 0
 44891                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:COMMAND		, 0
 44892                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:ABSDRD		, 0
 44893                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:ABSDWRT		, 0
 44894                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:Stay_resident	, 0
 44895                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:INT2F		, 0
 44896                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:CALL_ENTRY	, 0
 44897                                  	;DW	OFFSET DOSCODE:IRETT		, 0
 44898                                  	
 44899 00001062 [5A53]0000              	dw	DIVOV 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+0
 44900 00001066 [1B03]0000              	dw	QUIT 		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+4	
 44901 0000106A [4703]0000              	dw	COMMAND		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+8
 44902 0000106E [7A05]0000              	dw	ABSDRD		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+12
 44903 00001072 [0106]0000              	dw	ABSDWRT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+16
 44904 00001076 [A862]0000              	dw	STAY_RESIDENT	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+20
 44905 0000107A [5007]0000              	dw	INT2F		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+24
 44906 0000107E [2203]0000              	dw	CALL_ENTRY	, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+28
 44907 00001082 [2103]0000              	dw	IRETT		, 0  ; DOSINTTABLE+32
 44908                                  
 44909 00001086 0000                    SS_Save: dw	0		; save user's stack segment
 44910 00001088 0000                    SP_Save: dw	0		; save user's stack offset
 44911                                  
 44912                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44913                                  ;
 44914                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 44915                                  ;
 44916                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts 
 44917                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the 
 44918                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 44919                                  ;
 44920                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 44921                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 44922                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 44923                                  ;	   4. else 
 44924                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 44925                                  ;	   6. endif
 44926                                  ;	7. else
 44927                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 44928                                  ;	9. endif
 44929                                  ;
 44930                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44931                                  
 44932                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44933                                  
 44934                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44935                                  
 44936                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44937                                  ;
 44938                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 44939                                  ;
 44940                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44941                                  
 44942                                  ldivov:
 44943                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44944                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44945                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44946                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44947                                  i0patch:
 44948 0000108A EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont	
 44949                                  
 44950 0000108C E8E000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44951                                  divov_cont:
 44952 0000108F 2EFF2E[6210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 44953                                  
 44954                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44955                                  ;
 44956                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 44957                                  ;
 44958                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 44959                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 44960                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 44961                                  ; will be restored then.
 44962                                  ;
 44963                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44964                                  
 44965                                  lquit:
 44966                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44967                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44968                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44969                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44970                                  i20patch:
 44971 00001094 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont	
 44972                                  
 44973 00001096 E8D600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44974                                  quit_cont:
 44975 00001099 2EFF2E[6610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 44976                                  
 44977                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44978                                  ;
 44979                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 44980                                  ;
 44981                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44982                                  
 44983                                  lcommand:
 44984                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 44985                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 44986                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 44987                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 44988                                  i21patch:
 44989 0000109E EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont	
 44990                                  
 44991 000010A0 E8CC00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 44992                                  command_cont:
 44993 000010A3 2EFF2E[6A10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 44994                                  
 44995                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44996                                  ;
 44997                                  ; INT 25 
 44998                                  ;
 44999                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45000                                  
 45001                                  labsdrd:
 45002                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45003                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45004                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45005                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45006                                  i25patch:
 45007 000010A8 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont	
 45008                                  
 45009 000010AA E8C200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45010                                  absdrd_cont:
 45011 000010AD 2EFF2E[6E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 45012                                  
 45013                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45014                                  ;
 45015                                  ; INT 26
 45016                                  ;
 45017                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 45018                                  
 45019                                  labsdwrt:
 45020                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45021                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45022                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45023                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45024                                  i26patch:
 45025 000010B2 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont	
 45026                                  
 45027 000010B4 E8B800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45028                                  absdwrt_cont:
 45029 000010B7 2EFF2E[7210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 45030                                  
 45031                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45032                                  ;
 45033                                  ; INT 27
 45034                                  ;
 45035                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 45036                                  
 45037                                  lstay_resident:
 45038                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45039                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45040                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45041                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45042                                  i27patch:
 45043 000010BC EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont	
 45044                                  
 45045 000010BE E8AE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45046                                  sr_cont:
 45047 000010C1 2EFF2E[7610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 45048                                  
 45049                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45050                                  ;
 45051                                  ; INT 2f
 45052                                  ;
 45053                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45054                                  
 45055                                  lint2f:
 45056                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45057                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45058                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45059                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45060                                  i2fpatch:
 45061 000010C6 EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont	
 45062                                  
 45063 000010C8 E8A400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45064                                  int2f_cont:
 45065 000010CB 2EFF2E[7A10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 45066                                  
 45067                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45068                                  ;
 45069                                  ; CPM entry
 45070                                  ;
 45071                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45072                                  
 45073                                  lcall_entry:
 45074                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 45075                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 45076                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 45077                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 45078                                  cpmpatch:
 45079 000010D0 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont	
 45080                                  
 45081 000010D2 E89A00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45082                                  callentry_cont:
 45083 000010D5 2EFF2E[7E10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 45084                                  
 45085                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45086                                  
 45087                                  lirett:
 45088 000010DA CF                      	iret
 45089                                  
 45090                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45091                                  ;
 45092                                  ; LowIntXX:
 45093                                  ;
 45094                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 45095                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 45096                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 45097                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 45098                                  ;
 45099                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 45100                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 45101                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 45102                                  ;
 45103                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 45104                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 45105                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 45106                                  ;
 45107                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45108                                  
 45109 000010DB 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 45110 000010DF 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 45111 000010E3 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 45112                                  
 45113                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 45114                                  LowInt23:
 45115                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45116                                  					; the stack
 45117 000010E7 2E8F06[DB10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 45118 000010EC 2E8F06[DD10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 45119                                  
 45120 000010F1 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 45121                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45122                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45123                                  
 45124 000010F3 E87900                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 45125                                  
 45126 000010F6 2EFF2E[DB10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 45127                                  
 45128                                  
 45129                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 45130                                  LowInt24:
 45131                                  					; save the return address that is on
 45132                                  					; the stack
 45133 000010FB 2E8F06[DF10]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 45134 00001100 2E8F06[E110]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 45135                                  
 45136 00001105 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 45137                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45138                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45139                                  
 45140 00001107 E86500                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45141                                  
 45142 0000110A 2EFF2E[DF10]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 45143                                  
 45144                                  
 45145                                   
 45146                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 45147                                  LowInt28:
 45148 0000110F CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 45149                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 45150                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 45151                                  
 45152 00001111 E85B00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF	
 45153                                  
 45154 00001114 CB                      	retf
 45155                                  
 45156                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45157                                  
 45158                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45159                                  ;
 45160                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 45161                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 45162                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 45163                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 45164                                  ;
 45165                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 45166                                  
 45167                                  disa20_xfer:
 45168 00001115 E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 45169                                  
 45170                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 45171                                  
 45172                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 45173                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 45174                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 45175                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 45176                                  
 45177 00001118 FA                      	cli
 45178 00001119 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 45179                                  
 45180 0000111F 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 45181 00001121 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 45182 00001123 FB                      	sti
 45183                                  
 45184 00001124 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 45185 00001125 56                      	push	SI
 45186 00001126 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 45187 00001128 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 45188 0000112A 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 45189 0000112C CB                      	retf
 45190                                  
 45191                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45192                                  ;
 45193                                  ; M003:
 45194                                  ;
 45195                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 45196                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning 
 45197                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 45198                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for 
 45199                                  ; more info.	
 45200                                  ;
 45201                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that 
 45202                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's 
 45203                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 45204                                  ;
 45205                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45206                                  
 45207                                  disa20_iret:
 45208 0000112D E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 45209 00001130 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 45210 00001134 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 45211 00001138 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 45212 0000113C 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 45213                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 45214 0000113E 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 45215 00001141 A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 45216 00001144 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 45217 00001147 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 45218 0000114A A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 45219                                  
 45220 0000114D 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 45221 0000114E 5B                      	pop	BX
 45222 0000114F 59                      	pop	CX
 45223 00001150 5A                      	pop	DX
 45224 00001151 5E                      	pop	SI
 45225 00001152 5F                      	pop	DI
 45226 00001153 5D                      	pop	BP
 45227 00001154 1F                      	pop	DS
 45228 00001155 07                      	pop	ES
 45229 00001156 CF                      	iret
 45230                                  
 45231                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45232                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line			      
 45233                                  ;									      
 45234                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in 	      
 45235                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45236                                  ;									      
 45237                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA				      
 45238                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled					      
 45239                                  ;	USES	NOTHING					      
 45240                                  ;									      
 45241                                  ;**************************************************************************
 45242                                  
 45243                                  XMMDisableA20:
 45244 00001157 53                      	push	bx
 45245 00001158 50                      	push	ax
 45246                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 45247 00001159 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 45248 0000115B 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45249 00001160 58                      	pop	ax
 45250 00001161 5B                      	pop	bx
 45251 00001162 C3                      	retn
 45252                                  
 45253                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 45254                                  
 45255                                  XMMcontrol:
 45256 00001163 00000000                	dd	0
 45257                                  
 45258                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45259                                  ;
 45260                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 45261                                  ;									      
 45262                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in		 	      
 45263                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.					      
 45264                                  ;									      
 45265                                  ;	ENTRY: none		
 45266                                  ;
 45267                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 45268                                  ;		
 45269                                  ; 	USES : NONE								      
 45270                                  ;									      
 45271                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45272                                  
 45273                                  LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 45274 00001167 8000                    	dw	00080h
 45275 00001169 0000                    	dw	00000h
 45276                                  
 45277                                  HighMemory:	; label dword
 45278 0000116B 9000                    	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 45279 0000116D FFFF                    	dw	0FFFFh
 45280                                  
 45281                                  EnsureA20ON:
 45282 0000116F 9C                      	pushf
 45283 00001170 1E                      	push    ds
 45284 00001171 06                      	push	es
 45285 00001172 51                      	push	cx
 45286 00001173 56                      	push	si
 45287 00001174 57                      	push	di
 45288                                  
 45289 00001175 2EC536[6711]            	lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 45290 0000117A 2EC43E[6B11]            	les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 45291 0000117F B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 45292 00001182 FC                      	cld
 45293 00001183 F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 45294                                  
 45295 00001185 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 45296                                  EA20_RET:
 45297 00001187 5F                      	pop	di
 45298 00001188 5E                      	pop	si
 45299 00001189 59                      	pop	cx
 45300 0000118A 07                      	pop	es
 45301 0000118B 1F                      	pop	ds
 45302 0000118C 9D                      	popf
 45303 0000118D C3                      	retn
 45304                                  
 45305                                  EA20_OFF:
 45306                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 45307                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 45308                                  
 45309 0000118E 53                      	push	bx
 45310 0000118F 50                      	push	ax
 45311                                  
 45312 00001190 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 45313 00001192 2EA3[8610]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 45314 00001196 2E8926[8810]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 45315 0000119B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 45316 0000119D 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45317 0000119F BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 45318                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 45319                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 45320 000011A2 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 45321 000011A4 2EFF1E[6311]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 45322 000011A9 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 45323 000011AB 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 45324                                  
 45325 000011AD 2EA1[8610]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 45326 000011B1 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 45327 000011B3 2E8B26[8810]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 45328                                  
 45329 000011B8 58                      	pop	ax
 45330 000011B9 5B                      	pop	bx
 45331                                  
 45332 000011BA EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 45333                                  
 45334                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 45335 000011BC B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 45336 000011BE CD10                    	int	10h
 45337 000011C0 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 45338 000011C2 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 45339 000011C4 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 45340 000011C6 B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 45341 000011C8 CD10                    	int	10h
 45342                                  XMMcont:
 45343 000011CA B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 45344 000011CC 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 45345 000011CE CD10                    	int	10h
 45346                                  	
 45347 000011D0 BE[B812]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 45348 000011D3 0E                      	push	cs
 45349 000011D4 1F                      	pop	ds
 45350 000011D5 FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 45351                                  XMMprnt:
 45352 000011D6 AC                      	lodsb
 45353 000011D7 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 45354 000011D9 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 45355 000011DB B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 45356 000011DD BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 45357 000011E0 CD10                    	int	10h
 45358 000011E2 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 45359                                  
 45360                                  XMMStall:
 45361 000011E4 FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 45362 000011E5 EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 45363                                  
 45364                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45365                                  
 45366                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45367                                  
 45368                                  ; retrodos4.s ; offset 0Ch in BIOS segment (0070h)
 45369                                  ALTAH	equ 0Ch
 45370                                  
 45371                                  ;This has been put in for WIN386 2.XX support. The format of the instance 
 45372                                  ;table was different for this. Segments will be patched in at init time.
 45373                                  
 45374                                  OldInstanceJunk:
 45375 000011E7 7000                    	dw	70h	;segment of BIOS
 45376 000011E9 0000                    	dw	0	;indicate stacks in SYSINIT area
 45377 000011EB 0600                    	dw	6	;5 instance items
 45378                                  
 45379                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:contpos, 2
 45380                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:bcon, 4
 45381                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:carpos,106h
 45382                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:charco, 1
 45383                                  	;dw	0,offset dosdata:exec_init_sp, 34               ;M032
 45384                                  	;dw	070h,offset BData:altah, 1	 ; altah byte in bios
 45385

 45396                                  ;
 45397                                  ; DosHasHMA - This flag is set by seg_reinit when the DOS actually
 45398                                  ; 	takes control of the HMA. When running, this word is a reliable
 45399                                  ;	indicator that the DOS is actually using HMA. You can't just use
 45400                                  ;	CS, because ROMDOS uses HMA with CS < F000.
 45401                                  
 45402                                  DosHasHMA:

 45404                                  FixExePatch:
 45405 00001212 0000                    	dw	0		; M012

 45407 00001214 0000                    	dw	0		; M012

 45444                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 45445                                  ;
 45446                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 45447                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 45448                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 45449                                  ;
 45450                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH 
 45451                                  ;
 45452                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!
 45453                                  ;

 45456                                  	;ORG	0122Ah
 45457                                  
 45458                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45459                                  
 45460                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 45461                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 45462                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 45463                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 45464                                  
 45465                                  ; country and code page information
 45466                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45467                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 45468 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 45469 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 45469 0000123B 53595300           
 45470                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 45471 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 45472                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45473                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 45474                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 45475                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 45476                                  ;  endif
 45477                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 45478                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 45479                                  ;  endif
 45480                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 45481                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 45482                                  ;  endif
 45483                                  ;else
 45484 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 45485                                  ;endif
 45486                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 45487 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 45488 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 45489 00001277 [AD0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 45490 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45491 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 45492 0000127C [2F0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 45493 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45494 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 45495 00001281 [B10B]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 45496 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45497 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 45498 00001286 [E10B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 45499 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 45500 0000128A 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 45501 0000128B [E30C]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 45502 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK

 45513 0000129D 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 45514 0000129F 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator

 45516 000012A3 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator

 45666                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 45667                                  ;
 45668                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 45669                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 45670                                  ;

 45672                                  ;
 45673                                  ;   DVRDRAW:

 45675                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45676                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10

 45679                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 45680                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 45681                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 45682                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 45683                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL

 45685                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H

 45690                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45691                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 45692                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 45693                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 45694                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 45695                                  ;	    POP     DS
 45696                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 45697                                  ;
 45698                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 45699                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 45700                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 45701                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 45702                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 45703                                  ;
 45704                                  ;   CRDROK:
 45705                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 45706                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 45707                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 45708                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 45709

 45735                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.

 45774                                  ;============================================================================
 45775                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 45776                                  ;============================================================================
 45777                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 45778                                  
 45779                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 45780                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 45781                                  ;
 45782                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 45783                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 45784                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 45785                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 45786                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 45787                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 45788                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 45789                                  ; to call out here.
 45790                                  ;
 45791                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 45792                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 45793                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 45794                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 45795                                  ;       
 45796                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 45797                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 45798                                  ;
 45799                                  ;Exported Functions
 45800                                  ;==================
 45801                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 45802                                  
 45803                                  ; DosData Segment
 45804                                  
 45805                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45806                                  
 45807                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45808                                  
 45809                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 45810                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 45811                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 45812                                  ; 'patch' related.
 45813                                  
 45814                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 45815                                  	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 45816                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45817                                  
 45818                                  MagicPatch:
 45819                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 45820                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 45821                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 45822                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 45823                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 45824                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 45825                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 45826                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 45827                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 45828                                  
 45829                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45830                                  
 45831                                  ;DosData Ends
 45832                                  
 45833                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 45834                                  
 45835                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45836                                  
 45837                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 45838                                  
 45839                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45840                                  
 45841                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45842                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 45843                                  
 45844                                  db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 45845                                  
 45846                                  ;align 16
 45847                                  
 45848                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 45849                                  
 45850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45851                                  
 45852                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022
 45853

 45860                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART
